0 My wife took me here on my birthday for breakfast and it was excellent.
1 The weather was perfect which made sitting outside overlooking their grounds an absolute pleasure.
2 Our waitress was excellent and our food arrived quickly on the semi-busy Saturday morning.
3 It looked like the place fills up pretty quickly so the earlier you get here the better.
4 Do yourself a favor and get their Bloody Mary.
5 It was phenomenal and simply the best I've ever had.
6 I'm pretty sure they only use ingredients from their garden and blend them fresh when you order it.
7 It was amazing.
8 While EVERYTHING on the menu looks excellent, I had the white truffle scrambled eggs vegetable skillet and it was tasty and delicious.
9 It came with 2 pieces of their griddled bread with was amazing and it absolutely made the meal complete.
10 It was the best "toast" I've ever had.
11 Anyway, I can't wait to go back!
12 I have no idea why some people give bad reviews about this place.
13 It goes to show you, you can please everyone.
14 They are probably griping about something that their own fault...there are many people like that.
15 In any case, my friend and I arrived at about 5:50 PM this past Sunday.
16 It was pretty crowded, more than I thought for a Sunday evening and thought we would have to wait forever to get a seat but they said we'll be seated when the girl comes back from seating someone else.
17 We were seated at 5:52 and the waiter came and got our drink orders.
18 Everyone was very pleasant from the host that seated us to the waiter to the server.
19 The prices were very good as well.
20 We placed our orders once we decided what we wanted at 6:02.
21 We shared the baked spaghetti calzone and the small "Here's The Beef" pizza so we can both try them.
22 The calzone was huge and we got the smallest one (personal) and got the small 11" pizza.
23 Both were awesome!
24 My friend liked the pizza better and I liked the calzone better.
25 The calzone does have a sweetish sauce but that's how I like my sauce!
26 We had to box part of the pizza to take it home and we were out the door by 6:42.
27 So, everything was great and not like these bad reviewers.
28 That goes to show you that  you have to try these things yourself because all these bad reviewers have some serious issues.
29 Rosie, Dakota, and I LOVE Chaparral Dog Park!!!
30 It's very convenient and surrounded by a lot of paths, a desert xeriscape, baseball fields, ballparks, and a lake with ducks.
31 The Scottsdale Park and Rec Dept.
32 does a wonderful job of keeping the park clean and shaded.

35 General Manager Scott Petello is a good egg!!!

146 Never having dealt with a Discount Tire in Phoenix before (only in Texas, and their service has been great all the time), I came in not knowing what kind of service to expect.
147 I was pleasantly surprised!
148 The store had a good amount of parking, and the store front was clean, open and had adequate seating around the perimeters.
149 There were already 5-6 people sitting and waiting for their cars to be finished, and 2 people waiting infront of me to see a representative.
150 All the guys working there were busy helping someone, yet were saying hello to us and reassuring they'd get to us very soon.
151 I didn't wait an unneccesary amount of time and then was helped by Wally.
152 He inspected my tires, recommended a plan of action gave me options, and we headed back into the store.
153 After I made my decision to replace 2 of the tires, he checked their stock, and unfortunately they didn't have them there.
154 BUT he called another store and had them picked up for the next morning, so I could just come back the next day to this same store and get those bad boys installed.
155 Great!
156 The prices were not as heafty (relief), and although there were a good amount of people the next day waiting for their cars to also be serviced, it took exactly the amount of time they'd told me (45 min).
157 They apologized for the wait, but no need for that!
158 The guy who helped me on the 2nd day (I'm sorry I forgot his name) was also very professional and great.
159 I recommend this store and will be bringing my car here in the future most definitely.
160 Thanks, guys!
161 TIP: If you know you need to bring your car in, you can make an appointment with them online.
162 They take walk-ins, but I believe it helps them manage their customers easier, and that in turn benefits you.

286 Beer...or Yoga?
287 Located in a small center just east of Four Peaks Brewery in Tempe (a reasonable distance from the light rail on Apache), is an amazing, classy studio for the Mind-Body connection.
288 Mr. Mustachio had decided after doing a couple yoga classes with me at the ASU gym that he loved the stretch, so pursued a class for a semester at ASU this Spring and had the pleasure of practicing with Tish Hegel.
289 After seeing his body transform to only 16.2% body fat, all his jeans get too big on him and fill out his American Apparel briefs nicely I was super jealous.
290 He raved about his teacher and I could tell he had de-stressed a lot since he started the practice.
291 Luckily, she opened up a studio recently, and it simply goregous.
292 The waiting area is filled with yoga material and a very calming space with a remodeled bathroom and dressing rooms to change if coming from work/school.
293 Not at all cheesy like the SouthWest Inst with the way too many angels imagery (creepy!).
294 But the gem is truly the practice space.
295 Hardwood floors, high ceilings, a beautiful staircase, tasteful decorations and absolutely NO MIRRORS.
296 That is right- the only person staring at my pudge rolls is my teacher and who-ever isn't focusing on their tree posture-not the entire class!
297 It really relieves a lot of stress  and helps me concentrate on how a posture feels as opposed to just looks.
298 As for Tish Hegel, she is simply outstanding-she has so many credentials, you have to read her biography for yourself.
299 She has been practicing for a loooong time, and her hands-on instruction and confident voice echoes in my ears even now (bring those shoulders down!
300 ).
301 So far, I have done:  Ashtanga Inspired Flow (pretty intense, really hurt for 3 days, would recommend after getting into yoga for a while), Sivananda (ditto),  Focus Class (did a lot of bike riding and she focused on everybody's body issues and did the sequence right then and there for us and my lower back and knees felt amazing the day after) and this morning brought my friend to Kinetic Yoga: Morning Movement and Flow, which kicked our 6am asses a little bit but we both felt amazing afterwards!
302 She does tons of modifications, is always making sure we are okay, and is just super personable.
303 I did the huge package since I didn't renew my ASU gym membership for this summer, but you can do drop-in.
304 Now for the cliched Yoga Review ending:

334 First off you have to understand that the cuts are top quality so you can order almost any steak off the menus and be dazzled by the flavor, which is fantastic to the point that adding anything to it would destroy the integrity of the taste as is.
335  I mean the meat is perfection on a plate and this needs no other explaining.
336 If with friends or even your significant other you must start with the the seafood tower, which can be order in many different ways to match your appetite and likes.
337 When presented at the table you and your guests will be blown away at the quality of the seafood and rightly so as it is brought in fresh daily.

371 After the Padres Spring Training game, we had reservations at Don & Charlie's in Scottsdale .
372 None of us had been here before and it came highly recommended by my dad.
373 As soon as you walk into Don and Charlie's your eyes start feasting on all the signed baseballs down the left wall.
374 Now everywhere you look from floor to ceiling and even the ceiling itself is covered in memorabilia and autographed items from athletes of all sports and other celebrities.
375 Besides the amazing assortment of sports artifacts, I especially like the Cactus League Beer List which pairs a beer with each city that has a team in the Cactus League.
376 Colorado = Coors Light , Texas =Shiner Bock, Chicago =Old Style, and San Diego =Stone IPA, etc.
377 Also worth mentioning is the complimentary chopped liver platter with rye bread and bagel chips they bring as soon as you are seated.
378 I had the ribs with coconut shrimp combo which was great.
379 I wasn't thrilled with the side dish: potato's au gratin which is a $2.50 upcharge.
380 They also bring a huge bowl of cole slaw with each entrée or you can choose soup which comes in a smaller bowl than the cole slaw!
381 We were too full for dessert and as we walked out, this place was packed!
382 I found myself trying to take in as much memorabilia as possible and then on one side of the crowded lobby there sat Willie Mays himself.
383 He was signing his book (or a baseball) for a $200 charitable donation to his foundation.
384 Needless to say, I 'm not bringing home any memorabilia myself!

610 He took a few cues from her, and found a great bottle of white which we drank with great glee last night.
611 This was a test for the guy behind the counter.
612 She didn't set a price limit, just said "show me your favorite."
613 He could have done what many others have in the past and shown us a $50 bottle, but instead he showed us a kick ass bottle at the $14 price point.
614 This is the mark of a good wine seller.
615 Find you what you want without bending you over on the price.
616 Yes, sometimes I want to spend $400 a bottle, but not all that often.
617 I'd rather get my drink on at the price he found, and he turned us onto a white we both REALLY liked, which is super rare as we have very different tastes.
618 We'll absolutely be going back to buy more fermented grape from this place!

621 Recently moved back to Mesa, I have been on the hunt for a place to get a good sandwich and fresh bread.
622 This place now tops my list of places in the East Valley to get a good sandwich.
623 My first sandwich was the Atlantic Haddock Provencal.
624 A sandwich made with seared, lightly breaded haddock, sliced hard-boiled egg, fresh basil, romaine lettuce, tomato, Provencal tartar sauce on a grilled Brioche roll.
625 The brioche was amazing.
626 It was light and fluffy.
627 The haddock was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of breading, and the vegetables were fresh and in perfect proportions as to not overpower the bread and haddock.
628 Sometimes when you go to a sandwich shop they overload it with everything else that the meat and bread are just there to accessorize the vegetables and sauce.
629 This was perfectly done.
630 The atmosphere is pleasant and open with nice music as the light smell of fresh bread in the background salivates me.

792 AZ-88 is at once chic, urban, fun, and just enough Scottsdale without making me want to stab myself in the face, as a t-shirt-and-jeans-wearing, overweight guy.
793 You'll first notice the atmosphere, and with good reason--it's perfectly lit, with noticeable but not mind-numbingly blaring music, and even better, they have a live DJ who goes through no small trouble to beat match and keep things rolling throughout your Wednesday-Saturday evening dining experience.
794 When I first hit AZ-88, it had an enormous deconstructed NY taxicab suspended from the ceiling which was a fantastical conversation piece.
795 The wall behind the bar was completely covered in names and numbers.
796 (I was far too proud when I accurately guessed that they were the names of cabbies and the numbers were their license numbers.)
797 Overall, a very different, fun look.
798 Comfortable chairs and very full cocktails abound, and while they typically have a rock-steady delivery, more than a little cosmo has ended up in my friend's purse, to her chagrin.
799 That aside, the food is fantastic and even though it's a bit hard to get out of here for under $30 per person (because you simply must try the cheesecake, and drinks are pushing $14), it's worth it as a classy-but-casual night out that you can really enjoy.
800 They have a great patio, the burger is dripping with flavor (and, in fact, cheese), and they have waffle fries with pretty much everything.
801 Great salads and sandwiches help round things out, and they ship their cheesecake in from Carnegie Deli in New York which is just about the most perfect cheesecake you'll have the good chance to try.
802 Forget that Cheesecake Factory nonsense, these people know how a cheesecake is done.
803 It is rich, thick, with just a hint of sour, and an amazing flavor that takes your tongue hostage and demands whipped cream ransom.
804 Overall, a wonderful place for drinks and good food with friends, and the staff is pointed but efficient and will throw back any shit you give them, in good humor or, as appropriate, not.
805 (We've never run afoul of that rule, but you wouldn't want to, I assure you.)

820 I also had some scalloped potatoes which was basically in the shape of a brick covered with cheesy goodness.
821 I wanted to eat the apple pie for dessert because it looked so delicious, but could barely breathe after eating all that food.
822 The service was outstanding, although the manager stopping by the table several times throughout dinner was annoying.
823 I can't wait to come back here.
824 On one of my many visits to see mi amore, he took me to this fantastic little pizza joint.
825 The aesthetics of the place were overwhelmingly perfect.
826 I believe the maximum seating capacity of the dining area is 45, yes folks, 45.
827 So the 2 1/2 hour wait was expected, and very VERY worth it.
828 The pizzas are baked to order in a classic brick house oven.
829 The toppings arent what youd find in your local Pizza Hut, either.
830 You can choose from fresh slices of mozzarella, slices of perfectly seasoned italian sausage, pepperoni slices, salami slices, arugula, fresh basil leaves, tomatoes, etc.
831 Basically what Im getting at, is this is beyond words delicious, classic LEGIT Italian pizza.
832 Around the dining area, you will see freshly baked loaves of focaccia bread, that is later served to you with extra virgin olive oil for dipping once you are seated.
833 The smell in that place is heavenly.....incredibly reminiscent of my grandmothers kitchen!
834 !
835 PS GET THERE EARLY!
836 !
837 The pizza is my favorite in Phoenix.
838 It is light, airy and tasty and does not give you that "I am reading to explode as my cotton mouth is making me drink two liters of water every half hour" feeling.
839 The ingredients are fresh and delicious.
840 I am hooked!

882 AJ's closed early the other night in lieu of the holidays and I ran around to FOUR different stores looking for something as simple as whole grain mustard and fennel.
883 I came up empty handed on both items.
884 I say "simple" items - but it's amazing when you rely on a grocer like this as much as I do and realize that most items are out of reach otherwise.
885 AJ's carries practically anything my culinary desires could ask for!
886 Although I had to wait a day to go shopping again and to make the recipe i was wanted, it was during my adventures to the 4 stores that I realized how much I truly appreciate this grocer.

1057 I'd say I've been to the Clubhouse a few times a year over the past five years or so.
1058 Does that make me the most knowledgeable person on the venue?
1059 By all means, no.
1060 But, there are some very common themes among the shows I've seen here, even though the artists were different genres, different, crowds, and even different times of year.
1061 The sound quality is terrible.
1062 The last three bands that I have seen there (and have seen in other venues as well) all complained that they couldn't get the sound right on their monitors or in the house.
1063 To me, that's a major turn off, if the band isn't happy with their sound, are they going to be very motivated to play?
1064 Maybe it's a slighted observation, but it seems that the only bands that return to this venue, are the ones that play music, where the sound quality isn't...let's say "sacrificed or as important" (metal, hardcore, thrasher, hip-hop, whatever you call it).
1065 The venue is also hot.
1066 I don't read the reviews of others, before I review a location, because I don't want my opinions to be skewed, but I noticed someone said, "don't wear pants," honestly, that's a really good tip.
1067 The last show I saw here was in June.
1068 I know, it's Phoenix, in the summer, suck it up.
1069 But when you exit the venue and it is noticeably and significantly "cooler" than inside the venue, we've got issues, can they not afford to run the a/c?
1070 The answer to that question is, maybe not.
1071 The bar is understaffed, and patrons seem to be lined up 3+ deep, all around.
1072 Sometimes you've got to spend money to make money.
1073 Hire more bartenders, customers get served faster, thus allowing them more time to consume the beverage and purchase more.
1074 That means you can sell more, which means you will make more money!
1075 What a concept.
1076 Hate to just destroy a business, but hopefully they will heed the feedback constructively.
1077 Until then, remember: if you've always wanted to hear the artist you are going to see in a low-fi format, here's your chance, if you have always wanted to forgo wearing those pantaloons, I support you, and finally, you should craft a clever way to hide a flask, since you won't get served, although this might be difficult sans bottoms.
1078 Not that any SBUX is worth going out of your way for, but this one is worth skipping.

1159 Indeed it was and we both enjoyed a nice Ice Cream cone....mine was chocolate vanilla swirl...and you can also get it in a cup as well.

1238 Rita's Kitchen is a hidden gem located right smack in the center of the Camelback Inn.
1239 While this may be a hot-spot for hotel guests, I think that locals might be missing out on its charm.
1240 I am a huge fan of anything the Camelback Inn does, especially since they offer live music and a great space for relaxation and Rita's Kitchen is no exception.
1241 This restaurant is airy and opens up to the spacious Camelback Inn patio where they play live music every night.
1242 Breakfast:
1243 Breakfast at Rita's is sublime and pretty reasonably priced.
1244 They offer a breakfast buffet for around $23 which includes eggs made to order (including omelets), pancakes, waffles, pastries, fresh fruit, bacon, sausage and hashbrowns.
1245 It's a great pick for a leisurely weekend breakfast.
1246 Just today was Mother's Day and while we only did the breakfast buffet, I did catch a glimpse of the Mother's Day brunch and holy moly do they know how to wow a crowd!
1247 Not only did they have stations set up all throughout the restaurant, patio and R-Bar, but they also had an extensive dessert area with build-your-own sundaes, freshly made cotton candy (in an old fashioned cotton candy maker) and a long dessert table with a chocolate fountain.
1248 Lunch:
1249 Lunch here is sublime and I also enjoy either the tacos or the chicken sandwich.
1250 The chicken sandwich is particularly a favorite of mine due to the cheese and sauce.
1251 The fries are tasty as well and you can either get sweet potato or regular.
1252 I also get sweet potato then regret not just getting the regular which are better in my mind.
1253 If the weather permits, sit on the patio and enjoy the beautiful water fountains, views of the mountain and tropical/desert setting.

1855 I paid 9000 USD a semester to receive a so and so education.
1856 I graduated with a magna cum laude.
1857 I have attended other universities.
1858 However, I couldn't help but notice the gap in the quality and variety of classes offered.
1859 For example, you have to be a finance major to take upper level interesting finance classes.
1860 Business school was so and so, a lot of repetition.
1861 Very little hands-on and help with internships.
1862 Way too much groupwork and free-riding.
1863 They do not have many good employers at their semi annual recruiting events.
1864 Oh, and professors rarely teach the courses.
1865 They have their teaching assistants teach us.
1866 Also, there is a lack of bridging classes between lower level and upper level classes.
1867  Junior year when you get admitted into the "professional program" the level of the classes and transition isn't too smooth.
1868 The campus tutoring program is pretty helpful for general classes if you're having trouble with classes (usually lower level)
1869 There are not enough chairs/desks in some classes.
1870 The students sit on the floor and cram on the stairs in the lecture halls.
1871 Also, the classes don't teach you how to think critically, which I think is crucial in college.
1872 Please don't waste your money, especially those of you from out of state.
1873 Its not worth it.
1874 Expect to wait in line wherever you go.
1875 ASU accepts way too many people.
1876 It would prolly accept my cat and my baby sister who barely talks if we threw money at them.
1877 Thus its very difficult to get myself into the classes I need.
1878 The advisors are walking advertisements of the business school.
1879 They are not informed enough to advise you.
1880 I got dropped from two required prerequisite courses so I could not move on to the next level.... even after pre-registration.
1881 I got screwed and ended up having to take one more semester to graduate.
1882 Tuition rose from 6000 a semester in Fall of 2003 to 9000 + in Fall of 2007.
1883 Gross!

2007 Really?!?
2008 You're coming over to tell us how long we have been waiting???

2010 It was the most ridiculous display of what NOT to do as a manager.
2011 I have been in management and customer service for over 12 years and this was clearly a Management 101 mistake.
2012 She never apologized or tried to rectify the situation, but when you come out to your customers in fighting mode you really cannot rectify that!
2013  Needless to say, unless this restaurant starts to provide better training to their managers and team members, or hires a new manager, we will NOT be coming back here again.

2017 Today I returned and spent a few hours working at Echo Coffee on their wi-fi.
2018 It was such a nice break from my usual home office at Starbucks.
2019 Walking into Echo Coffee you can instantly tell its a different type of coffee experience.
2020 The environment is very relaxing, music is not blasting so customers don't have to scream over each other, and they have great big couches in the back.
2021 Of course atmosphere and great coffee needs to be in balance and it definitely was at Echo.
2022 The coffee is really good and love very fair price for the quality you get (my 2 favs are Cappuccino at $2.75 and $3.75 for large Chai Latte).
2023 My chai latte came in a big ceramic mug.
2024 I don't know about you but there is just something special enjoying coffee out of big mugs and not recyclable paper cups.
2025 A surprising first for me is getting actual lunch at a coffee place and was pleasantly surprised to find the food was also really good.
2026 Can you tell I am a fan yet?
2027 I ordered a Curry Chicken sandwich and it was huge and delicious so finished the whole thing.
2028 There was a nice bonus on the plate - Mango Chutney so make sure you get that if you order lunch at Echo.

2146 Yup, I'm reviewing a gas station.
2147 I like the Quiktrip chain in general and this station in particular.
2148 I find Quiktrips to generally be the cheapest gas in town.
2149 Sure, the Arco sign down the street might say it's 2 cents/gallon cheaper, but then you get whacked with the ATM surcharge, not to mention there's all those bums loitering in the adjacent bus stop.
2150 With Quiktrip, the place is well lit, there's always a trash can and window squeegee at every pump, the convenience store is better than most, and unlike most other gas stations, they don't charge you for the air compressor.
2151 Oh, and the person at the register will actually greet you when you step inside the door, while managing to sound sincere about it.
2152 Is that the coolest thing for a convenience store or what?
2153 Bonus: for those of you who enjoy shopping at the Hot Chick Safeway down the street, this is the Hot Chick Gas Station.
2154 Tried going there for my 1st visit and they were closed during hours they were supposed to be open.
2155 Have tried calling them a few times during normal business hours and did not get anyone to pickup.
2156 They may be closed for good.
2157 Not sure.
2158 Piestewa and Camelback Peaks are the two boobs of Phoenix.
2159 They're real, and they're spectacular.
2160 Of course, being all-natural one is just a slight bit larger than the other, but this is barely noticeable.
2161 Camelback is barely 100 feet higher than Piestewa, whose nipple... er... summit, is at 2608 feet.
2162 Climb either one and you can enjoy great views of the other at various vantage points, not to mention views of the city.
2163 Although Camelback strikes me as a funner climb, I give Piestewa 5 stars because for what it lacks in the intangible fun factor it makes up with being just a tad less insanely crowded.
2164 Piestewa Peak Park also has a number of really cool looking trails that don't go up to the summit, which look to me to be worth exploring some day.
2165 Speaking of female body parts, the former name for this peak was "Squaw" Peak.
2166 This has inspired one of the most ridiculous controversies in modern times in our state.
2167 Native Americans are offended by the term "Squaw", and regardless of the linguistic origins of the word, it is basically the equivalent of terms such as "Negress" or "Jewess".
2168 In the 1990s, the State of Arizona proposed ending the controversy by renaming the peak after our greatest political leader ever and the father of American conservatism, Barry Goldwater.
2169 The whining dipshits who apparently constitute our voting population rejected the idea.
2170 They'd rather continue using a stupid name that has no historical or sentimental value whatsoever just to spite Native Americans, rather than honoring one of their finest citizens.
2171 And so, in this decade, Democratic Governor Janet Napolitano put an abrupt end to the whole issue.
2172 She gave the sqaw-apologists the finger and ordered the renaming of the peak to Piestewa, after Lori Piestewa, the first US woman soldier to be killed in the 2003 Iraq war and a member of the uniquely-Arizonan Hopi Nation.
2173 A fitting end to the debate.
2174 NOTE: Even more fitting, the original name of this peak was Squaw Tit Peak, and I swear to God I'm not making that up to be funny.
2175 I just love Chipotle.
2176 Fresh, yummy, spicy (if you want it to be).
2177 And the restaurant was clean a HUGE plus!
2178 My personal fav is the chicken burrito, no rice, no beans w/ fajita veggies, pico, cheese, sour cream, and lettuce.
2179 Guacamole and hot sauce on the side.
2180 So delicious!!!
2181 The person who did our order was so nice!
2182 It was my friend's first Chipotle experience!
2183 She was impressed by how big the burrito was.
2184 I'm glad I only live a few blocks away... because I will be back.
2185 I love you, Marquee Theatre.
2186 Just last night I saw Dashboard Confessional here and it was packed.
2187 I have seen many shows here and I have not a single complaint about The Marquee.
2188 The bartenders are really friendly, the bouncers do a great job, and the bands they have play here are always phenomenal.
2189 Not to mention, the sound guys do an awesome job.
2190 I love how big it is in the Marquee, because it allows for tons of people to see a great show.
2191 One thing that most venues fail at is keeping it cool inside of the venue, The Marquee on the other hand does a tremendous job of keeping the temperatures bearable in there.
2192 The only thing I hate (and this has nothing to do with The Marquee itself) is that I am always standing next to belligerently drunk, annoying girls who can't seem to keep their mouths shut during a set....
2193 Please don't speak...
2194 I am listening to Chris Carrabba's angelic voice, thanks.
2195 All in all, I think that The Marquee Theatre is my favorite venue of all time.
2196 Their food was GREAT!
2197 I had the pancit, lumpia, and that purple rice!
2198 The price was not bad for the amount of food that they gave you!
2199 Even though they had a very long line they were still very fast with service!
2200 FINALMENTE!!
2201 !
2202 Andiamo....
2203 FOOD
2204 --------
2205 Appetizer: Fritto Misto, which is a trio of fried appetizers.
2206 For the day, ours included a cheese, a stuffed olive, and whole leaves of broccolini.
2207 The cheese wedge was great (I wish I remembered what it was), and have you ever had a deep fried veal-stuffed olive?
2208 Very interesting.
2209 The flash-fried broccolini took a little getting used to, since the leaves kept crumbling as I was trying to eat them, but still tasty, if subtle.
2210 Main: Orecchiette alla Puttanesca.
2211 Man.
2212 This is the real deal.
2213 Orecchiette is the "little ear" pasta and "alla puttanesca" means it's made "whore style".
2214 And what a beautiful, classy, yet very vibrant whore she is.
2215 The pasta was cooked just perfectly, and even though puttanesca sauce usually goes with a stringier pasta (spaghetti, linguini, etc.)
2216 it worked really well with the orecchiette.
2217 And the sauce.
2218 Holy mother, this streetwalkin' hussy of a sauce with its 12 ingredients: capers, breadcrumbs, anchovy sauce, garlic, olives, basil, olive oil, and, uh, the other 5.
2219 The flavors were a perfect, clear-heeled harmony.
2220 Nothing overpowered the other.
2221 Subtle and humble home food.
2222 It really tasted just like something my Italian friends' mothers would cook in their kitchen.
2223 As for the servings, when I first got my bowl I was thinking, "oh ok, this is a European serving.
2224 I'm still going to be starving after this."
2225 And, um, nope.
2226 Why?
2227 Because I slowed down.
2228 I savored my meal, and took my time with the dish.
2229 And by the end, was I hungry?
2230 Not at all.
2231 I really enjoyed this meal.
2232 And the serving was just right.
2233 Complimentary packs of long breadsticks are also found on each table.
2234 SERVICE
2235 -------------
2236 Very friendly, efficient, and willing to go through the menu in detail and answer any more questions about the restaurant.
2237 Dishes were brought out in a timely manner and there was never any rush after the meal was completed to clear the table.
2238 And the mood inside Pastabar was palpable.
2239 Everyone looked happy, excited, and relieved that the restaurant was finally open for business.
2240 And I felt the same for them.
2241 SETTING
2242 -------------
2243 I would say the space was just the right size.
2244 Not a cavernous place in the least.
2245 Probably the same size as Sens, maybe  even a little smaller.
2246 It's tucked away in the very back of the hallway of the building, so much so that I completely missed it when I was IN THE HALLWAY the previous afternoon looking for it.
2247 But I like it a little hidden off, actually.
2248 The colors inside are warm, with a modern bistro feel.
2249 No windows looking outside but I didn't mind that.
2250 There is seating at the bar, a few two-tops up front, and larger tables in the back.
2251 Selections from different Shins albums made up the soundtrack throughout the dinner, and while the music sounds like it could be incongruous with a bunch of little ears cooked whore-style, it worked.
2252 I definitely don't think this is going to be as "scene-y" as Sens.
2253 It has a completely different vibe.
2254 EXTRA CRIB NOTES
2255 -----------------------------
2256 * the main courses of Pastabar are pasta and ONLY pasta.
2257 No veal parm here.
2258 And no hoikey sauces like Olive Garden-y alfredo or a jar of sugary Prego.
2259 * It's great
2260 * Prices for antipasti range from $7-$11-ish and mains $11-ish to $18.
2261 I spent around $26 with tax and a nice tip.
2262 * it's great
2263 * No liquor license (yet).
2264 For now, sparkling waters, lemonades, a number of sodas (including root beer & cream soda).
2265 * it's great
2266 * complimentary valet awaits the diners, if you're averse to parking close by yourself.
2267 * it's great
2268 * It's open till midnight on weeknights and 2 am on weekends!
2269 What more could you ask for?
2270 * did I tell you it's great?
2271 ALL IN ALL
2272 ---------------
2273 An awesome asset to the area and I'm very content.
2274 And as much as I loved my whoreish little ears, all the other pastas on the menu sounded incredible and I can't wait to try them all.
2275 I'm wishing these guys much success and giving them gratitude to finally being open.
2276 A few minor kinks to be worked out (and I wasn't as into the appetizer as I was my entree) so it's not totally perfect but they have started out very strong, and it's only Day 2.

2280 The theaters are clean and usually not packed either.

2288 What can I say?
2289 I like Culver's.
2290 It reminds me of home.
2291 It's total comfort food.
2292 Got one of their Wisconsin Swiss melts.
2293 What other fast food joints offer burgers with Swiss on rye?
2294 The crinkle cut fries are always hot and fresh.
2295 And tasty.
2296 Culver's is known for their frozen custard.
2297 What Wisconsinite has not driven past a Culver's, looked at their sign, checked out the 'flavor of the day', and gone, "Hey, that sounds good!!
2298 ", and quickly pulled into the parking lot?
2299 If you're from Wisconsin or the Midwest stop in for a Butterburger and some custard....it will bring back lots of good memories.
2300 Like another reviewer noted when he said he felt like he was in Iowa or something.....well.....that's the whole charm behind Culver's.
2301 You DO feel like you're in Wisconsin or one of the upper Midwest states.
2302 Granted I'm not the best person to review Culver's....I'm a little biased towards it.
2303 But if you want a 'different' kind of fast food experience and you've never been to the upper Midwest, it's a heck of a whole lot cheaper than flying there.
2304 Give it a chance....see if you like it.
2305 Let's be honest, when you walk into a tanning salon if you have high hopes you'll expect to see a nice person behind the counter who is friendly and can tell you the prices for packages and the max times on the beds.
2306 If you have low expectations you'll expect a bored teenager who hands you a price sheet and stares at you looking bored.
2307 Walking into the Total Tan I had pretty good expectations based on the reviews and even those were blown away.
2308 Dallas was the person who helped me (I think he's one of the owners?)
2309 and he was sooooo friendly and knowledgeable I spent more than I was originally planning but I feel good about it actually.
2310 I had looked at the pricing online so I had an idea of what I wanted but he explained things about the beds that I never knew and that none of the other salons I'd been to had ever told me.
2311 He was super personable too, even asking for my name just during his explanations of everything before I had committed to buying anything.
2312 He made sure I knew every detail of the beds, the differences, gave recommendations and was never pushy with any of it.
2313 During our conversation several people came in and he always asked my permission first to take care of them and I don't think he had to ask for their names once, a good sign that he pays attention and remembers his customers.
2314 I could go on and on because I was so impressed with his service and also the location itself (super clean, trendy, nice extras in the rooms like baby wipes and extra towels) but I think you get the point by now.
2315 Just check this place out, you'll be happy you did.
2316 This place really made a terrible situation as easy as possible.
2317 Our cat was hit by a car or beaten, and my husband found her immobile and crying horribly in pain.
2318 We rushed her to the clinic, and the doctor saw her right away.
2319 She told us our options, but was very upfront about the liklihood that our kitty would pass no matter what we did.
2320 She didn't pressure us one way or another, and left the room so that we could talk privately and make our decision.
2321 My husband asked if they could give her some pain meds while we talked about it, and they gave her some immediately.
2322 Once we made our difficult decision to put our kitty down, she brought the cat into a private room with us so that we could say goodbye.
2323 She left us alone and gave us as much time as we needed.
2324 She also let us be present in the room when they gave her the final shot.
2325 At all times the doctor and the techs were compassionate and very respectful.
2326 I was crying and they were very sensitive to my feelings.
2327 They treated my little kitty so gently even after she had passed.
2328 They even sent a sympathy card to our house a few days later.
2329 I really appreciated how they helped us through this difficult time, and I would definitely reccommend them if anyone else is in a similar situation.
2330 OK, yeah, everyone LOVES teriyaki, we know!
2331 Well, don't so quickly dismiss the other absolutely AMAZING dishes served here!
2332 It may look like a little pre-processed Japanese hole in the wall from the outside, but they're a die hard home-made mom and pop your mouth full of great food establishment!
2333 I'd highly recommend trying the Katsu bowl!
2334 You can hardly find ANY kind of Japanese katsu in AZ, yet they have an excellent one that's very traditional, but not too expensive!
2335 I'd love to explain the mystique of this dish, but too many people think that fried egg with onions and leeks topped over a diced pork cutlet that's coated in panko bread crumbs is too strange to be palatable.
2336 Well, to them I say you should educate your tongue, and expose it to some delicious culture!
2337 There's also Orange chicken...
2338 This dish is completely the bee's knees.
2339 It easily and without remorse makes Panda Express look like a burnt out oil can that a homeless person decided to cook some chicken in over a pile of burning newspapers.
2340 Their house beef?
2341 Spicy garlic brown sauce and beef with mushrooms?
2342 Heaven.
2343 Simple and delicious.
2344 And I haven't even mentioned their coup de grace yet.
2345 Their fried rice might seem a little "heavy" on the surface as it's lightly fried with some garlic oil, but it outclasses all competitors.
2346 Paired with their lightly fried shrimp, it's sweet garlic love.
2347 Seriously, their fried rice is the Sean Connery of fried rices.
2348 As I've been eating here for far longer than I'd like to admit, I'd have to say I might be a little biased.
2349 But, for the great unique quality and cheap price, I guarantee you're not going to find any better in AZ!

2351 Since then I have been a regular there and the people that co-work or work there are some of the most inspirational ones I know and are passionate about bringing start-up culture to Phoenix area.
2352 The companies that anchor Gangplank are always working overtime to plan events from Gangplank Jr. for kids to learn programming to the Wednesday "brown bag" talks that have ranged in topics from how to pitch to angel investor to a local news anchor talking about how they are using Twitter as a resource for news leads.
2353 Gangplank rocks.

2401 Weekend plans prevented me from kicking off AZ Restaurant Week on Saturday.
2402 So on Monday, Venyse and I headed to White Chocolate Grill where we both had our cherries popped.
2403 We started out with the spinach artichoke dip.
2404 The blends of cheeses made this perhaps the single most spectacular dip I've ever had the honor of putting in my mouth.
2405 O.M.G.
2406 Venyse and I were practically clawing at the bowl to get the last of its creamy loveliness.
2407 But when you hit a home run so soon in the game, the rest of a meal can seem at odds.
2408 However, I was not daunted.
2409 She ordered the New York Strip with a side of mashed potatoes (with good gravy...what exactly is that?)
2410 and roasted carrots; I the blackened Mahi [*back story to follow] topped with crab and a side of Israeli couscous.
2411 We didn't share our protein, but we sampled each others sides.

2543 Rocket Burger and Subs serves up huge sandwiches and fried delights for astonishingly low prices, and much of the food is home-made.
2544 There's also an enormous section of unusual soft drinks; for instance, there's over two dozen brands of root beer to choose from.
2545 Dennis, one of the owners worked for A&W for 8 years, so he probably has root beer running through his veins by now.
2546      I saw Rocket Burger in a listing of new valley eateries, then did a little research.
2547 The reviews I saw were all stellar, so I knew we had to give it a try.
2548 It doesn't look like much, inside or out - it's in a little strip mall tucked behind Churches Chicken at 35th Ave. and Cactus.
2549 But it's clean, and everybody is helpful and pleasant.
2550 Ken gave a happy whoop when he saw Cheese Curds ($2.49/$4.49) on the menu.
2551 We decided to get an order while waiting for our friends Randy and Marty to join us.
2552 The curds came quickly out of the kitchen, piping hot, served with some tasty homemade marinara.
2553 They were a touch greasy, as they should be, and the oil was fresh.
2554 Marty and Randy arrived in time to save us from ourselves by helping to finish off the curds.
2555 Then we took a while trying to make our selections from the extensive menu.
2556 Eventually Randy and I both went for the New Yorker: pastrami with homemade slaw and thousand island dressing ($2.99, $3.99 or $4.99).
2557 Ken had a homemade-meatball  sub, with more of that good marinara and some provolone.
2558 It was the same price structure as our New Yorkers and all the rest of the entries under Classic Subs and Sandwiches.
2559 Marty went with a double burger ($3.89, the singles are $1 less).
2560 He could have opted for a Rocket Burger - !0 inch sub with three burgers and the fixings in either plain, cheese, bacon, teriyaki, or chili style ($4.99 to $5.99).
2561 Of course we had to try the fries and onion rings.
2562      Again our food arrived quickly, served in plastic baskets.
2563 It became very quiet, except for the occasional growl of pleasure.
2564 The onion rings ($1.99) had been dipped in a thin cornmeal batter which made them nice and crunchy.
2565 The handcut fries ($1.49) were skinny, the way I like them.
2566 Randy thought they were undersalted, but I thought they were fine - our usual disagreement.
2567 At any rate, they disappeared quickly.
2568 Unlike the sandwiches.
2569 They were so big that we all ended up taking half of each sub home.
2570 The slaw on the New Yorkers was delicious, as was my whole wheat sub roll.
2571 The meat balls were nice and tender, and there was plenty of cheese on top.
2572 Randy had found a bottle of ginger beer imported from Australia that had a wonderfully refreshing true ginger taste.
2573 There seemed to be actual pieces of ginger in it - instructions on the label said to invert the bottle before opening.
2574 It never did tell you to turn it right side up again - the Aussies give us more credit than we deserve.

2690 I would be beside myself if Grinders closed.
2691 It's about time I wrote a review, since I'm a regular.
2692 I can be found sitting on one of the giant chairs surfing on the wi-fi many mornings.
2693 I'm the one who brought the plants in.
2694 I used to water them a couple times a week but nowadays I'm lazy and they really need to be repotted.
2695 I should get on that ...
2696 The music is always playing and everyone knows my regular drink ... they've continued to memorize it for me even as I started to slowly decrease the fat & calories of my regular order.
2697 Now it's an ice skim latte with sugar free vanilla.
2698 I used to get an Everything bagel with egg, cheese and potatoes most mornings.
2699 Now I get it on multigrain toast.
2700 Eh, it's the little things.
2701 The coffee at Grinders is really really good.
2702 It's not bitter and sharp, it's smooth.
2703 They grind their beans outside many mornings per week.
2704 Sometimes it gets too warm inside during the winter so we prop the doors open, but if the grinder is going outside, it'll blow coffee bean fumes in the door.
2705 There's some retired motorcycle cops who meet up every morning and sit around the big round table.
2706 They often park their motorcycles in front of the place together.
2707 They call themselves the Geezerados.
2708 There's sometimes a few right-wingers having conversations mid-day.
2709 One time I listened to their meeting and heard them trying to come up with controversial topics to get people to come to church.
2710 They spent a long time trying to figure out who could get them proof that global warming isn't happening, so they could use that as their hook.
2711 A lot of moms come in with their kids.
2712 Seeing siblings piled up in one of the oversized chairs together is common.
2713 There are a few regulars who come in specifically to sit on the internet all day.
2714 I'm not there all day, but I'm there at all times of the day because I have a home office, and you never know when you suddenly need caffeine.
2715 Early in the morning and after 3pm the place becomes flooded with Sunnyslope High School kids.
2716 They range from ROTC kids wearing pickle suits to trendy girls in neon to the alternative crowd.
2717 They often lay around the couch splayed across each other or gazing into each others' eyes.
2718 Ordinarily I'm a real talker and I can't usually keep my mouth shut, but Grinders is the one place that I go where I barely make a peep.
2719 I just eavesdrop on everyone's conversations and sometimes run into friends I know.
2720 I usually go before my brain is fully awake in the morning, that's part of it.
2721 For the record, a couple months ago one of the girls there said I was practically invisible and she hardly knew I was there, because I was so quiet.
2722 There's nothing pretentious about Grinders at all, and it's also down to earth without being ghetto.
2723 It has character.
2724 Some months the art is better than other months.
2725 Hannah has been there for years (they call her Big Hannah now, only because there's another girl named Hannah who is tiny and they call her Little Hannah) and Hannah rocks and makes the best breakfast ever.
2726 I can ride my bike in the morning and be wearing my pajamas and not have anyone really bat an eye.
2727 That's the beauty of Grinders.
2728 I've seen other people come in wearing their pajamas, too.
2729 It's a little bit like the cafeteria in a college dorm, except the people are of all ages and we live down the street from each other instead of down the hall from each other.
2730 Grinders has a location inside the John C. Lincoln hospital across the street, too.
2731 It's common to see the hospital workers walk in wearing their scrubs.
2732 I think they're also opening one at Devry, or they just did.
2733 I was frustrated to hear that they tried to open a location at the Art Institute but they were one week too late, Stupid Starbucks had just gotten there.
2734 LAME!
2735 In my opinion, one of the best steakhouses in town.
2736 My husband and I go here for all our special occasions and have never had one bad meal.
2737 The service is the best just like their steaks.
2738 I recommend the Caesar salad, fillet, creamed spinach, cream corn, garlic and lobster mashed potatoes.

2761 Unfortunately this will not happen because Pavle Milic, who runs the place, cannot be at every restaurant.
2762 This is a small, friendly restaurant in my hood, that just happens to have some of the best food you will find.

2772 I LOVE Laser for Less (Chandler)!
2773 If you are going anywhere else for Laser hair removal you need to stop now and call to make an appointment with Laser for Less, Chandler.
2774 I wasted a lot of $$$ at another Laser removal place before I found Laser for Less and now I am kicking myself for not going to them first.
2775 If you pay to wax any part of your body you should be lasering that hair off.
2776 It works better, lasts longer, and in the long run is cheaper.
2777 Pros -
2778 1.
2779 Free touch ups 14-18 days after your first appointment if they missed 1 hair they will touch up for free.
2780 Never had a problem with them discouraging me, in fact it was the opposite they give me reminder cards so I know when my touch ups are due.
2781 They encourage you to come in.
2782 2.
2783 They can also charge you by the laser shot instead of a whole area.

3346 I found this place on Yelp and came here while on a trip to Arizona.
3347 The place was pretty crowded but we only  waited about 15-20 minutes.
3348 We ordered babyback ribs, St. Louis ribs, corn, and mac&cheese.
3349 They also give you DELICIOUS AMAZING CORNBREAD!
3350 Everything was excellent.
3351 The St. Louis ribs were the best ribs I have ever had.
3352 They were extremely tender and had a nice flavorful bark on the  outside with dark grill marks.
3353 Their BBQ sauce was equally awesome and the kind I like -- a bit more on the sweeter side, less on the vinegary side.
3354 The babyback ribs were also tasty, but not as flavorful (and less meat of course) than the St. Louis ones.
3355 The sides were good but more forgettable due to the sheer perfection of their ribs.
3356 I don't know if I will ever be in Phoenix again, but this place is a must-return if I ever am.

3377 I can't add much to what has already been said....BUT I'll try, haha!
3378 Um, don't come here without a map, or some sort of gps device (NOTE: some spots in the mountain do not get good reception, so a map on your phone may not always fully come in).
3379 It is VERY easy to get lost!
3380 There are many trails, I look forward to getting to know them better.
3381 So far, all I have really done is Mormon Trail and the Hidden Valley Loop.....Fat Man's pass is probably my most favorite spot...OH!
3382 AND there are some really cool rock formations on the way there (including a natural tunnel) look for the rock that looks like a big mushroom!
3383 This is a good area to do a hike in the dark....but don't do it until you've done the trail a couple times in daylight.
3384 You can see what seems like the whole valley from up there!
3385 If you do the night hike, make sure the moon is full.....you can actually see pretty well with that and the city lights.
3386 Plus, it's GORGEOUS!

3389 When Hoa called and said we were having a reunion of former branch employees at a Chinese buffet, I wasn't at all apprehensive.
3390 My normal concerns with such eateries--will the food be maintained at a proper food-safe temperature, is this seafood fresh, how long has the sushi been sitting out, will I be able to make it home before my intestines rupture--dissipated because Hoa knows good Asian cuisine.
3391 She is, of course, born to Vietnam and world traveled.
3392 Let's start with my happiest aspect about HKGB: the sushi.
3393 No, it's not the best sushi in the Valley, but they make it fresh for you on site.
3394 You can stand there and watch it being make, grab a soup or something else to munch on, or just sit at your table and chat awhile.
3395 Afterwards, you can head back for more sushi or veer over to the more traditional offerings of a Chinese buffet: sweet and sour chicken, fried rice, crab legs.
3396 Now let's review the not-so-shiny aspect: the price.
3397 Yes, it seems a little steep that we paid about $25 per person with tip (and I made only two rounds) but when you factor in the 2 hours we spent there, grazing, catching up, grazing, passing Lisette's daughter around, grazing and making plans to keep in touch, it's really not such an outrageous amount to pay.
3398 If you find yourself in this part of town, craving Chinese and are wicked crazy hungry, give HKGB a shot.

3618 I have been visiting Mrs. White's going on 30 years, but after looking up the phone number this afternoon to verify if they were open and still had fried chicken, my wife started reading some of the reviews following a recent Food Network recommendation - I almost got cold feet.
3619 Good thing I didn't.
3620 The food is as awesome as ever.
3621 The service is much as it has always been.
3622 Be forewarned, trendy restaurant goers, who glom onto TV reviews, Mrs. White's is not trendy; there are no bubbly fresh blonde girls waiting to seat you.
3623 The service is matter of fact, no goofing around, you must get to the business of ordering and pretend you know what you are doing - this is the way it has always been at Mrs. White's.
3624 If you are looking for others to pamper you, this is not the place for that.
3625 Mrs. White's is where you go to pamper your indulgence for perfect soul food.
3626 If you want Scottsdale ambiance, again, this joint won't work for you.
3627 When you go, be prepared that not all dishes may be on the menu during your visit.
3628 There are no corporate owned semi-trailers that deliver two tons of food every other day.
3629 This is a small and very cramped operation that makes homemade food for those who know how to appreciate it.
3630 In these days of flash frozen prepared dishes that are uniform from visit to visit at chain restaurants, this food is made in a tiny hot kitchen.
3631 If they run out of your favorite dish that has been cooking for hours prior to your arrival, there is no way they can whip up another pot of green beans and potatoes in 20 minutes.
3632 I often call ahead to verify if they have what I want because years ago it was not uncommon that by 12:30 they would be out of half of everything on the menu, which was OK because if forced me to try new things Back then, Mrs. White's was open Monday through Friday from 11:00 till 3:00, but I'd swear you'd be lucky to get anything after 1:00 - and that was perfectly fine as you knew they were doing all they could with their limited space to do their best for us customers.
3633 I'd just come back on another day.
3634 To say I have the utmost respect for the White family would be an understatement, today I was afraid I might have to lose that based on those poor reviews below.
3635 I do not believe those reviews are an accurate representation of The Golden Rule Cafe.
3636 They are the distortions and disappointments of people who have skewed expectations.
3637 Funky little hole-in-the-wall family-run operations that attract a loyal customer base may not be the place for everyone, but if you understand that wonderful stuff doesn't always come wrapped in a sterile designer package, then you might get along with Mrs. White's.

3849 I love me some Dobson Ranch.
3850 As far as municipals in the Valley are concerned, this is as good as it gets (Aguila is a close second).
3851 No overbearing marshalls.
3852 Rates that top out at $28 in the winter.
3853 Above average range and practice area, including two large putting greens.
3854 Cheap pitchers of beer.
3855 A long-time cart lady who will spray your face with water in the summer!
3856 As far as the course itself, this is not typical AZ golf - there are no cacti, only tree-lined fairways and some water sprinkled throughout to pose as threats.
3857 But there are birdies to be had, and lots of them; #1, 3, 5, 7, 10, 13, 15 and 18 are the best chances in my experience (I consider this my home course).
3858 The greens are usually pretty moderate speed to slow - this is grainy bermuda, not some hybrid or bent grass, so prepare to run the putts into the back of the hole.
3859 #5 is my favorite hole, a short-par 5 that gives you the chance to hit over a tree left and drive the narrow fairway, leaving you a long to mid-iron into an elevated green that slopes toward you.
3860 #8 is a formidable challenge if you have the tendency to block (or slice, as may be the case) the ball from time-to-time, as your ball will face a watery grave.
3861 #16 is a tricky tree-lined hole with a tight driving area and doglegs right.
3862 And finally, #18, a short par 5 that is easily reachable and where a par feels like a bogey.
3863 A scant 6600 yds from the blue tees (but rarely plays it's full length), there are some low scores out there.
3864 A great course, value, practice area, and recently renovated restaurant and bar - 5 stars.

3957 I will precede this lackluster review by stating the following:
3958 1)I have only been to this place once.
3959 2)I didn't get a chance to actually try the cuisine.
3960 3)I am a sympathetic person to servers, as I have been one.
3961 That being said, I give this place one star for reasons of poor service.
3962 About six months ago, at around 4pm on a Sunday afternoon, we decided to eat at this place.
3963 The atmosphere was warm and cozy; typical college bar with college-aged waitresses.
3964 We made sandwich selections and ordered happy hour beers.
3965 The beers came, the food never did, and we watched other patrons come in, eat, and leave.
3966 All the while, our waitress never came by to give us an explanation or even get us another round of drinks (we got them ourselves from the bar).
3967 Since my bf and I both worked in food service, we are always sympathetic when we can see that a place is under-staffed.
3968 But after an hour of waiting, we finally crossed the room to speak with our server.
3969 She said, "I can't imagine it will be much longer."
3970 I think the more professional approach would have been an apology and admitting to forgetting to put in our ticket, which is what we gathered when we saw her speaking frantically with the cook.
3971 Where was the manager that day?
3972 Or someone who noticed that we sat there so long without our food or any communication at all?
3973 We left money on the table for our beers and walked out.
3974 I guess there is a first time for everything.
3975 As I passed the velvet rope flanked by shiny, exotic cars I knew I was in for an experience.
3976 Some might call it a fine-dining experience, but clearly this was something more.
3977 A tribute to opulence and Regan-era excess, Dominick's is your seven-figure foodie fantasy come alive; from the moment you enter the swanky foyer to the gleaming 10 inch tower of tiramisu that finishes your meal.
3978 It's glittery, bedazzled, and oozing pretension - and I loved it.
3979 The Service
3980 My visit to Dominick's was the night after it's official opening.
3981 The service tried very hard to be as impeccable as the surroundings and, while not perfect, the charming staff and the sincere effort put forth made little things like missing napkins and bread plates instantly forgivable.
3982 Our server, Drew, let us know that the wait staff only had 2 - 3 tables each and it was very evident in the personal service we received.
3983 A few more weeks of experience for the staff should easily iron out the little wrinkles.
3984 The Food
3985 We started with the jumbo shrimp appetizer, which unfortunately came with 3 shrimp - hardly conducive to sharing - so we ordered two.
3986 And "Jumbo" they certainly were, accompanied by a kicky cocktail sauce which my dinner companion felt was spicy enough.
3987 Ever the daredevil, I added additional horseradish to mine because who doesn't like to burn the inside of their nostrils at dinner.
3988 For the main course we both had the 9-oz filet, lobster gnocchi and steamed asparagus.
3989 My filet was a perfect rare-plus with a dark pink center, expertly seared and juicy.
3990 Surprisingly the lobster gnocchi really stole the show for me.
3991 I'm not big on starches or cream sauces so when it was suggested I wasn't particularly excited; I should have been.
3992 The dough was light and fluffy, the cream sauce not too rich and the lobster added the perfect amount of salt & texture.
3993 After dinner I indulged in a grand marnier while my companion ordered the tiramisu.
3994 He was presented with a 10 inch tall hunk of cake that could easily have been intended for 4 people.
3995 The tiramisu was spongy and light, with a lovely cool custard and only a subtle flavor of rum.
3996 A nice finish to an excellent meal.
3997 Atmosphere
3998 We were lucky enough to score a poolside table which started off as very romantic but over the course of the evening became quite the place for people watching.
3999 The scene at the small bar area on the 2nd floor was bustling and both the waiters and I wondered aloud how long it would be before a guest fell in the pool.
4000 I bet they didn't make it through the weekend without someone making a splash.
4001 I Love this place.
4002 I eat here either take in or take out at least 2 times a week!
4003 I also agree with some of the others.

4140 I 'm reviewing Haji Baba as a GROCERY STORE first.
4141 Then I will give you some insight into the prepared food for take-out or in-store dining.
4142 This is one of the few stores in Arizona where you have several choices for pita bread--it's also the ONLY place I've found for whole wheat pita.
4143 There are several choices for Feta cheese.
4144 Danish, French,Greek...same with olives--there are choices.
4145 I ALWAYS buy my tahini here.
4146 All the prices are very inexpensive.
4147 Need spices???
4148 They have them all.
4149 At about 25% of the price you would pay anywhere else.
4150 The best way to describe Haji Baba is that it is a REAL grocery store, with REAL prices, for REAL people.
4151 It is NOT a "specialty store" with trendy items and inflated prices.
4152 They sell food items that you will actually use.
4153 The bonus here?
4154 You won't find a 10 year old can or jar of something.
4155 On to the "restaurant" portion.
4156 Haji Baba is better if you think of it as a take-out joint that happens to have places to sit and eat.
4157 They do have tables and they do perform table service, it's just got zero charm.
4158 You go for the food, that's it.

4174 I was looking into gyms around the area.

4181 He was personable - at first anyways.
4182 Showed me around the gym and I was interested in joining.
4183 Next we went over to the childcare area since I have a little one.
4184 Children were in the room however the two girls monitoring the room were chatting it up with one another and ignoring the kids.
4185 Bad sign.
4186 I asked the girls if they were CPR certified and had fingerprinting and background checks.
4187 The world stopped for just a moment and they stared at me.
4188 I had interrupted their important conversation.
4189 Then they were both saying, "Yeah, like, well, um, no, I mean yes,".
4190 In other words, no straight answers.

4192 I felt like I was purchasing a new car.
4193 "If you choose option A, you then can go to all the gyms."
4194 "If you choose option B, then only here" .
4195 The whole time I could see the children's area and the kids were being completely ignored (and we are talking very little children).

4198 From there he was down right rude.

4215 BF went with Pollo Parmagiana.

4219 The perfect sweet ending to our meal.
4220 In addition, we were each brought an after dinner drink of amaretto on the rocks, on the house.

4600 Culinary Thought: I got shrimp on the side, due to allergies.
4601 This was probably the most awesome experience of the evening.
4602 They even "fenced in" the shrimp within a Masai-esqe cage of cabbage, to prevent their oceanic brine from invading the delicate papaya, sprout and carrot forest.
4603 Spice and crunch with every munch.
4604 Beautiful.
4605 Ninja Eating Plan: Try not to be seen scarfing this down in front of a date, it's that awesome.
4606 Fortunately, my sister was only present and she knows I can eat like a pig and sound like one, too.
4607 # 53 Peanut Curry (Panang curry style, comes with rice!
4608 ): Umami
4609 Culinary Thought: I don't like coconut.
4610 I do now.
4611 The lemon and coconut milk rises through the savory peanut curry.
4612 Tofu was my protein option, it was done perfectly.
4613 Green beans provided great consistency in this masterful crescendo.
4614 Ninja Eating Plan: Laid over rice, alternately brown and white rice, interrupted by the occasional, gorgeous, curry-only spoonful.
4615 Coconut Ice Cream: Yum
4616 Culinary Thought: I was reeling at this point but I wanted to continue this experience.
4617 As I stated earlier, coconut is not my thing but I believe in giving things a fair try, so I did.
4618 Coconut ice cream is delicious.
4619 Coconut pulp, or meat, I still have a texture issue with, but the honey swirl throughout the ice cream made this delectable.
4620 Ninja Eating Plan: Use the cooling ice cream energy to return your body back to normalcy.
4621 Perfect coda for the culinary symphony.
4622 I will be back.

5103 The Renaissance Festival is a place where everyone and anyone can venture to in order to awaken their medieval passions and expose a side of them no other place can reveal.
5104 Here people can be themselves without fear of being judged.
5105 They can dress in clothing appropriate to the era, eat as citizens of the renaissance age would eat, and live a day in the shoes of people whose lifestyle consisted of these aspects every day of their lives, all while having a merry time.
5106 What's fascinating about the Renaissance Festival is it is an escape from the everyday bustling industrial environment known to people of the 21st century.
5107 Once you pass through the gates, you are immersed in a culture rarely seen these days.
5108 Men, women, and children of all ages absorb the spirit of the festival and change into someone only such a place can expose.
5109 Immediately you are compelled to have high spirits as people dancing, shopping, and just continuously enjoying themselves welcome you to the festival.
5110 From there the opportunities are limitless for there are twelve stages of continuous live entertainment, jousting tournaments, over 200 artisans displaying a variety of unique wares, and displays of ancient skills like glassblowing, leatherworking, weaving, woodcarving, blacksmithing, candlemaking and pottery.
5111 One specific entity of the Renaissance Festival that stands out in my mind is the old coin striking mill tucked away and blended into in the strips of stores surrounding it.
5112 Here, a family of three (father, mother, and daughter) work to produce unique coins crafted into necklaces by means of a punch press.
5113 The store offers some 100 different punch dyes each a symbol possessing its own special meaning.
5114 The categories range from mythological symbols, to astrological, to even ancient Egyptian.
5115 Once their customer has chosen two of their own special symbols they want imprinted on a coin, they place a blank, either bronze or silver, between each dye and clamp it to a press.
5116 Then a heavy weight is hoisted a few feet above the dyes and then suddenly dropped onto the head of one dye, eternally imprinting the symbols on the coin.
5117 What's distinctive about this certain store is they can fulfill the needs of any customer that they are presented with by owning such a broad spectrum of dyes applicable to anyone due to the meaningful descriptions given to each symbol.
5118 Additionally, what captivates people is the fact that the coin is formed before your very eyes three feet away, making the production a very personal thing for the consumer.
5119 If you and your family are venturing to the Renaissance Festival in Arizona anytime soon, which I would undoubtedly recommend, be sure to stop in on this special experience not attained anywhere else close by.

5174 I just wanted to add that in addition to party and catering equipment, they also rent heaps of tools and equipment.
5175 Think hedge trimmers, lawn aerators, cement mixers - stuff you might need for a once a year or special project, and so, don't want to invest in the equipment.
5176 In our case, we needed a chainsaw to take down some dead stuff from last winter's freeze, an unwelcome sapling, a dead tree, branches encroaching the roof, and to tame some monstrous oleanders.
5177 I was just about to head to the tool rental department at that big box home improvement store, when a friend mentioned A to Z. I gave them a call, and their prices were competitive.
5178 Plus it had that feel good factor of being a local biz.
5179 The process was pretty easy.
5180 We got a thorough tutorial on chainsaw operation and safety, and were on our way to some serious arboreal carnage.
5181 Pro tip: rent on Friday after 4pm.
5182 You can return it Monday morning, and only be charged for one day (Saturday), since they are closed on Sunday.

5568 I can now thank the Humane Society for not only giving me my dog Brutus when I was a child, but now my dog Harley as an adult.
5569 A couple of years ago, I planned a visit to the Arizona Humane Society to present them with a corporate donation on behalf of my old company.
5570 When I scheduled the meeting, they offered to give me a tour of the vicinity and as a friend of the helpless animals, I said of course and planned my visit.
5571 However, I knew that with a tour, I might be in some trouble in the willpower department.
5572 When I arrived to the center, I was greeted by a pretty view of South Mountain and a wide open vicinity.
5573 I walked inside and immediately noted how clean it was for being home to many a furry creature.
5574 The staff was warm and welcoming as potential new "parents" waited in the lobby to adopt a new friend.
5575 Kittens and bunnies greeted the guests and there was a special area for the cats being featured that week.
5576 The vicinity was a five star facility to say the least and I could immediately tell that the animals were treated well here and in good hands until they found a new home.
5577 To make a long story shorter, they gave us a detailed tour of the complex.
5578 I walked through spacious room after spacious room full of dogs of all kinds just wanting a home.
5579 As I walked up to one of the cages, a furry ball of fluff looked up at me and placed his paw on the cage.
5580 I fell in love immediately.
5581 To make matters worse, the staff then took us into a room where we could make a kong of peanut butter and treats for our dog of choice.
5582 Of course I had to give it to my new found friend.
5583 At that point I knew I was in trouble and could very well be leaving with a dog.
5584 So to end that part of my story, I did leave with a dog and Harley has been happy in his new home ever sense.
5585 While I visited the Humane Society, I couldn't get over their quality of service for not only the clients but the animals themselves.
5586 They were clean, kept in spacious areas and they even had a huge playground for the animals to play in each and every day.
5587 When i found Harley and started to think about taking him home with me, they took me to a private play area where I could get to know Harley a bit more to make sure he was the right dog for me.
5588 A staffer stayed in the area and helped me with any questions I had.
5589 When I made the decision to take Harley home with me, they neutered him, gave me a couple free vet visits and sent me home with some treats, food and a leash.
5590 They even have a pet store to pick up all your essentials for your new friend.
5591 And did I mention that the proceeds go back to the Humane Society...a nonprofit?
5592 This Arizona Humane Society is a five star pet resort that focuses on making the most of a pet's stay until they find a new home.
5593 I suggest just taking a visit to the facility to see how well-kept it is.
5594 They even have horses that they rescued.
5595 Sorry folks, they are not up for adoption though.
5596 So thank you Arizona Humane Society for bringing my little dog Harley to me and saving so many animals from the streets.

5598 The innovative drink menu, the pizza was out of this world and the bartender was very personable.
5599 A++ I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.
5600 Ban't wait to return!
5601 Hole-in-the-Rock is a cave-like natural rock formation sculpted into the top of a sandstone butte in Phoenix's beautiful Papago Park.
5602 It's one of the most powerful scenic views in our city, and is the perfect place to showcase its exquisite landscape.
5603 Just a short hike up the butte and you'll find yourself in the amazing chamber sculpted over millions of years of wind and water erosion.
5604 At sunset there are few locations that can rival its awesomeness.
5605 The hole faces south, giving a wonderful view over south Phoenix all the way to South Mountain.
5606 Hole-in-the-Rock is truly one of the greatest attractions in our city and everyone would be blessed to experience it at least once.
5607 No fee to enter.
5608 Bring a camera!
5609 Flatiron Mesa is one of my favorite hikes in the Phoenix area.
5610 Like other reviewers have stated, once you've gotten used to Squaw and Camelback, give this one a try.
5611 It'll kick your ass.
5612 It's about a 2600' climb in elevation, so you're doing more like 2.5 Camelbacks.
5613 You'll be scrambling over boulders most of the way up since there really aren't switchbacks.
5614 I'd say give yourself about 5 hours to go up and down.
5615 It's inside Lost Dutchman State Park so you will need to pay an entry fee.
5616 My one recommendation besides the obvious ones (being fit, pack food and water) is to bring some light gloves.
5617 Since you're climbing up and down on all those boulders your hands will probably get a little scratched up.
5618 Don't feed the wildlife.

6288 The Phoenix metro area is definitely not known for authentic Asian cuisine.
6289 China Magic Noodle House, however, is the real deal.
6290 This place reminds me of the Taiwanese delis that I used to go to in LA, as well as noodle houses that I've frequented in Taipei.
6291 They have a great selection of cold noodle, hot noodle and soup noodle dishes.
6292 And, a variety of ways to have your noodles (I typically order the thick noodles or shaved noodles).
6293 There's always a veggie on the whiteboard to try and the fried tofu is very tender and tasty with the dipping sauce.
6294 If you're looking for a reasonably priced, ethnically authentic meal in Phoenix (especially the East Valley), China Magic Noodle House should be near the top, if not first, on your list.
6295 the only negative that I would have about this place is that there isn't enough choices where chicken is the main protein.

6479 in honor of the impending superbowl XLV, i wanted to write my majerles review.
6480 this year though, instead of hitting up a sports bar for the biggest day in football, i'll be going to a party.
6481 a real rager.
6482 if i wasn't though, i would definitely be pressed up against majerles front door bright and early superbowl morning.
6483 it's a great sports bar.
6484 the weirdest thing about majerles is their name.
6485 someone finally told me it wasn't pronounced "mah jer lees" like i had thought.... it's pronounced "mar lees".
6486 so let me get that out first.
6487 i'm a big sports nut.... well, let me rephrase that.
6488 i'm a big sports nut when it involves REAL sports.
6489 i won't make fun of anyone, but if it's not football, baseball, basketball or hockey i don't wanna hear about it.
6490 unless of course we're talking about extreme sports like surfing, skateboarding, etc.
6491 being a fan of sports makes me a fan of sports bars.
6492 there are only 3 main things i need in order for a sports bar to be great in my opinion.
6493 let me lay them out for you:
6494 a good selection of beers, happy hour specials and bar snacks--- yes, majerles has this in spades.
6495 large selection of beers and any sports bar that has perrier jouet, vueve clicquot and dom champagnes must be praised.
6496 (mostly because i think this is absolutely hilarious.
6497 WHO orders pricey champers at a sports bar?
6498 haha!)
6499 also, put me down as a fan of their reuben reuben and tenderloin sliders.
6500 yum.
6501 the service--- there's nothing worse than sidling up to a bar, excited to watch your team kick some ass and ordering a drink from a bartender that seems bored and unhappy.
6502 every bartender i've come in contact with at majerles truly loved being at work (or they at least acted like it).
6503 bartenders attitudes really carry a lot more weight then they realize.
6504 happy bartender =  happy bar patrons
6505 the strategic placement of large TV sets for comfortable viewing pleasure--- yep.
6506 they designed this with real sports fans in mind.
6507 no matter where i sit, i can see a multitude of TV's with little blocking my view.
6508 so they have it all, and i likey.
6509 go here if you're looking for a good bar to watch the superbowl... or any sporting event for that matter.

6650 This is my favorite restaurant in the Phoenix area.
6651 There, I wrote it...and I am sticking to it.
6652 First off -- fresh local, sustainable, organic are not just words on the menu and the website.
6653 Now, in places like San Francisco and NYC, this would be nothing notable, but in the desert, it is truly something hard to find.
6654 Aside from the practical, in the land of Fox Restaurants (True aside) and the big box store at the strip mall, there really appears to be little demand for a small, local restaurant on a farm.
6655 It's time to make new demands!
6656 It's time to say no to the next Zinburgergeist and try that little corner place run by your neighbor...but I digress.
6657 We enjoyed the Farmer's Feast and it was worth every penny of the $65/person.
6658 First, the house cured meats, including the head cheese, were amazing.
6659 Second, how often do you get a chef's menu where each person's plate is different?
6660 Not often.
6661 Ultimately we each tried 10 different items.
6662 And each item, was amazing.
6663 I would come back for the pasta alone, let along the perfectly cooked scallops, and melt in your mouth sliced fillet.
6664 The service was ideal.
6665 If you want to eat in 60 minutes, don't come here, but if you want to enjoy in evening of great food, do come here.

6667 I commented on how unique it is, etc...Of course, it was not available on the night I was there...or was it?
6668 When it came to our fish course, the waiter brought out sturgeon for me.
6669 The restaurant didn't have enough to have it on the menu, but the waiter clearly put in a special request on my behalf and made the effort to make a diner happy.
6670 Maybe if I offer to work on the farm I can eat for free...

6722 This review can be applied to any and all Quick Trip locations.
6723 I have, on many occasions, gone out of my way to stop in QT over other gas stations, because not only are they much much nicer, but they are very clean and offer a ton of gas station fare (drinks, shakes, coffees, juices, snacks, etc).
6724 I really appreciate how quickly they work, with cashier's that are able to take care of two customers at once.
