13184 I'd go look at the box but we are fresh out because the hubs thinks that eating one box over a two-three day period is acceptable!
13185 It also fun to be rewarded for bringing your own reusable bags; as any good eco-friendly shopper would do!
13186 There is a weekly drawing for a TJ's gift card (I think the value is $25) and you get a ticket when you bring your own bags.
13187 (not one for each bag...just one ticket for bringing them to put your goodies in) Then they draw a name out of all the tickets (which you drop in a box on your way out of the store) once a week.
13188 If you shop more than once a week, you can "earn" a ticket for each time you shop there in a week therefore increasing your chances of winning.
13189 (although I am PRETTY sure the majority of Surprise/Sun City Grand shop there so maybe the odds aren't THAT great! )
13190 Regardless, this is just a great little "market" through and through.

13218 Owner Daniel M. is one of my most favorite restaurateurs in Phoenix.
13219 His stamina and passion for the business of serving fine cuisine is a rare find.
13220 Daniel is from South America but you wouldn't know it; his knowledge of the secret kitchens of Tuscany, Umbria and Amalfi is uncanny.
13221 I know this because I traveled with him and his chef one year on their odyssey through Italy.
13222 Daniel takes special pride in personally choosing a very select few bottles of wine to fit any budget.
13223 OK, it's not Etienne's Different Point of View's list of 4000, but know that any choice you make is going to be a good one.
13224 If you're not sure, just ask for Daniel and tell him what you have in mind -- likely he has (with a wink) a special bottle in the back.
13225 When we traveled through the Italian countryside I was constantly astonished by the warm greetings and special invitations we had from local proprietors who shared with us exquisite homemade wines and dishes made with pride from the finest vegetables and livestock.
13226 We frequently stayed long past closing with the owners and into the night sampling rare port and grappa.
13227 At one restaurant in Orvieto the owner took us deep into the dank recesses of the wine cellar for a special sampling  of cheese and wine.
13228 Talk about knowing people?
13229 One afternoon while drinking our 5th bottle of wine, who walks by but Jan D'Atri!
13230 Wow.
13231 (That's another review.)
13232 And speaking of reviewers, I also ran into Phoenix Magazine's Nikki Buchanan (also extremely nice).
13233 When Daniel first opened in this location with that little stone oven in the corner, it was a pizzeria and guests could belly up to long tables in a casual environment that was made easy by his banter with the heavy Italian accented waitress (name?)
13234 who made a comeback some years later.
13235 For quite some time the restaurant was Il Forno; that is until corporate giant Il Fornaio entered the fray and sued him to change the name.
13236 After much rigmarole he changed to aqua e sale -- and notice Il Fornaio has since closed its doors?
13237 LOL.
13238 Again after much hoopla, he made it Daniel's.
13239 The current wood-paneled decor makes me think of a city club in San Fran or London.
13240 Very posh, yet understated.
13241 Selections of sculpture and art from his travels dot the restaurant's three small dining rooms.
13242 The menu is a very difficult one.
13243 I say that because it has all of your favorites and it is difficult to make your final selection.
13244 Great for steak, ravioli, the best carpaccio in the city, best buffala mozzarella, mmm....
13245 I could go on and on.
13246 So does the menu, page after page.
13247 Some might call the preparations simplistic.
13248 This is the Tuscan way.
13249 Simple ingredients and simple preparation.
13250 Let the ingredients make their own magic.
13251 Grilled rack of lamb is not drowned in some Smucker's lime jelly, but gently brushed with rosemary and garlic, tickled with salt and pepper and finished with a squeeze spray of lemon.
13252 Unfortunately the artful one-of-a-kind plates and bowls handmade in Vietri chipped at the edges over the years and the health department made him throw them away -- UGH!!
13253 -- they were a beautiful motivation to make you lick your plate clean to see the painted pictures beneath your scrumptious dinner.
13254 Not that you needed an excuse to dab every last bit of sauce with the wonderful mini loaves of bread cooked right there in the hearth that started it all.
13255 Daniel himself is a wonderful host.
13256 He loves to give his guests a wonderful experience.
13257 There are many choices for Italian food in Phoenix.
13258 Most of it is just American Italian.
13259 Daniel's is a unique touch of the simple yet elegant.
13260 Enjoy.

13268 Changing Hands is the perfect bookstore.
13269 These types of places just don't seem to exist, but Changing Hands has managed to survive.
13270 Allow me to begin by saying that this bookstore does not have anywhere near the selection of a Barnes and Noble (or probably a Borders, but I don't go into that garbage store and cannot be sure).
13271 With that said, there are a few reasons to shop here.
13272 First, and most importantly, they have well priced used books.
13273 I believe most of their used books are $7.50.
13274 They are also all in pristine condition.
13275 Now, $7.50 used isn't always that great for a paperback.
13276 You can do better online quite often.
13277 What's notable, however, is that their hardcovers are typically $7.50 as well.
13278 This is a fantastic price and is hard to beat.
13279 Second, the location of CH is perfect.
13280 This is one of the best plazas out there.
13281 Wildflower, Trader Joe's, Mac's, Jamba Juice--you can't go wrong.
13282 Third, and finally, Changing Hands is a local store, and many good things come with that.
13283 The staff is extremely friendly.
13284 From what I can tell, they are all hardcore book nerds and you have to love that.
13285 The store also has a very welcoming feel to it.
13286 Once you're in, you will realize how extremely friendly everyone is.
13287 No, not just the staff--the customers.
13288 Everyone is talkative, friendly, and just seems to be happy.
13289 They are all indulging in one of their hobbies in one of the most inviting stores I have ever seen.
13290 Someone will ask the staff "who wrote such and such?".
13291 The staff will almost assuredly spot a regular and ask him or her  "who wrote such and such".
13292 If he doesn't know, someone else will  probably pipe up.
13293 It's this type of thing that makes it a great store.
13294 Overall, it just has a great atmosphere.
13295 The only negative comment I can make about Changing Hands is how hippy it is.
13296 There's a ton of books on spiritual techniques, new age methods, buddhism, and whatever the hell else hippies/hipsters think makes them look more cultured.
13297 Of course, this just goes along with the Tempe, Trader Joe's, and book reading demographic, so I can't blame them for meeting the inherent demand.

13437 I play squash racquet's, a sport favored by the east coast "elites" from them Ivy League schools, those snooty Britishers and the Pakistani leisure class:)
13438 Why they let me play, I'll never know:)
13439 Last evening, we had a little tourney in which a group of us from the Village traveled to the outer reaches of Tempe to play a group from Lifetime Fitness:)
13440 It was a jolly good, show, ever so much fun and our Village group gave the Lifetime group a bit of a "Rodgering":)
13441 So it was with happy hearts and high spirits that we headed down the street to the post tourney repast at Skip & Jan's...let me start by saying that the Lifetime group picked this place, and it's almost like they knew they were going to lose and wanted to select a venue that would be the grimiest, greasiest, grubbiest, grossest spot to try to eat...they succeeded:)
13442 Where to start...I know...the parking lot:)
13443 When we arrived, the total Kelly Blue Book value of the 50-60 cars in the parking lot was about $832...we raised that by several orders of magnitude, just by driving in...this parking lot hasn't seen a lot of traffic from the Mercedes/BMW/Lexus/Jaguar crowd (and may never again:)
13444 After I safely parked a block or 2 away, I went inside and took in the look and feel of S&J...crappy old wood paneling...tables and chairs from a circa 1955 high school cafeteria...an intriguing mix of flat panel TV's, regular TV's and OTB results screens (yeah, you can bet the ponies here...the sport of Kings, in a slightly less than "regal" atmosphere:)
13445 They must have 20-25 pool tables...faded felt...and a whole bunch of people playing pool (and frankly looking like they weren't enjoying themselves...extremely tight and serious expressions on the faces of the people playing and watching...aren't games supposed to be fun?
13446 :-)...I suspect there was gambling going on:)
13447 The smell in S&J can only be described as "extreme humanity"...the place smelled like it has seen a century's worth of spilled beer, cigarette smoke, BO, vomit, urine, spoiled food and every other aroma that humans create for themselves...remarkable, given the fact that this place can't have been here for more than a few years...how did they do that so quickly?
13448 :-)
13449 S&J has menus, they have some sort of kitchen, they have Jagermeister on "tap", they have a bunch of beers on tap and they had a buffet (or "boofay" for my friend Ryan C) set up for our group.
13450 It was supposed to be a Taco Bar:)
13451 S&J provided a table full of taco "fixin's"...the centerpiece of which was the taco meat hot tray...Holy Crap, was that disgusting!
13452 :-(
13453 They told us it was ground beef, but I know my beef, and I don't think this was it...this was ground "creature"...possibly some sort of unfortunate non-distinct animal which happened to be near the kitchen when duty called.
13454 I kid, of course...as far as I know, this was indeed, "beef"...just not very good "beef":(
13455 The hot tray holding the "meat" looked like a relief map of the Hawaiian Islands...small mountains of "meat" rising out of the ocean of brown/orange grease that was the real body of the dish:(
13456 But, I was starving (a banana for breakfast and nothing else) so I tried to make a taco.
13457 I decided to forgo the slotted spoon that everyone was trying to use to fish some meat out of the soupy brine, and use some tongs instead...my idea was to try to squeeze as much grease out of the concoction as possible...I was sort of successful, but in doing so, I probably squeezed any flavor out as well:(
13458 I got back to the table and tried a bite...not good...I added several shakes of Cholla and tried another bite...and that was that:(
13459 One of my buddies had decided to forgo the mystery meat tacos and ordered wings from the menu and offered me one...I'm not sure what the deal with the wings was, but the wing I tried seemed to be boiled (no, not "broiled"...boiled) and then dipped in buffalo sauce...not crispy, just wet...all the way through:)
13460 Then they announced that Karaoke was going to start soon...and that was enough for me:(
13461 Adding amateur singing to this tableau would have just been too much:)
13462 Still, it's not all bad news...the tires and wheels were still on my car when I was ready to leave...I didn't become immediately ill (although I had kind of a rough morning, this morning).
13463 They say shared adversity can make teams grow together, so I think I should thank S&J for making the Village Squash group nearly invincible:)

13705 My first box of NGD arrived a few weeks and tears nearly came to my eyes as I removed the produce from the box.
13706 I haven't seen such beautiful, fresh, well packaged produce since I was a kid (and I'm no spring chicken).

13708 The amazing thing is that I had come to expect most organic vegetables and fruits to be less visually appealing than the chemical type but such is not the case with NGD.
13709 The medium size box has been perfect for our little family of four.
13710 It is delivered on our day like clockwork around 2am.
13711 The unseen elf that drops off the goodies is nice enough to open the carton and place all the contents in our cooler so everything stays nice in this boiling cauldron we call Phoenix.
13712 Furthermore, I live way out in Carefree/Cave Creek where we always expect to be on the list of places too far away for delivery.
13713 Not with NGD.
13714 It appears from the labeling they have optimized their routes so they can include many outlying areas.
13715 Finally, there is a gentleman named Ben that works for NGD.
13716 He has been very helpful in making sure everything is going smoothly and that we are using the service properly.
13717 We think NGD is a great value for organic produce delivered to your door and HIGHLY recommend NGD!

13750 My love affair with Pita Jungle is a long one.....perhaps longer than any other restaurant, certainly longer than I can remember, and at least for the adult portion of my life, which is why it pains me to write this review.
13751 For the last 6 months, I have ordered takeout one day a week from this location, typically on a Friday or Saturday.
13752 The ridiculousness that has become my adult life has necessitated a heavy reliance on takeout for my main source of nourishment.
13753 Although the food is always spot on at Pita, my takeout experience has been anything but.
13754 The prior 3 out of 4 times I went to pick up my food, I ended up waiting past the promised time.
13755 Now I'm not unreasonable, waiting 5 or 10 minutes is not a big deal, but each time has been a wait of 25 to 30+ minutes past the pick up time, with no apologies or explanations.
13756 I was beginning to wonder if they had ever started cooking my food before I got there.
13757 The last time I must've looked really irritated, because I was offered an obligatory baklava for my wait.
13758 Used to the wait, I started showing up 5 to 10 minutes past the promised time, just as preventative maintenance.
13759 Imagine my surprise when my order was ready as promised thie time.
13760 I left with my bag of food and a smile on my face.
13761 I get back to my friend's house, open the bag, and begin to realize just how badly the order has been screwed up.
13762 We ordered 4 items, 3 of which were wrong.
13763 I load one item up and head back to Pita.
13764 Making me wait a ridiculous amount of time for my food is one thing, but blatantly screwing up my order is too much.
13765 As I explain my situation to the takeout girl, she goes to get the Manager who proceeds to inform me that I ordered it wrong.
13766 As I struggle to keep my cool, I inform them that they must be mistaken.
13767 One item was ordered with chicken, my item was turkey, and the other two were salads.
13768 Everything came with chicken.
13769 The salads were for my vegetarian friends, and I'm allergic to chicken.
13770 There's no way you're going to convince me I ordered chicken for myself and two vegetarians.
13771 Sorry, try again.
13772 Without too much ado, the correct dishes were provided, and yet another obligatory baklava was offered.
13773 I declined.
13774 There is only so much wrong that baklava can right.
13775 Don't get me wrong, their baklava is amazing, but it's not going to make up for them screwing up my order, then trying to blame it on me.
13776 Oh, and did I mention that they gave me a coupon for a free appetizer?
13777 Too bad the coupon expires in a few days.
13778 I'm afraid I will be taking my weekly Friday takeout business elsewhere, until enough time has passed that maybe, just maybe, I can find it in my heart to forgive Pita Jungle.
13779 In the meantime, I suggest you try to get it together down there.
13780 In case you missed the count, that's 4 out of the last 5 takeouts you missed the mark on, including 1 you tried to blame on me.
13781 That's shameful.
13782 I went there last night with bf to celebrate our anniversary.
13783 After pre-yelp, we knew what to expect as to prices, so it wasn't so much of a shocker.
13784 To the food, we concur with almost everyone here.
13785 It was impeccable!
13786 We ordered the ice tower for 2 and thought that it was very well presented.
13787 Ours came with 3 appetizers (raw oysters, crab claws and dungeness crab) so it wasn't too high.
13788 They are all fresh.
13789 Growing up I used to go to the beach quite often just to have fresh crabs, so I know what those taste like.
13790 And for 6 years living in the desert, Mastro's is the first and only one in AZ to deliver that.
13791 For main course, I got Ivory Salmon "Oreganata", bf got Swordfish blackened.
13792 I am quite picky when it comes to fish, and bf isn't exactly a fish person, but both of our dishes "surpassed expectation."
13793 I couldn't say much about swordfish except it was fresh.
13794 We had the same dish 2 weeks before at somewhere else, it was nowhere near as sweet and fresh as the one at Mastro's.
13795 It was my first having Ivory Salmon, it was sweeter, and white (hence the name) than normal salmon we get around here.
13796 Mine was good size portion, firm to the touch, but melted in the mouth.
13797 The flavor was subtle enough to enjoy by itself, or you can add one of the sauces provided.
13798 One of my favorite sauces of the night I think was made of minced tomatoes and olives, came with the main course.
13799 Sides were Lobster Mash and Snap peas.
13800 I didn't really care for snap peas as I can make them at home.
13801 But lobster mash is a MUST for those who go there.
13802 I'm not sure how they prepared it, but it felt like mash potatoes made with lobster bisque (instead of water and milk) and added lobster chunks.
13803 It was much more flavorful and creamy than a normal mash potatoes.
13804 It was big enough to share and take home.
13805 One thing though, it hardened up after sitting out for awhile, so I'm not sure if microwave could make it all fluffy again after 1 night in the fridge.
13806 Drinks there are amazing, from the presentation, to the taste, and definitely the amount of alcohol in each drink.
13807 We decided to go with cocktail drinks rather than wines because of other yelpers' reviews.
13808 Total worth it!!
13809 !

13857 Way to go Irma!
13858 We step into a well packed restaurant on a Friday night with plans to try the Sailor's Paella Special and a few cocktails.
13859 We wait for just a few seconds until we are greeted by Irma and her warm smile and are led to our table.
13860 Our cocktail orders are taken immediately, 1 Mojito and 1 White Sangria.
13861 Both exceeded our expectations and were just thing to get our date started.
13862 The ambiance is whimsical and charming - Reminded me of the movie "The Bird Cage" without the drag queens and dramatic dialogue.
13863 Bummer!
13864 Now on to the Paella.
13865 It was the perfect dish for the evening offering plenty of shrimp, calamari, crab, scallops, muscles, tuna and a healthy serving of saffron rice.
13866 This meal also requires a little handy work to get to the crab and muscles but you are given the proper instruments to do so.
13867 This may not be the best choice for those who do not enjoy this kind of food activity but we had a lot of fun with it.
13868 We will be back soon to try another interactive meal and partake of a round or two of Mojitos.
13869 So if you are in the mood for something different, fun, and oh so delicioso, I recommend you try a night out at the Havana Cafe.
13870 I also hope you have the pleasure of meeting a groovy gal who goes by the name Irma.

14382 Here's how to do Pizzeria Bianco the right way:
14383 1.
14384 Show up at 3:30 or earlier to get a good place in line.
14385 Make sure you bring some friends to enjoy the time together and the great food.
14386 2.
14387 At 4:00, the bar opens.
14388 Get yourself a bottle of wine and make the best of the 90 minutes you'll spend just waiting to get on the seating list.
14389 3.
14390 Order a few appetizers from the bar; they're light and fresh and yummy.
14391 4.
14392 When you finally get seated for dinner, don't hold back.
14393 Order salads, share different pizzas, and have a coffee after.
14394 The quality of the food is ABSOLUTELY worth the wait.

14516 This was a Chai with espresso shots.
14517 Press uses a powdered Chai which, in my opinion, works better than the liquid or tea bag forms.
14518 I was also given the option to have my frothy delight in a ceramic cup.
14519 I opted for that.
14520 I felt like i was having the type of coffee house experience I had only just imagined.
14521 Press occupies a well appointed space, too.
14522 From the wood and granite, to the stained concrete floors, I felt as if i were in a European city, not a Phoenix strip mall.
14523 The free wi-fi is a major plus, in my opinion.
14524 Press goes as far as to have a "dog friendly" cart outside, in its ample outdoor seating area.
14525 I spoke with Steve, the owner of Press, at length.
14526 In talking, I asked how Press came to be, and he said that his wife had wanted to open a coffee shop one day.
14527 Well Steve, you have certainly exceeded her expectations, as well as the residents of the Greater Phoenix area.
14528 By the way, Press serves sandwiches and soups, as well as an extensive list of wines.
14529 Check it out, the staff will make you feel at home, or like you're on vacation in the cozy European city of your choice.
14530 I am a huge tea drinker, so when I found out about Teavana I was excited.
14531 I entered the store and an employee asked if I cared to try some tea.
14532 After sampling several different blends, I chose three to purchase.
14533 The employee asked if I wanted to get a large canister for a dollar more than the one I had picked.
14534 Not realizing this store sells tea by the ounce rather than per canister, I said "sure."
14535 He chatted as he filled the containers, never mentioning the price, and once done took my debit card and rang me up.
14536 I didn't pay attention to the cost and when I looked at the receipt when I got home my heart nearly stopped.
14537 I spent $350 on tea.
14538 I returned it and they didn't give me too much trouble.
14539 Now I always check the total before handing my card over, and I won't go back.
14540 I feel like they totally swindled me.

14613 Several months (maybe over a year?)
14614 ago my husband read a newspaper article about the Clover coffee maker and the one place in town that had managed to procure one.
14615 I was skeptical (as is my nature).
14616 It can't be that much better right?
14617 You're just saying it's amazing because you want to talk about the new hot coffee shop you discovered, right?
14618 Well, maybe.
14619 But I love this place.
14620 And I don't think it has a whole lot to do with the Clover.
14621 They roast their own beans and they roast them way differently than that other ginormous coffee chain - all a light or medium roast.
14622 Never bitter, never oily, never yucky.
14623 The coffee they make there is, obviously, the best.
14624 But I send my husband in every week now to buy a pound of beans so that I can approximate the same coffee at home.

14824 "Fine dining" is not just a setting.
14825 it isn't just good food.
14826 It is many things that add up to an attitude.
14827 I have had the opportunity to find it in different cities.
14828 I found it the other night at the Stockyards.
14829 We were seated by a host who took us to our table and when we were properly seated gave us menus.
14830 Our server came to the table and introduced herself and said she would return shortly.
14831 It was nice to have a moment to chat before we had to think about ordering.
14832 When she did return,  our glasses were filled-not something we should have  to wait for her to do when the service is right.
14833 She knew the selections on the menu and all available options and could make sensible comments concerning them.
14834 Our salads were served promptly by two additional people and were as fresh as I could ask for.
14835 When my friend was finished with hers they asked if they could take her plate.
14836 I was pleased when they didn't ask me if I was finished with my salad and could they take my plate.
14837 If I'd been finished I could have told them.
14838 We were able to continue our conversation uninterrupted as I finished my salad.
14839 The salad plate was removed  when it was appropriate and we had a few minutes before the entrees were served.
14840 All was in keeping with a relaxed dining.
14841 At no time did I have to think about having drinks refilled, it just happened quietly.
14842 After a few minutes our dinners were served by the two gentlemen and our server appeared to make sure they were to our satisfaction before we started.
14843 There was no room for error there that couldn't be resolved before we started.
14844 My friend had ordered a small steak.
14845 My friend is  quite elderly and Kathy, our server, discretely asked her if she'd like it cut for her.
14846 A potato also was served with her dish.
14847 I asked my friend which of the condiments she would like it prepared with.
14848 She look at me and said "Prepared with?"
14849 She didn't understand what I was getting at but Kathy did and was already reaching for the potato.
14850 She opened the potato and smiled while my friend said a bit of everything.
14851 One doesn't go to a restaurant like the stockyards to have to deal with opening a hot potato and preparing it.
14852 When serving is done properly, these things don't have to be discussed.
14853 Kudos to, Kathy!!!.
14854 That is part of the fine dining experience.
14855 I had a full rack of ribs which were so tender the meat fell of them.

14942 1.
14943 Look at menu.
14944 2.
14945 Decide what you want.
14946 3.
14947 Wait your turn to order.
14948 4.
14949 Order (give your name).
14950 5.
14951 Wait your turn to be called to pay the other girl for the order you placed.
14952 6.
14953 Pay her.
14954 7.
14955 Wait until your food is ready.
14956 8.
14957 Leave with your food.

15208 It's romantic if you're on a date, it's festive if you're with your family and it's just pure fun if you're with friends.
15209 You enter the park to be immediately greeted by hundreds of meowganificant Luminarias lighting up the entire garden.
15210 Cocktail stations lie in every knook and cranny and they serve delicious festive drinks like my favorite, hot cocoa and raspberry vodka!
15211 If you're hungry, they sell food throughout the garden at two locations.
15212 Then there are the performers.
15213 The DBG does an amazing job of bringing in musicians of every shape and size.
15214 Whether it's a trio of Christmas carolers, a mariachi band or a lively Jazz band, they have bands in every corner lighting up the night!
15215 I am also continuously impressed with the acoustics of the garden.
15216 With so many live acts in one area, you can barely hear a specific act until you are in that area.

15365 I love breakfast food and the "specialty" won me over instantly; PROTEIN PANCAKES!
15366 As the timeless Tina Turner once said, "Simply the Best!".
15367 That describes these pancakes perfectly.
15368 Before I go on and on about the pancakes (because I have been known to do so) some background information about atmosphere, staff etc.
15369 This location is in a nondescript one story building in front of the offices at Mill Towne Center (or is it Mill Town Centre?).
15370 Nothing fancy, but I don't need a "Jacket Required" sort of feel to a place to enjoy my breakfast.
15371 The staff is fantastic; hosts/hostesses, waitresses, busboys.
15372 I have never had anyone employed here be anything but 100% professional and attentive.
15373 To speak to something others have mentioned about getting the check early (while they are still eating); as long as you continue to be my waitress (i.e.
15374 refills, requests for jelly, etc.)
15375 I don't care if you bring the bill with the food.
15376 If I decide I want something else, I doubt any of the folks here would have a problem reprinting a corrected bill.
15377 Now on to the food!
15378 !
15379 The protein pancakes are filled with blueberries, granola, cinnamon and silvered almonds.
15380 The ingredients aren't something exotic, but they are perfectly balanced in the mix (not too much or too little of any of them).
15381 The thing about any food item you like at a restaurant, it becomes a favorite because they are able to duplicate it time after time.
15382 I have had this item many times (more than any other item), and they are always spot on (knock on wood) :).
15383 All the other dishes I have had (always breakfast, haven't tried lunch yet) were some combination of eggs and protein, and the eggs are always perfectly cooked to my specification (over medium), and the meat always juicy.
15384 I promise to write another review as soon as I don't get the protein pancakes (which will be when they decide to remove them from the menu - NEVER).
15385 :) Oh, or if I actually go in later than normal and feel like lunch over breakfast (not good odds :O).

15641 The food is fresh and prepared to order.

15658 Or too sweet?"

15769 "If you buy half a duck, you don't get to pick which duck."
15770 I lived in China, mainly Guangdong, for three years, and all it really took was a look at this sign, along of course with all the wonderful roasted ducks and pork, to know I had come across a place with bona fides.
15771 Hope Kee has some of the very best Chinese food in town, in my opinion, and is worth the trip from wherever it is in the valley that you live.
15772 I don't know anywhere else in town you can get such good congee, which is actually called "zhou" or "jook," and which is a soupy, delicious rice porridge.
15773 They're also one of the only places you can get dried scallop soup, which they do an excellent job of.
15774 Dried scallops, a specialty of HK/Guangdong, are one of the most delicious things in the world.
15775 Everything that they make is delicious, and sitting in there listening to the customers and staff talk in Chinese and Cantonese can really take you back to China, if you've had the pleasure of spending time there.
15776 Otherwise it's just about as close as you can get.
15777 If you want to eat some real Chinese food that is both delicious and approachable, and very reasonably priced, you can't beat Hope Kee.
15778 Get some soup or some congee, some clams with black bean sauce, some greens and some BBQ, and you'll see why China and Hope Kee are such hard places to stay away from.
15779 If you do decide to try your hand at duck-picking and buy a whole duck, fear not for wasted leftovers, because roasted duck makes for a very tasty soup.
15780 How can something so simple taste sooo good?
15781 I wish there were one more on the west side.

15835 As a frequent antiques consumer, I can honestly say that Lizabel's Treasures is my favorite antique store in Phoenix.
15836 I've been a customer for several years, and Lizabel's is my first (and often only) stop.
15837 Why Lizabel's is such a treasure is because of these things: price, desirable antiques, and great customer service.
15838 John and Bette know what people want, and they go to great lengths to get the antiques that people want and to make their customers happy.
15839 I'm a believer.
15840 They consistently have one-of-a-kind quality furniture and pieces that you would not normally find elsewhere in town.
15841 Pieces are priced very agreeably, so you can afford to stock up or furnish a whole room without busting the bank.
15842 John and Bette have created the kind of family business that is to be admired.
15843 They have a legion of supportive customers, and I'm one of them.
15844 I can always find them to be helpful and interested in getting me what I want, even if I don't always know what I want.
15845 Lisabel's Treasures is the place to build a relationship with, because as one's life's needs changes, so does the need for different pieces and furniture.
15846 I can always count on finding something I really love at their store, and you will, too.

15932 This is often called the largest mall in Arizona, and it shows.
15933 Each time I've done the usual "mall walk" I've easily lost a few hours trying to see it all.
15934 It's true that this isn't a place for anyone that doesn't care about fashion - but this is a mall that's true to its name.
15935 "Fashion Center" is no joke here.
15936 Lots of high-end designer stores, lots of mid-range affordable fashion stores, and a few random familiar stops like Hallmark and Pottery Barn-esque stores scattered through there.
15937 A decent food court, with a theater also conveniently down there.
15938 (But after spending so many hours at the mall, who has time for a movie?)
15939 You can easily drop a few thousand here, so be forewarned if you're on a budget.
15940 Also, I almost wish I had a map in my pocket, because it can get confusing to remember which hallways you've already explored.
15941 And wear some comfortable walking shoes, because it's not easy to get in and get out of this one.
15942 But there's a good number of parking to use in a garage or few - when you remember where you parked the car.
15943 I'd take any out-of-towner here, unless they had a grudge against fashion, classy stores, or walking.

15947 I love bacon, and if you don't love it as much as I do, the bacon overload may be too much, I swear there might be more bacon than egg in this bacon bomb!

15959 I know the drill and have seen more than one vacation be sucked in to the great black hole of "well of course I want  to have the best care".
15960 The first thing I noticed is that there is NO odor.
15961 It doesn't smell like there have been decades of animals paraded through the doors that feel the need to pee as soon as they enter the room... just in case this is their one last shot at leaving something behind.
15962 Then there is the overall feel of the place.
15963 The office I used to frequent always had a frenetic sort of feel to it.
15964 Files were lost, techs were running, the waiting room was packed with stressed out clients, etc.
15965 This office was peaceful.
15966 Whether is natural or contrived, I could care less.
15967 My dog picked up on it immediately and her normal "OMG what are we doing HERE?!!"
15968 behavior was replaced with something I've never witnessed in a vet office before.
15969 She was calm!
15970 It's clean!
15971 Except for the area around me that was covered in the undercoat that Zoe was stress releasing, there were no traces of other animals.
15972 The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.
15973 I had a HUGE file that I was bringing in and they patiently sorted through the entire thing.

15975 I thought that was a wonderful, time-saving offer and in the event that I ever have to go with an emergency and am not able to focus on paperwork.
15976 Finally, I was in an examination room at the time of my appointment and waited less than 3 minutes for both the tech and the Dr.
15977 I was in an out under 1 hour and that my friends is superior service IMHO.

16051 Ahhh, Four Peaks.
16052 By far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.
16053 This place is fantastic as far as brew pubs go - great beer and great food to go with it.
16054 I can't believe I haven't taken the time to review it yet...
16055 The Beer: pretty consistently awesome.
16056 All the beers are at least "good," my favorites being 8th Street Ale and their IPAs (Hop Knot and Raj).
16057 I have to say the Kiltlifter is a tad overrated, but still pretty solid, and worth a try.
16058 I've been meaning to try one of their cask conditioned ales, but they always seem to be out, probably indicative of the quality of those selections.
16059 The Food: fantastic!
16060 I can't say that I've ever had a bad meal at Four Peaks.
16061 The Italian Beef Beer Bread is the best thing on the menu, but you can't go wrong with the Chicken Fingers, Chicken Salad Pita, or really any of their sandwiches.
16062 The fries are also great here - there's a little crispy coating on the outside that is quite tasty.
16063 Oh, and the Spicy Thai Hummus is also a really good appetizer.
16064 A little more liquidy than your average hummus, but really good.
16065 It has a nice little kick to it that will have you reaching for your beer.
16066 Bottom line, if you live in Phoenix, like beer, and enjoy eating a good meal, then you should be shot if you don't like Four Peaks.
16067 If you haven't been yet, do yourself a favor and try it.
16068 You'll come away happy, I promise.

16071 Soups are fantastic, sandwiches are hearty and flavorful, and the service is excellent.

16483 But if that were the case, I wouldn't be ordering the salad again and again.
16484 The field greens and romaine lettuce are served with avocado (I'm pretty sure they use at least 1/2 an avocado for each salad), artichoke hearts, tomatoes, bacon (no bacon bits here!
16485 ), radishes, blue cheese, egg, cucumbers  and I'm sure i'm forgetting something else, but it is GOOD.
16486 Sometimes, if I'm really hungry, I order it with a side of their twice baked casserole (twice baked potato in a cup, basically.
16487 It's unbelievable.)
16488 I'd also recommend the Arizona caviar (black bean salad) or southwest coleslaw.
16489 My dad loves their BBQ sandwiches (with choice of homemade barbecue sauce - each one better than the last), my mom usually orders one of their other great salads with a side of potato pancakes (better than grandma's), and grandpa loves whatever is on special.
16490 Even my picky-eater brother loves food at Open Range - and that's saying something!
16491 Bethany and Tom are the owners; Bethany does most of the kitchen cooking and Tom says that he's in charge of most of the barbecuein'.
16492 (He once gave my family a taste of some of their freshly smoked pecans and WHOA, they were GOOD.)
16493 The restaurant (as the name suggests) has a full service deli too, in case you need a pound of freshly sliced ham as well as a meal.
16494 In the past, the service has been slow, but it has improved dramatically over the past year.
16495 The restaurant has a killer view of the Superstition Mountains, and is within 10 - 20 minutes of countless hiking trails.
16496 To make this long review short: if you're looking for a tastes-like-home (or tastes-better-than-home) cooked meal and you're in the far east valley, make sure to stop in for lunch or dinner.
16497 You'll probably see my family and me chowing down too.
16498 One of the perks to being an only child, is "me" time.
16499 There is something special about having time to yourself, when the only obligation you have is to check in on Yelp, leave a quick tip, and grab a lemonade from the mall because it is 109 degrees outside.

16501 I had stumbled across The Art of Shaving.

16504 I'm vain.
16505 2.
16506 I'm hairless.

16515 Both were passed down by my Grandfather who passed away when I was a teenager.

16517 They even gave me a proper demo on how to use it properly with my brush.
16518 I've been used to shaving soaps and the usual aerosol creams....so the little tutorial was nice.

16960 Just like the menu says, their Pad Thai has a plethora of intense flavors, to the point where every bite is unique.
16961 If you love Pad Thai and haven't tried Wild Thaiger's, you need to.
16962 If you don't love Pad Thai, it's probably because you haven't tried Wild Thaiger's.
16963 :)  Seriously, this is one of the best dishes I've found in Phoenix.
16964 Their other dishes are consistently good as well.
16965 I love Chicken Satay, but most places only offer it as an appetizer, with a few skimpy chicken strips.
16966 Wild Thaiger, on the other hand, has a filling Peanut Chicken lunch, as well as a Peanut Passion dinner, both drenched in their delicious peanut sauce.
16967 Their curries are very flavorful and make for a superb and hearty dinner, but if you're going for lunch, you may want to consider Thai Basil up the road as their curry lunch combo includes a salad and other extras.
16968 Their Thai Tea is strong yet creamy, just like it should be, and you can even add boba to it.
16969 A must if you're eating anything spicy.
16970 The service is very professional and timely.
16971 The atmosphere is pretty classy, in fact, it's probably the nicest-looking Thai restaurant I've been to.
16972 It's also the only Thai restaurant I can think of with a patio.
16973 All in all, it has a very welcoming atmosphere.
16974 I would feel just as comfortable here in a suit as I would a T-shirt and jeans.
16975 It's a great place for dates, business lunches, or just some great take-out.

17183 Pauli from ATL checking in here.... just for a bit of nostalgia...
17184 I used to live in Phoenix a few years back, and of all the places I miss eating at, this is #1 on my list.
17185 I remember how I first heard of the place....
17186 I was over at a friend's house in Scottsdale having a few beers after work, and remember asking him what his favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix was.
17187 My friend, who had more than just a few beers in him, stared at me all glassy-eyed, got right in my face and said... "Cheeeeno Banddddeeedo!!"
17188 As I backed up a bit, thinking my friend had too much to drink (he had, for sure), I wondered... hmmm...the Chinese Bandit?
17189 What the hell is that place about?!?
17190 Or is he just f***ing with me?
17191 So, I asked him what kind of food they serve there... And, as he did his best to focus on me, when his eyes hit mine, there was this long pause.... and he had this expression on his face that I can't forget...
17192 I wasn't sure if he was having trouble putting it into words or if he was sh***ing in his pants.
17193 And then he put his hands together, like a nutjob working a Rubik's cube.... and said, "They... dooo... things... like.... egg-foooo youngggg burrritos and jaaaade red chicken tacossssss...."..... as he gave me another crazy-ass look (the kind that tells you it's time to say goodnight and get outta there - which I did)....
17194 So, a few days later, I remembered his drunken explanation of Chino Bandido and thought I would go check the place out.... And from that point on, I was hooked.
17195 Egg foo young burritos indeed!
17196 And jerk fried rice!
17197 And those refried black beans with fire-in-the-bungholio sauce mixed in.... Yep, those will burn you twice... All served in a giant disposable aluminum baking dish... And you got that combo, along with a soda and tip for about $10!!!
17198 WOW!
17199 !
17200 At that time, I had never seen anything like it before, and I still miss eating there more than any of my favorite old haunts in Phoenix....
17201 I wish somebody would franchise one out to Atlanta - I would be the first customer in the door on opening day, guaranteed....

17214 -Shawn
17215 A chain, yes.
17216 But par for the course, no.
17217 First of all, they have an extensive wine list, which includes a rare type of sparkling wine, called Brachetto.
17218 In this area, DUI's are more common than a cold, and it's a light and tasty wine, with a low alcohol content.
17219 So it's option is great for me.
17220 It also goes great with everything they serve, because of it's unique flavor profile.
17221 Lizzie was our waitress, and offered options and suggestions, which actually saved us quite a bit of money on the whole.
17222 Not that, by any stretch of the imagination, is this a place to go when you are not intending a big splurge.
17223 This is a place to take it slow and spend slightly over a decent amount.
17224 The food, however, is absolutely worth it.
17225 We tried the Cheddar fondue, which could have used a bit more mustard powder and worstershire sauce, but on the whole was delicious.
17226 It was well prepped, and Lizzie explained what she was adding and why the whole time.
17227 The veggie selection is a bit mundane, and that's really my only complaint.
17228 We ate the "big night out" prix fix menu and chose the "Fusion" option which had lobster tail, shrimp, brats, ravioli, new york strip, sirloin steak, and a marinated chicken.
17229 We cooked it in the Boullion method which is just a flavored broth.
17230 Because it's not oil, you do need to add 30 sec to a min to the suggested cook times, but it was a lot lighter than using the oil and we didn't come home smelling like oil.
17231 The california salad was incredible.
17232 It had mixed greens, sliced roma tomatoes, chopped pecans, and blue cheese crumbles with a rasberry black walnut dressing.
17233 It's been a long time since I was able to truly enjoy a salad, and this was amazing.
17234 The chocolate we chose was the Smore.
17235 It was milk chocolate, marshmallow creme flambeed with grahm cracker bits added after the fire goes out.
17236 It's served with 2 types of coated marshmallows, pound cake, a slice of cheese cake, and a bowl of sliced strawberries and bananas.
17237 Just enough to fill us up, but we didn't overstuff ourselves.
17238 Our dinner was leisurely paced and took us about 2 to 2 1/2 hrs to get through.
17239 This is pretty normal for fondue.
17240 You do have the option of sitting at the bar and having just a cheese or chocolate, if you are on a time constraint though.
17241 It's located in a great little shopping and dining area that wasn't too crowed last night, but I think that was more due to the weather, than the actual popularity of the place.
17242 Jason Silberschlag pulls off a pretty amazing thing here in the metro-PHX area.
17243 Three shops with their own quirky details, passion and identity.
17244 Each tailors specifically to the demographic at hand, which I can totally get behind.
17245 The fact that each shop has its own deal going on is awesome - I really dislike chains and the chain feel/look.
17246 I hadn't seen Jason in a while at the other shops, the times I'd frequented, and was happy to see him behind the bar when I came here for the first time.
17247 Just the same way the other Cartel shops have a selection of brewing methods, this one does as well.

17550 Lee's is the best privately owned ice cream parlor in Scottsdale!
17551 Located in Old Town Scottsdale in the heart of some prime dining locations, Lee's is a great night cap in the form of ice cream, a superb place to bring a date or all in all just a wonderful atmosphere to enjoy some ice cream con alcohol.
17552 Let's start with the aesthetics; Lee's offers a very clean, small, cozy environment.
17553 A few table and chair sets dot the inside and a couple more to match on the outside.
17554 Lee has some awesome glass vases on the wall that add a modern touch.
17555 She has a few large clocks with different time zones so you know what time it is on the east coast while you eat?
17556 I dunno the clocks were kind of a head scratcher.
17557 The Service is spectacular!
17558 Lee is the only help I've ever received there, so I am not sure if she works alone or has help.
17559 She is always timely and prompt to greet and serve you and automatically starts you off with TWO samples of which ever flavors you would like.
17560 All the young ones like myself be prepared to show ID, although you would have to eat a lot of ice cream to get loaded, Lee doesn't skimp on the booze either.
17561 Lee is usually a bit on the quiet side so you gotta listen up and be as patient with her as she is with you.
17562 The lady is running the joint by herself!
17563 The Product is what makes Lee's so good!
17564 Her ice cream flavors are inventive and wonderful.
17565 There is usually new options as well a few solid customer favorites too choose from.
17566 As pre-mentioned Lee does pack a fair amount of liquor in her ice cream so some of the flavors have a stronger alcohol flavor than others.
17567 The Jack Daniel's chocolate swirl is my personal favorite and has the perfect amount of bourbon to chocolate ratio to make a unique, delectable treat.
17568 Lee does offer non-alcoholic flavors (at a discounted price, too!)
17569 for those opt to take there alcohol and ice cream separate.
17570 The cookie dough flavor may be the best ice cream I have tried with or without booze.

17627 Now in my history with management; a decent manager would offer to remove the collection of dishes but instead he decided to ask us if we needed anything else since the look on our faces was disgust.
17628 Instead we opted to inform Joe that we would enjoy our meal a little better with silverware and napkins.
17629 He acknowledged that was a novel concept and proceeded to fetch us a pair.
17630 Joe wasn't six steps away before he was interrupted by a member of the waitstaff who informed him that what she needed was more important than delivering two setups to some first time customers so they could enjoy their ever increasingly cold food.
17631 At this point my girlfriends temper got the best of her and she jumped up and retrieved her own silverware off of a table in front of Joe and eager waitress to salvage any heat that might have been left in our entrees.

17911 I rarely give 5 stars, as I believe it is very difficult to obtain a perfect score through food, beverage, service, ambiance, etc.
17912 Christopher's new venture is perfectly Christopher, 5 stars.
17913 First off a little background, Christopher is a native.
17914 That's right; he's a graduate of Central High School.
17915 He studied in France where he honed his craft and to this day draws his technique from.
17916 He has owned now three ventures in Phoenix, first his fine dining and bistro location on the northwest corner of 24st and Camelback (later became Eddie's by Eddie Matney, former hair dresser turned chef at Cous-Cous then Eddie's Grill) then after closing he moved to the restaurant row in The Biltmore Fashion Park, 2rd level to open Christopher's Fermier Brasserie & Paola's Wine Bar.
17917 Which in reading many reviews here on Yelp was unfortunately misunderstood.
17918 It makes me wonder if people understand what French is, it's not their fault though, there aren't many French restaurants in town, most have be closed, including Mary Elaine's at the Phoenician  and John Claude's Petite Cafe.
17919 There are a few that still survive Sophie's and Vincent's, but in this town of chains few people venture for French.
17920 Now with Christopher's Restaurant/Crush Lounge he has passed on the wine bar and opened a lounge instead.
17921 Christopher does enjoy lounges as he is a regular at Merc Bar, but then so is his smoked salmon which is offered on the Merc Bar menu.
17922 So a lounge makes sense, I'm a believer in a chef should open what they are passionate about.
17923 The new location has a different feel from his previous; his last venture echoed a French Countryside feel, as did the food.
17924 I think that was why many didn't understand it; yes it was French, but ALL FRENCH IS NOT FINE DINNING.
17925 I wish more understood that concept, but this is primarily a beer drinking state, not wine or rather more Mc D's not Mary E's!
17926 Hence there's a difference between filling your stomach and filling your soul and leaving a restaurant inspired with the feeling that life is wonderful.
17927 Christopher's is the latter.
17928 The design is contemporary with long lines of brushed stainless, white linen and exposed wooden beams.
17929 Kudos to whoever designed it, great job!
17930 The tables are dressed with white linen, elegant silver and polished stemware.
17931 You can't help but feel that it's 'time to dine' when seated.
17932 The walls in the main dining room have many vases of fresh flowers that seem to be replaced whenever necessary, nice touch.
17933 The food at Christopher's is exactly what you'd expect, French, without the super-high-end prices.
17934 He's still one of the only chefs in town serving Foie Grass and Duck Confite, both wonderful and worth the trip if a glass of juice (wine) is added!
17935 I've been there now on 4 occasions and everything is fantastic, flavorful and prepared professionally.
17936 Christopher offers daily specials and I recommend them including; Veal Chop on Wednesdays, Roasted Duck on Thursday, Lamb Shank on Friday and Rabbit on Saturday.
17937 But don't stop at your entree, get the cheese course for dessert or for something sweet, the Chocolate Tower is one of the best desserts in town, hands down, no question.
17938 Service is another point were Christopher sets himself apart.
17939 It doesn't get any better than this.
17940 Again it's NOT fine dining, so you can't compare it to fine dining restaurants (but then again there's only one left in the valley - Different Point Of View).
17941 The servers know the food; they can describe anything on the menu and recite the specials as if their job depends on it (if you know Christopher it probably is).
17942 Food is coursed correctly with a few minutes in between, as well as wine service is as professional as it gets.
17943 The bread service is as always, French breads with a super rich, euro butter, perfect for lapping up to sauce or vinaigrette remains on your plate.
17944 Needless to say, Christopher does it right, in my opinion, or is it just my opinion?
17945 Many of the valley's most celebrated chefs eat at Christopher's, he's know in many circles as the "chef's chef".
17946 But don't take my word for it, ask the chef at your favorite restaurant, who their favorite chefs are in town, and favorite restaurants, most likely Christopher will make the list!
17947 Here's the web address:  http://www.christophersaz.com/
17948 The website is limited; menu, wine list, press release and pictures of the restaurant...
17949 Hands down, best slices in Scottsdale....
17950 Just don't.

17953 I had the tacos, they may be small, but they were packed by taste.

17989 There was a longer than normal wait for the food however, the server was very attentive and I thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance as we had drinks in garden.
17990 I would not recommend this place for a quick meal but it's perfect if you bring friends and want to have time to relax and enjoy conversation!
17991 Try the Larb, it is on happy hour and it even comes in tofu as a veggie option.
17992 This one dish alone ($5) at happy hour would make me love this place but there were many more delights that made my visit so great.
17993 I don't drink with dinner but here it was happy hour all day sat, and they had a unique drink the Curry Gimlet, IT comes in a martini glass has a orange hue, it is fruity but has a curry finish from cardamom I assume, truly unique.
17994 Our dishes of Pad See ewe and Dragon noodles were great, and huge portions.
17995 Rich flavors, well textured tofu and crisp veggies.
17996 When I made my reservation I let them know about the birthday of the person I was with.
17997 We were surprised with fried banana and ice cream along with a candle and signing it was great!

18001 I saw a piece in the local rag about C4 and since we're already in Moon Valley I say 'how 'bout it'.
18002 Jeff agrees and we're off -
18003 We arrived just before 4 - closing time and the bartender/waitperson was reeeeally nice.
18004 She told us we had only a few minutes to order because the kitchen would be closing and that the pizza oven was already off.
18005 No worries, we remain unfazed.
18006 We sat at a high top next to the bar, there were a few other people at tables nearby, some drinking coffee and one couple enjoying the bruschetta and some wine on a leather sofa by the large fireplace.
18007 The room hits just the right notes for me, warm and inviting, nice art but not overpowering - its a place I could hang out in.
18008 We both had a nice glass [generous pour] of a Voga Pinot Gris and a sandwich.
18009 I had smoked salmon, Jeff had roast beef.
18010 The smoked salmon was a generous portion with capers, cuke and tomato and a what seemed to be a seasoned mayo [not goat cheese as the online menu suggests but a nice and savory compliment just the same] on a toasted baguette.
18011 Roast beef was similar in scale, lots of meat with melted cheddar, greens also on a toasted baguette.
18012 Each was served with a side of chips and a pickle.
18013 It may have been me or just the mood I was in but I really felt relaxed there and in spite of the fact that we closed the place for the afternoon, we didn't feel rushed or in the way.
18014 It was just a nice, shoulder dropping, ahhhh experience.
18015 Not the spa, but just what the doctor ordered.

18130 Tour de Tavern is a tribute to tipsy teamwork and a perfect way to host a unique group event.
18131 As "pedalers" on their inaugural tour, we enjoyed the celebrity treatment of cruising down the winding streets of Old Town Scottsdale as onlookers snapped photos and cheered us on!
18132 We rocked out to top 40 hits and, by special request, our Lonely Island favorites on their awesome sound system.
18133 Our guides were flexible and let our party run the show.
18134 If we needed more time for let's say...... an impromptu horseback ride in front of Shotgun Betty's, they were more than happy to wait.
18135 As an added bonus everyone gets to burn off some of those unwanted cocktail calories in between your favorite watering holes.
18136 If you are concerned that after a few stops (and a few shots) your legs might lose some of that forward momentum, there are a few coveted "non pedaling" seats in the back of the bike.
18137 We all compromised with a friendly and fair rotation system.
18138 Our tour guides were helpful, accommodating, and entertaining.
18139 They even proved to be exceedingly patient upon discovering that we did in facts have "that guy" in our group.
18140 If you're saying to yourself,  "Such a marvelous experience could only cost an arm and least the majority of a leg" then you would be wrong!
18141 With the cost of gas being substituted for sheer earth friendly man power, our group of fifteen people spent less than $30 bucks each for the experience.
18142 But wait, there's more!
18143 Included in this price are all the amazing special deals that Tour de Tavern exclusively brings you at select bars along the route.
18144 On our tour we were offered drinks specials ranging from $3 to ONE PENNY!
18145 I say this in all caps because it's ONE PENNY!
18146 So next time you are planning an event, I recommend Tour de Tavern 100%!

18826 I was visiting Tempe for Ironman Arizona and came down with pretty acute foot injury three days prior to the race.
18827 The friendly receptionist at Dr. Natcher's office understood the predicament I was in and managed to fit me into Dr. Natcher's schedule within a couple hours of my call.
18828 Dr. Natcher's is clearly both a great doctor and a great person; she is extremely competent, friendly, and sympathetic.
18829 As an  runner and cyclist, she is also in tune with sports injuries and the mentality of an athlete.
18830 She quickly diagnosed the injury and prescribed an aggressive treatment protocol.
18831 I was in good shape on race day (due to her treatment protocol) and am so very thankful to Dr. Natcher for putting me in the position to complete the race in fine fashion.
18832 I was paying out-of-pocket, and  was very pleasantly surprised by the cost of the office visit.

18906 We-Ko-Pa has been prominently listed as one of the places to play if you are in Arizona.
18907 I first played it several years ago, and it has become one of my favorite desert courses in Arizona.
18908 There are two courses - Cholla, and Saguaro, and although they are both desert courses, they are somewhat different.
18909 The cholla course is an older, more mature course and doesn't have the same feel as the Saguaro course.
18910 The Saguaro course can be walked, but has a wild side to it and to me, seems to have more elevation changes.
18911 That said, both courses are immaculate, wonderful condition, and a joy to play.
18912 Over the years, I have played the Saguaro course more, but lately the Cholla course has grown on me.
18913 Now when my golfing buddies come down, I always make it a point to play both courses with them.
18914 This has led to some interesting memories.
18915 The first time we played, despite my warnings, one of the players wandered off the Saguaro course and found a Jumping Cholla.
18916 He liked it so much, he brought it back to us - stuck all down one side of his body.
18917 It took us quite a while to get them off of him - and then he wanted us to give him extra strokes.
18918 Not a chance.
18919 Another time, one of my friends teed off on a par 3 on the Cholla course, and hit it into a dry creek bed.
18920 He seemed to lose his composure, and hit five provisionals, which also went into the desert.
18921 Then he found his first ball, and ended up with a par!!
18922 Of course, we haven't let him forget the five provisionals...
18923 I have read some comments about the marshals on the course, and in the past would agree.
18924 However, the last two times we played, the marshals have been very good - very courteous and very helpful.
18925 The last time, while we were playing cart path only, one of the players was very slow (as usual) and the female marshal most diplomatically asked us to speed up.
18926 She was one of the nicest, most courteous marshals I have had experience with, and consequently, one of the most effective.
18927 The courses have a nice driving range, chipping and sand area, and putting greens.
18928 Unfortunately, they no longer allow you to use them, unless you are playing one of the courses (you used to be able to pay a daily fee to use them).
18929 Finally, the service is friendly and courteous - from the drop off, to the restaurant, to the desk personnel, I have had nothing but pleasant experiences with the employees.
18930 I think any golfer should experience these courses at least once - a visit would be well worth it.

19119 I became a full member today after also researching Shooter's World, Phoenix Rod & Gun, and Scottsdale Gun Club (where I will also become a member).
19120 The cost is VERY reasonable at $85/year ($110 after adding the initial administrative fee).
19121 The club is huge (140 acres).
19122 There is a main range for members and the public.
19123 Then, there are multiple other shooting areas for members only.
19124 You can shoot out to 500 yards at this facility AND you can shoot any weapon.
19125 The only restrictions appear to be on the allowable ammo.

19146 Being a former band nerd in high school, so much nostalgia kicked in upon entering the museum.
19147 I saw all the instruments I was familiar with in high school, and many others that I wasn't familiar with (and learned much about).
19148 They supply you with headphones and a wireless receiver that plays the audio/video of the different sections you walk into.
19149 Each plays a sample of what the instruments sound like and some give detailed history on the instrument.
19150 Very enlightening experience.
19151 Best Part IMO: They have a room where you get to test random instruments to your heart's content!
19152 I really wanted to go ham on the gong but there was a sign that said something along the lines of "do not hit the gong repeatedly".
19153 I was disappoint... but otherwise many other instruments in there kept me occupied for awhile (xylophone, conga, harp, etc)
19154 It's not an arm and a leg to get inside, and this place has something for everybody.
19155 You're sure to spend a few hours enjoying yourself here.
19156 If you're going to do anything in Phoenix, this is one of the spots you should definitely check out.

19274 ), Lantana (evil and will not die!
19275 ), 2 Trumpet vines (attracts hummingbirds!)

19278 Just ask!
19279 Need something transplanted?
19280 Buy the pots and they'll replant your plants for you.

19310 Green....how I love thee.
19311 Green may be vegan/vegetarian, but I certainly wouldn't claim it to be 'health' food.
19312 Green is located in a small run down strip mall adjacent to Kore Bicycles on the NW corner of Scottsdale Road and McKellips.
19313 It doesn't look like much from the outside and without knowing of Green you probably wouldn't do a second take upon passing it, however the food here is no less than amazing!
19314 The decor is unique and fresh; 10-12 tables, a couch/lounge area, random artwork on the walls, painted quotes, lights hanging from the ceiling, and old painted car doors along one wall.
19315 I've tried a random assortment of items from the menu and nothing has disappointed me...but by far my favorite is the BBQ 'Chicken' sandwich along with an appetizer of the spicy buffalo wings.
19316 I believe the mock chicken Green uses is fungus based, Quorn perhaps (may not sound appetizing but it is freaking awesome).
19317 I am not personally vegan, or even vegetarian for that matter but Green has me hooked.
19318 I've 'forced' many of my meat eating friends to try Green and they have all become believers (if you could call sharing something so wonderful forcing).
19319 Great prices, great dishes, unique/fun atmosphere, and great service!!
19320 !

19322 We weren't even upset about the wait, just waited patiently for our delicous order and upon arrival the server gave us two free entree tickets for our next visit and apologized.

19355 Had some time to kill before the Ultimate pleY Date Yelp event, and I'd wanted to share my love of Nobuo's Dark chocolate mousse with green tea ice cream and sugared orange peels with my happy-go-lucky cousin, who has never been here before, so we stopped by at 5:17p to find that Nobuo wouldn't open till 5:30p, so we waited outside in the comfortable patio.
19356 After watching a couple of employees add lanterns to their outdoor umbrellaed tables, I noticed the "OPEN" sign on the front door, so we entered the resto, whereupon we were greeted warmly by a male host and shown to a two-top.
19357 I didn't like the energy in that room, so I asked if we could sit elsewhere, and he said to choose wherever we wanted to sit.
19358 We were the first customers, so we chose a four-top, knowing we wouldn't be taking up space for very long, anyway.
19359 Glasses of water were delivered, and soon we met our female server (whose name on the receipt reflected "Butai").
19360 When she laid down the menus, I told her we would only be having dessert and could we see the dessert menu?
19361 I wished we had a video of the look she gave us, a look of pure distaste, as she gathered up the dinner and beverage menus and said "We don't have dessert menus, as we only have two..." and proceeded to tell us of the mousse and the almond-orange fritters.
19362 She walked away, and as we loudly discussed about our losing our interest in dining there, she came back with napkins and utensils and asked if we decided what we were going to have.
19363 I decided to forgo our server's very cold treatment and asked for the mousse.
19364 After all, I'd already finished a glass of ice-cold water and cousin's phone needed recharging...
19365 When Butai placed our chocolate mousse http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0Buxoc0cRqjpvkezo3bqog?select=rK8m1rxl50PB69_c2YqQTg#rK8m1rxl50PB69_c2YqQTg on the table, I wanted to send it back.
19366 Where was the lovely bowl and presentation of the last dessert I had here?
19367 Was she serious in presenting us with this stale-looking mousse, with cracked edges and whose green tea ice cream had ice crystals on it?
19368 I don't know about you, but the only times I've seen crystals on ice cream is when it has slightly melted and placed back in the freezer to re-freeze.
19369 For me, seeing crystals on ice cream is a sign that it is old...
19370 I brought the receptacle and showed it to the male host, who assured me that all of the mousse is made daily at 4:00a and seeing cracks and bubbles in the mousse is normal, so I decided we would go ahead and try it, if for nothing else but to have something to report here.
19371 The dessert was definitely not up to par with the pretty bowl http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0Buxoc0cRqjpvkezo3bqog?select=o9jIksB-MObhCxoI_msekQ#o9jIksB-MObhCxoI_msekQ I had during our October OYE in taste and presentation, but it was OK.
19372 The mousse was still cold and stiff, and it had a mouth-feel more of like thick chocolate ganache filling/icing on a cake- certainly not the silky-smooth chocolate decadence I knew it could be.
19373 My cousin had to warm up to the dish, as the sound of chocolate and green tea together didn't seem like a great combo to her (I told her to trust me).
19374 She also never enjoyed orange and chocolate together, but she liked it in this dessert.
19375 I understand that the knowledge of having to serve only dessert instead of dinner AND dessert, which translates to a higher table bill, can be a bit of a disappointment, but why must you show your displeasure to your guests?
19376 Butai, you were lucky that my cousin even left you the change for a tip- she didn't want to give you anything, and you certainly didn't deserve it!
19377 When I told other Yelp friends about the sub-par service and dessert we just had, one replied she didn't enjoy the last time we had apps here (I think it was around Halloween and First Friday?)
19378 either.
19379 Cousin and I thought it very poor taste that our server gave us that awful, condescending look after finding out we were just going to have dessert; We didn't deserve that!
19380 I am never going to recommend Nobuo to anyone, anymore.
19381 I even promised my Japanese friend (who lives and works overseas) I'd treat her to a dining experience here when she comes to visit.
19382 Guess I'll have to find another place to take her...
19383 I don't want to risk getting the same treatment from Butai, or from another server should we come back here.
19384 Sorry, Nobuo, but I won't be returning.

19947 Some side notes:
19948 1.
19949 Parking is awful for lunch.
19950 If you don't mind creepily stalking folks in the parking lot and possibly engaging in an altercation with another patron attempting to park, go ahead and give it the good ol' college try.
19951 2.
19952 I ordered a water with lemon.
19953 I received a water with no lemon.
19954 When I asked for some lemons for my water, they brought me out a small plate with SIX (yes, I really did say six) overgrown lemon wedges.
19955 I tried to come up with a scenario where one person would possibly have a need for one entire lemon on steroids.
19956 I couldn't come up with one.
19957 There is no reason for one person to be in possession of that much lemon.
19958 Period.
19959 3.
19960 We walked in and staff #1 seated us.
19961 Staff #2 took our order.
19962 Staff #3 brought our drinks and later the pile of lemons.
19963 Staff #4 brought our meal.
19964 Staff #5 cleared our plates.
19965 Staff #6 brought our check.
19966 Staff #3 took our check and brought the receipts/change back.
19967 Did it really take 6 people to get us through a weekday lunch?
19968 I was mostly entertained by it - it almost became a game of "who will show up next and what is their task?"
19969 It was still a little ridiculous.
19970 4.
19971 Being a semi-health conscious diner, I loved that they had fat free dressings, made tuna salad with low fat mayo, and just had many, many more healthy options than the average restaurant.
19972 I appreciate places that can fix a good meal without drenching it in calories and fat.
19973 There are plenty of places to go for that sort of meal when you're in need.
19974 No shortage there.
19975 It's nice to have those options beyond the standard no dressing, burger wrapped in lettuce, or vegetable medley consisting of zucchini, carrots, and cauliflower.
19976 A big up for Taylor's.
19977 5.
19978 For a half sandwich with soup, half of the fries, tax, and tip I paid about $16.
19979 It's not the cheapest lunch in town, but it's worth what you pay for.

20387 When you first walk into Biagio you would think you had walked into a fancy day spa.
20388 But when you read the prices, you wonder how they can stay in business.
20389 A "spa" pedicure, one of the most expensive treatments, is a whopping $49 (I say whopping with a sense of sarcasm).
20390 Not only do you get a great pedicure (best I've EVER received), but you get a leg and neck massage (yes the chairs are massage chairs, but real hands give you a real massage).
20391 A "spa" manicure, which also comes with a neck massage, is $25.
20392 The technicians are very nice, the store is immaculate, the tools are all sterilized, and the treatments are very high quality (even for a snob like me).
20393 Plus the atmosphere makes you feel like you are at a spa, not a strip-mall dive nail salon.
20394 I highly recommend Biagio.
20395 I have been there several times, and plan to go back often.
20396 I actually love this place and I always get great service when I'm there.

20501 I hate gyms...I mean LOATHE them.
20502 From rude staff to unpleasant odors or creepy guys giving you longing looks while you're just trying to figure out which one of your friends with an advanced degree in engineering you can text to help you figure out how to get on a machine without having it rip your arm out of its socket because the staff is not going help you without paying for a personal trainer or because you don't look like you were already born on a nautilus machine.
20503 This gym is everything but.
20504 I went in because of the great introductory special and a recommendation of a friend.
20505 We're both training to swim the SF Bay for the 2011 Sharkfest Alcatraz Swim, so we needed a pool.
20506 As soon you walk in, the guy at the front desk treats you like you're an old buddy and cracks jokes like he is your best bar buddy.
20507 Awesome attitude.
20508 The place has never been overly crowded (even at peak hours right after work.
20509 I've never gone during the early morning or lunch hours).
20510 No waits on the machines and they have plenty of them.
20511 No waiting in the pool and even when there is a water aerobics class, one lane is left open to due laps.
20512 Hot tub, sauna, and some inexplicable walk in dunking tub (see, I'm not a gym aficionado or else I would know what that thing is for).
20513 Towel service, locks, and even gym shorts available.
20514 (no more using that excuse that you can't work out today because you left your work out clothes at home...they have some to check out there.)
20515 Even the seemingly cranky old lady doing her water workout was nice and called me sweetie and asked if I was ok when I inadvertently let out a puppy like whimper as my shoulder blades decided they wanted to cede from the union of my body.
20516 Note to self....don't do a month of the P90X with a friend, think you're hot stuff and on your way to a gym bod and then jump in a pool to do a mile swim without stretching because you think you're all that now.
20517 Had it not been for Grandma Water Aerobics, I might still be at the far end of the pool trying to inch my way back to the stairs hoping that the water on my face hid the tears that were going start gushing any minute if I couldn't make it to the hot tub to get my back to stop seizing up.
20518 (Thank you, unknown Water Aerobics lady.
20519 You turned a moment of shame into motivation.
20520 Oh yeah, I will out swim grandma next time!)

20527 I saw no young kids running around.

21168 Don't be fooled by the shabby looks of the outside plaza; the inside is contrarily well orchestrated with subtle Thai ornaments and design.

21170 Much like that feeling, the service is intriguingly exceptional from the time you walk into the front door.
21171 The food that I've tried here so far is... may I say it... divine.
21172 I started off with the squid salad with mint and lemongrass and it was packed with fish sauce and shrimp paste.
21173 Score.
21174 I also tried some papaya salad and once again, it was mounded in fish sauce and chili.
21175 Splendid.
21176 Then I had the minced beef phad kaprow (which is not on the menu) and lo and behold, I was tasting Phuket in a Bangkok sort of way.
21177 To be honest... the sauces from each of these entrees mingle quite well.
21178 You can drizzle some of each dripping over rice and literally have an orgy in your mouth of Mormonic proportions.
21179 You can also bolster it with some more heat with their chili fish sauce, again drizzled all over your concoction.

21188 For the ladies, there is a vanity with lighted mirror just off the bathroom.

21190 The mini-bar seems to be a thing of the past, but the Boulders still features a well-stocked version with a half bottle of Cali wine, kettle cooked chips, water, soda and various liquor.
21191 The villas were outrageous and would be great for a family reunion or that type of thing - multiple bedrooms, a large outdoor area for entertaining, with the garage (they're houses, really) converted to a bedroom.
21192 If you're staying in a casita, it's a hike across the property to the villas - they'll take you in a shuttle bus.
21193 The bar near the dining room was well-stocked with several single malts, and the standard cigar list.
21194 Walk out back through the seating area, and you'll find the pool, framed by a gorgeous backdrop of a large boulder and waterfall.
21195 A little cool for the pool in December, but it didn't seem to hamper others' enjoyment.
21196 Looking forward to returning and enjoying more on-site amenities besides golf.
21197 My girlfriend went to the spa for massage / pedicure and seemed pretty relaxed - what I gathered is that she enjoyed it.
21198 There are places with cushier accommodations, but the property it sits on is what makes the Boulder's unique.

21545 The Bikram Institute on Miller and Indian School is where I first tried it, and I like it the best so far.
21546 They offer classes throughout the day and later in the evening as well.
21547 Like other studios, this place offers first timers a week-long pass for around $20.
21548 What I really like about this studio is their instructors and the fact that they keep their room darkened throughout the entire practice.
21549 I've have been going to another studio lately (for their first-time student deals) and their instructors bark out instructions non-stop plus they keep the lights on the whole time.
