21562 What started out as a simple attempt to find a perfect birthday present turned into a life-long relationship with a fantastic jeweler.
21563 I wanted to get my fiancé (girlfriend at that time) a simple diamond pendant necklace for her birthday and could not find anything that even came close to matching her style.
21564 I searched the internet for days and reluctantly went into a few jewelry stores hoping for the best, but expecting the worst.
21565 I, like most people [guys] out there, had a bad feeling in a few stores I went to.
21566 Pushy sales people looking for the upsale, and sky high prices.
21567 I was getting very discouraged about the process, but that all changed when I came to Hyde Park.
21568 The super friendly staff made everything easy for me.
21569 There was no pushy sales process or anyone trying to upsell me something I didn't want.
21570 They immediately offered me a bottle of water and started to talk to me like a real person.
21571 After a few minutes of speaking with a very lovely woman in the store she suggested we think about something custom.
21572 At first  I was thinking "here we go; this is where I am going to get stuck!
21573 ", but I was all wrong!!
21574 !
21575 We looked a few loose stones and I got a great education about diamonds.
21576 I went home later that night and did some research on the internet and found that the prices we as good, or better than any of the big online retailers.
21577 I could never get my head wrapped around buying a diamond online, sight unseen, and I am so glad that I found Hyde Park.
21578 In the end I have used Hyde Park to create a custom pendant diamond necklace that my fiancé absolutely loves (it is perfect on her), and I also used Hyde Park to get the diamond for the engagement ring, as well as everything else to follow.
21579 Want to know what service is all about in the jewelry business, check out what Hyde Park did for me.
21580 I picked out an amazing diamond for the engagement ring (chose the loose stone again) but had no idea what kind of a ring my fiancé would want.
21581 So Hyde Park said "how about we just put it in a classic Tiffany solitaire setting as a temporary setting and then after you give it to her, you can come back in together and pick out the perfect setting and wedding band set".
21582 I was like, seriously?!!
21583 You can just do that??
21584 ?
21585 In the end Hyde Park will be my jeweler for life.
21586 They helped me create the perfect simple birthday present, and took that service all the way through doing a custom engagement ring and matching wedding band set.
21587 This is the jewelry store for any guy who wants great service, great prices, and like me, doesn't have the first clue about how to make the perfect decision.
21588 Just let Hyde Park take the stress out of it like they did for me!

21591 Nor the service, which is friendly and helpful.
21592 Nor about the atmosphere (well, somewhat about the atmosphere...it's quite lackluster).

21594 But what they've done is create a menu of less expensive small plates where you need to order at least 3 per person to be totally full, so you end up spending as much if not more as you would at other high-end establishments.

21844 I think chef Silvana Esparza first located the restaurant here on CALLE DIECISEIS (she renamed the street all by herself, apparently) to take advantage of cheap rent.
21845 There was no way she was going to locate her Scottsdalish restaurant actually in Scottsdale.
21846 So, people from the wealthier areas - and some First Friday urban hipsters whose parents foot their bills - make the trek down to CALLE DIECISEIS to partake in everything Barrio Cafe.
21847 And they think it's cool that they are going there, past the check cashing places, the people waiting at the bus stops and the "rawness" of this part of central Phoenix.
21848 And what is everything "Barrio Cafe"???
21849 ?
21850 Pretentious service.
21851 LOUD dining room.
21852 NO parking.
21853 Fusion food that is about 10 years past its prime.
21854 High prices.
21855 Let's talk a little about the last item on the list.
21856 Besides using vulgar language in her YouTube videos for pseudo social activism, Esparza seems to have forgotten her own humble upbringings.
21857 It's ironic that the very people who live on and around CALLE DIECISEIS cannot afford to eat in her restaurant.
21858 The Mexican immigrants and their sons and daughters who do the cooking, the cleaning, the landscaping and all that for Phoenix are not welcome at the Barrio Cafe.
21859 I know that this is not a taco truck, but there is some overwhelming irony here that you locate your restaurant in a working class area and supposedly have sympathy for the plight of the downtrodden and the neighbors can't even eat  at your restaurant.
21860 I guess that's capitalism.

21919 I've now tried Thai Elephant three times.
21920 My first two experiences were solidly mediocre -- nothing was awful, but aside from one delicious dessert (black sticky rice with pumpkin custard), nothing stood out, either.
21921 As a recent Bay Area transplant, I admit to being a bit picky, but in my 6 months in Phoenix, I've found several places that more than satisfy my rather frequent Thai cravings (Swadee in Chandler, Thai Lahna in Arcadia, Sala Thai in North Phoenix, and, in a pinch, Thai Hut in Central Phoenix).
21922 Until now, Thai Elephant hadn't really done it for me, but since the restaurant is literally 40 feet from my office and since other Yelpers seem to have had positive experiences, I was reluctant to give up on Thai Elephant without giving it another chance.
21923 On Friday, looking forward to a relaxing night at home, I called in an order for Pad Thai with chicken, Panang Curry with beef (extra spicy), and Spicy Eggplant with tofu (spicy, which I thought would be automatic given the name, but apparently wasn't).
21924 I got home, meted out ridiculously oversized portions of the three entrees, and sat down to enjoy my feast.
21925 Wow.
21926 I don't know quite where to begin, but to say that I was disappointed doesn't begin to cover it.
21927 The Pad Thai was about on par with the Taste of Thai boxed dinners you can pick up at the grocery store, only less flavorful; marginal at best, but edible.
21928 The chicken didn't stand out as being of particularly low quality, but the noodles were some of the worst I've had at a Thai restaurant (some bites were underdone to the point of being crunchy, while others were seriously soggy).
21929 Sadly, the sub-par Pad Thai was the high point of the meal by a wide margin.
21930 The Spicy Eggplant was a bland stir fry of soggy, overcooked vegetables and limp tofu.
21931 The tofu appeared to have been fried as a large block and then sliced, and a few small pieces of eggplant were thrown in for good measure.
21932 The Panang Curry with beef was even worse.
21933 Though I ordered the dish "spicy," the curry tasted like straight coconut milk with a few drops of red food coloring thrown in.
21934 The beef was the last straw for me; it very may well have been the worst quality, most gristly meat I've had at any restaurant I've ever been to.
21935 I tried several pieces, and all were similarly inedible.
21936 I really, really want to like Thai Elephant, but after the experience I had, I don't know if I can bring myself to give it another chance -- especially since I've found so many other good Thai restaurants in the Valley and since the second-worst Thai meal I've had since moving here was at Thai Elephant's sister restaurant, Thai Basil in Ahwatukee.

22236 I am not usually a fan of botanical gardens.
22237 They seem too precious, too "perfect" to be of much interest.
22238 And, let's face it, flowers and plants are beautiful things, but when you pay to look at them in neat rows, something is lost.
22239 That said, Desert Botanical Gardens is an exception to this garden cynic.
22240 Many of these cacti look like they are from another planet, like something you would see in a sci-fi film and say, "wow, it's too bad those crazy plants don't exist."
22241 They sprawl out on the ground, weaving and turning every which way, or compose huge bizarre formations high off the ground.
22242 I never knew such bizarre life forms existed, or that some cacti look like trees.
22243 The gardens are full of windy paths where one is also likely to find a family of quail, lizards, or a jackrabbit or two.
22244 Various species of bird can be seen here as well, especially at dusk.
22245 I especially love watching the birds fly in and out of nests they've made in the upper arms of cacti.
22246 This place never grows old.
22247 It's a great introduction to the desert for people from out of town, and because the cacti have been collected from around the world, a cool botany lesson for us all here.
22248 Great place.
22249 Hard to see behind Carl's Jr. on Southern Ave but is Worth finding!

22343 Yes, before you ask, I still love Desert Stages Theatre, perhaps more than ever.
22344 This is Andrew's fifth play there and this time he plays the Knave in Alice in Wonderland.
22345 Normally, we don't ask for a specific role but the director of Annie Jr. thought he would be cute as the Dormouse as he popped up from the table so that's what we asked for this time during audition.
22346 And we anxiously waited for the casting to be posted.
22347 When the casting was posted, he did not get the requested part and as a mom and a parent, I was glad.
22348 Why you may ask?
22349 Because to me as a mom and a parent, it's very important to teach my son the importance of handling success with graciousness and moving through disappointments with a positive attitude.
22350 When he asked why he didn't get the part, I told him in simple words that the director had a vision of what the whole play should be like and she saw Andrew in the role of Knave and that was his special role.
22351 I also told him that it doesn't matter what role you get, if you play it with all you got and go out there and perform with your heart as there are no small parts, you will capture the audience's attention and that will be your moment.
22352 He listened with a typical 5 year old attitude and became very excited about being the Knave.
22353 And I was also excited for him because this time around, he had 2 long lines to memorize and speak!
22354 With each review, I've written about how Andrew has grown through DST and here I've included a video where you can see him growing aware of theatre and performance:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fsG07sMlZ5s&feature=related.
22355 This time around, he started asking me if he was a main character, starting to understand the structure of a performance.
22356 It was great to see his awareness growing.
22357 I highly recommend bringing your own child to audition for a play here.
22358 It will be an amazing experience!
22359 !
22360 Really, DST is about the kids.
22361 Trusting the kids to do their part and giving them responsibilities.
22362 Once the curtain lifts, the kids are responsible for THEIR performance and for each other.
22363 It's fantastic to see the kids have their moments on stage, being responsible for moving and arranging the set, take care of the tech, go from loose energy backstage to fanstatic actors on stage.
22364 It's all fabulous.
22365 If you have doubts of what kids can do, go to a show at Desert Stages Theatre and be amazed.
22366 Truly, if you believe in your kids, as DST shows again and again, your kids will shine and raise above your expectations!

22605 This dairy sells fresh milk, straight from the cow.
22606 That's what they're licensed to sell.
22607 They use organic feed (dried grasses), hydrogen peroxide for cleaning certain things, and iodine to clean the cows' teats (just like many dairies used to).
22608 They want the cows to be out on pasture, but they need a bigger piece of land to do so.
22609 If you know of a piece of land in the area, please suggest it to Jackie Calamos.
22610 I love their milk.
22611 As of this date, milk is $10/gallon, the true cost of the milk (or maybe even a little low).
22612 Most of the milk you buy in the store isn't worth the price.
22613 Forcing more production out of cows with hormones comes at the cost of quality (and your health).
22614 SYD's has all the good stuff (the proof is in the taste).
22615 It's never made us sick, and we've been drinking it for 2 years.
22616 It's a miracle that this metro area actually has a dairy willing to sell fresh milk to the public!
22617 Thank you, Save Your Dairy!

22657 I came to the restaurant specifically because of a recommendation.
22658 I am now on a gluten-free diet and have other allergies so, suffice it to say, I don't get to eat Italian often.
22659 However I was told that they have gluten-free pasta and other choices.
22660 I was initially impressed by the sheet that breaks down their meals by allergen so that one knows what is safe.
22661 Kudos on that.
22662 This is more than most places provide.
22663 However, they have Basil Pesto Sauce listed as NOT being gluten-free nor soy free.
22664 Finding that odd, I asked the waiter to confirm with the chef, and I was told there was no wheat product at all in the pesto, which seems correct.
22665 (I did not ask about the soy, but I would wager that sneaks in somehow thanks to the cheese.)
22666 So I ordered the Create Your Own Pasta of gluten-free penne with pesto sauce, shrimp, peppers, spinach, and mushrooms.
22667 When my bowl of pasta arrived, it had all of the above.
22668 However, it also had onions, zucchini, and eggplant, yet I had to dig to find a shrimp.
22669 I originally assumed I had somebody else's order.
22670 The waiter, who was wonderful and attentive, took the bowl away and offered to replace it as I ordered.
22671 I would have eaten the original bowl, and told him so, but I was more concerned, as I said, that it was someone else's.
22672 As a side note, if these flourishes of extra vegetables are an example of a cook's flair, I would say that if a customer orders a straight menu item, that might be acceptable.
22673 But when I fill out a cute little checkbox form with what I want on my Create Your Own Pasta bowl, I *only* want the items I checked off.
22674 A fresh bowl arrived later exactly as ordered.
22675 Except the pasta was undercooked.
22676 I don't mean really firm al-dente.
22677 I mean some were still way under done.
22678 Now, I know that gluten-free pasta takes longer to cook, and they probably rushed the bowl to get it to me.
22679 But that bowl was almost inedible.
22680 The waiter did offer to get me a third bowl.
22681 I declined and soldiered through it.
22682 We were having dinner out for my wife's birthday and I did not want to belabor the meal.
22683 The waiter then offered us dessert to make up for the problems.
22684 Though I did agree to this, and I'm not demanding or even asking for a full dinner cost to be covered, it seems inadequate for management to offer me a three dollar dessert to make up for a twice-failed $14 dinner.
22685 I do not intend to go back.

22816 We just completed our third tour with Taste It Tours and we've been impressed with all of them.
22817 All 3 tours are distinct and are loaded with excellent restaurants.
22818 I've spent quite a bit of time downtown, but it can be daunting and I haven't ventured much to explore and try new things.
22819 The tours take you to the places you may not notice as you whiz by, give the history (yes Phoenix has history), and overall just slow you down to take in the sights, sounds, and of course, food!
22820 Can't decide which tour to take?
22821 Start with the Original, then the warehouse and finally the evening.
22822 Really, they're all good!
22823 Tips: Have a light snack before starting the tour.
22824 Yes you do get a lot of food, but keep in mind that the tours start at 2pm or 6pm.
22825 You have introductions, overview, some history and then a short walk to the first restaurant.
22826 If you're skipping lunch, you might be very hungry when you arrive as the first restaurant.
22827 2) Wear comfortable shoes.
22828 You will be walking about 2 miles.
22829 Nothing strenuous or fast paced, but just be conformable (also wear comfortable clothing as you will get full).
22830 3) Pace yourself!
22831 Don't eat everything that is in front of you.
22832 Each restaurant gives a fair amount of food, now multiply that by 3+ more restaurants that remain on the tour...You get the idea.
22833 You will be full!
22834 Highly recommend for anyone: locals, out of town visitors, guests of locals, team building, etc.
22835 Really, who doesn't like food!
22836 Side Note: Taste it Tours was founded by a few Phoenix locals who love food and their city.
22837 They have only been around about a year now and have been doing extremely well.
22838 They base their business around supporting local businesses (local supporting local).
22839 I'm excited to see how well they've done and wish them all the best (More tours are in the works and I will definitely be taking them!)
22840 I signed up for Yelp just because of the poor service and being cheated out of money from Cafe Rio.

22843 I understand that it's made to your order like Chiptole or Qdoba, but they'll add very little cheese or toppings on your food, which can cause you to request more.

22845 She barely put any cheese on my 3 tacos and I simply requested that she could put a little more on the tacos.
22846 She did and when I went to pay for my order, I was charged an extra 95 cents for "side cheese."
22847 The issue isn't the money because eating at Cafe Rio can be expensive for a fast-food mexican restauant, but it's the principle of charging me extra after I said, "can you please put a little more cheese on my taco."
22848 This hasn't been the first time this happened, but a previous visit had the same result with the sauce on my burrito.

22850 All I ask for from Cafe Rio to acknowledge that when you add more toppings to what the cook's add to your food, that they say, "this will be extra."
22851 They do this at Chiptole and Qdoba, but Cafe Rio would rather screw you over at the end.
22852 I will not be visiting this establishment again.

22877 Any parent with young children can vouch for me on this one...keeping the attention of a three year old is, to say the least, difficult.
22878 They need constant stimulation, otherwise, there very well may be hell to pay!
22879 Enter, the Children's Museum of Phoenix!
22880 The facility is an old school, converted into three stories of pure fun and energy!
22881 After you pay your standard $11/person older than 1 (or your $22 for up to four people with a Groupon), you encounter a three story art project that can only be described as AWESOME!
22882 There are multiple ways in which your children can traverse this mammoth.
22883 The various pathways challenge children in strength, balance, and critical thinking skills...all of the ways you want to challenge your child!
22884 After your child has lost interest in this room, you progress to the second floor.
22885 Here, children get to experiment with a really cool board that can only be described as "Plinko-esque".
22886 Here, children can alter the path of a falling object by changing different platforms.
22887 My daughter thought I was a genius because I was able to predict where her object would land every time...it's a shame she'll ultimately realize how routine that feat really is.
22888 After Plinko, children can either go to the trike wash, build forts, or they can head to the art room.
22889 After some laps through the wash, my daughter wanted to head into the art room.
22890 Being that we went right before Halloween, our child had the opportunity to make black play dough (to make spiders), she got to paint on a giant rocket ship, and then she was able to make a spooky tree out of a brown paper bag.
22891 Such simple activities...such great opportunities!
22892 After cleaning all of the paint from her smock, we made the journey up...to the third floor.
22893 Here, children get to play grown-ups.
22894 There's a mock supermarket that allows children to either shop, ring up merchandise, or work in the stock room of a miniature grocery store.
22895 After shopping, our daughter wanted to work at the little ice cream stand located just outside of the grocery.
22896 We had fake ice cream cones and sat at the tiny bistro set while we watched children make their way through the noodle forest.
22897 We then made our way to the end of the hall to race miniature race cars on roller skate wheels.
22898 Being only three floors, our day at the museum only lasted a couple of hours...but in those short hours, my daughter never stopped smiling!
22899 How on earth could you rate any place less than five stars when it brings so much joy to YOUR pride and joy?

22932 Jennifer said curtly, "We're busy."
22933 Apparently, on Saturdays, they're busy and one should avoid transacting business there on the weekend.
22934 I don't recall being spoken to so rudely at even a fast food restaurant in recent years...

22938 I asked for Jennifer's card, as I told her I was not happy with the way she had spoken to me or my mother, and I intended to speak with her manager.
22939 To that I received a reply she did not have one.
22940 The woman sitting next to her informed me she was the assistant manager and that they were busy on Saturdays.
22941 My biggest beef was this: If it was going to be an hour to speak with someone, tell me.
22942 I can make other arrangements or come in during the week.
22943 Being told first, "It shouldn't be long," and then, "We're busy" is not an excuse.
22944 If the business is so overwhelming on Saturdays, perhaps it would be wise to staff more people, extend the hours, or inform people of the wait they're likely to experience because of the queue.

22981 Having spent lots of time in Sonora, Mexico over the years visiting family, I have always sought a place here in Arizona that provides an honest and quality duplication of the food I have had south of the border.
22982 At Sonora Mesquite Grill, I have found such a place that makes food on the spot, using only fresh ingredients, and genuine care for your experience.
22983 You can always go elsewhere and maybe get your food faster, maybe have a plasma TV in your face, but I'm willing to bet that your food started out frozen and going through a thawing process in a microwave.
22984 Celina, the kind and welcoming owner, wants people to receive the absolute best food possible.
22985 This painstaking process means long hours for her every day preparing the beef and chicken over a mesquite fire.
22986 No, there are no large corporate chain gimmicks or cut corners.
22987 Sonora Mesquite Grill simply provides good food at a good price without the use of preservatives and loads of fat.
22988 Is Sonora Mesquite Grill for everyone?
22989 Perhaps not, but it is a great choice for someone looking for genuinely authentic, modest, great tasting and healthy food with the taste of Sonora.
22990 If going for the first time, make sure to order the silky and flavorful guacamole and salsas.
22991 Finish your meal with a fresh and homemade razpado to truly cap off a great meal at Sonora Mesquite Grill.

23167 The food was decent, however I am writing about their underhanded business practices.
23168 I ordered a travelzoo voucher for $69 that included 2 3 course meals.
23169 It said "Regularly $140".
23170 What we ordered, if had been ordered off the regular menu would have been about $100.
23171 However, we were charged tax on the full $140.
23172 Second, even though on the voucher it says "PLEASE TIP ON THE FULL VALUE OF THE CHECK."
23173 (which implies tip is not included and we get to choose the tip amount) and nowhere mentions automatic gratuity, 18% gratuity (18% of $140, even though we ordered $100 worth of food at the most) was automatically added to our check.
23174 Third, even if you had ordered the most expensive options, the highest possible amount it could be worth is $120, not $140.
23175 It is mathematically impossible to have the voucher be a $140 value, but that is what they add tax and tip to.
23176 Fourth, after we told our waiter we were using a voucher, he seemed less interested in the service level of our table, which i later realized was because he had a guaranteed 18% (of $140) tip.
23177 I just noticed today they have another travelzoo deal "$79 - AWARD-WINNING FRENCH DINNER FOR 2 W/WINE, REG.

23233 Since I have ranted recently on poor customer service, and in the spirit of balance, here is a shining example of how easy it really is.
23234 Late last summer  I came home and was shocked to see two of my sunscreens looking quite vandalized.
23235 Upon further inspection, it appeared that while using a back mounted leaf blower, one of the landscape crew had brushed against them.
23236 The exhaust pipe must have ripped and burned the screen material as well.
23237 It was quite the nasty burned melted scar.
23238  After staring at it for several hours, I realized there was no virgin Mary, no Jesus, hell it just looked like burned grilled cheese without any deity or lesser apparitions whatsoever, regardless of the angle or my squint.
23239 So deciding there was no money to made on eBay, I set out to get them repaired.
23240 Did some online searching and decided to call AmeriZona.
23241 I explained the situation and was told they could repair them, but I would have to bring them in.
23242 These are some pretty large sun screens mind you and packing them into the convertible would have been a challenge.
23243 While pondering what to do the person helping me on the phone asked me if I could hold on.
23244 I could tell it was one of those thinking on your feet light bulb went off type can you hold requests.
23245 She came back on the phone, informed me that she had a crew that was working close by and that she would ask one of the crew to swing by and pick up the screens for repair.
23246 She could not promise when they would be repaired, but for that convenience alone I was on board.
23247 She had already quoted me the price to repair the screens, and it was very reasonable considering some other online comparisons.
23248 Someone showed up within a few hours to pick up the screens.
23249 He could not have been more accommodating, and it was obvious this guy had been working all day and was on his way home.
23250 A few days later, Mark  phoned me to tell me my screens were ready and to tell me he was going to drop them off on his way home!
23251 Needless to say Mark was also very pleasant to deal with.
23252 I believe he was at the time the sales manager.
23253 When he arrived, the screens looked great, matched the color of the others, even with the sun bleaching over several years.
23254 He even offered to put them in!
23255 This experience was way beyond any customer service expectations.
23256 No extra charges for any of the above and beyond the call of duty efforts.
23257 Outstanding, and quite refreshing.
23258 They really do a great job, and you will really pay for it.
23259 I don't have incredibly pricey clothing, so getting my $50 blouses dry cleaned here just doesn't make sense- but I would absolutely trust them with very important articles (nice sport coats, lined trousers, wedding gowns, blood soaked mattresses... haha, kidding).

23400 We were in Gilbert staying at a friend's house for spring training, GO DODGERS!!!
23401 We hit the usuals, Waffle House, Dunkin Donuts, Dodger Dogs at the game, and our friends asked do you like sandwiches?
23402 If there is one food group that I love, it has to be the Sandwich group, and
23403 this place is one of my top 5 sandwiches stops of all time.
23404 We ate in the Lounge(y)(ie) area, which has a more adult vibe going on.
23405 We first started with their fresh bread, and tomato basalmic vinegar salsa(y) thing.
23406 Which was great, we had two rounds of that while we drank our beverages, and waited on our sandwiches.
23407 I ordered the Cuban sandwich with the potato salad, and the wife ordered the Chicken breast sandwich, with pasta salad.
23408 My sandwich came out perfectly, from the fresh Ciabatta Bread to the outstanding roasted pork.
23409 I would order this pork just by itself; it was juicy, and full of flavor, just like my Cuban grandmother makes.
23410 While this sandwich is a true Cuban sandwich, not using swiss, and not being pressed, it is not advertised as an actual Cuban, just a Cuban style, like me.
23411 Now this potato salad was some of the best I have ever had, and not just because it had bacon, which is awesome, but the use of yukon gold potatoes, instead of red, or russets has been a revelation to me.
23412 This is how I am going to prepare all off my potato salads from now on.
23413 After all that I still ordered the carrot cake, which like everything else is made in house with local ingredients, it was warm with a not overly sweet cream cheese frosting.
23414 The wife got the lava cake with some beer ice cream.
23415 Even though I ate most of my carrot cake, and loved it, I wish I had a full gallon of that beer ice cream, it was just perfect.
23416 In fact I am planning another trip out that way, just for that ice cream.

23799 Hiking Camelback Mountain has to have been the most difficult 1 1/2 mile hike (Just up, 3 miles total) that I have ever been on.
23800 While it is not a very far distance the increase in elevation is over 1000 feet in that short mile and a half.
23801 The first thing that I recommend is either getting to Echo Park at bright and early (between 4:30-5:30 am) or, if you come later as I did just parking in the overflow parking.
23802 You can find a simple map to the overflow parking at:
23803 http://phoenix.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/Camelback-Mountain-Trailhead-Overflow-Parking.png
23804 The walk to the Echo Canyon trail head to the overflow parking is only about 20-25 minutes and it is almost guaranteed to be faster than driving around looking for a parking spot somewhere else.
23805 The trail itself takes about 20 minutes to actually get difficult but when it does decide to start getting hard it does not let up for a moment.
23806 There are chain link fences at a couple of places in the hike to stop people from accidentally tumbling over very steep ledges and even handrails at times for more support up the trickiest sections of the hike.
23807 The good and bad of this hike is how crowded it is.
23808 There will rarely be a moment where you wont see someone coming or going for more that 50 yards at a time.
23809 This means that while there is little to no quiet and privacy, that if something were to happen to you there would be plenty of witnesses.
23810 The rest at the top is wonderful.
23811 The view is by far the best in the valley and something that I recommend to everyone.
23812 Take 20 minutes or so to eat a snack, drink some water, take a breather and take some breathtaking pictures from the summit.
23813 The summit is usually pretty crowded so you won't want to stay too long.
23814 Be careful on the way back.
23815 It can be very tricky navigating some of the areas and twisted ankles and even broken legs are not terribly uncommon.
23816 Again, take you time and take plenty of breaks when you need them and you should be OK.
23817 Don't forget to take plenty of water, I recommend at least a liter per person if you go in the morning and more that that if you do in when it is warmer outside.

23849 Embarrassingly, I only knew the street I lived on and not much more, so I couldn't help him.

23888 Just your typical warehouse club right?
23889 I guess that depends on your definition of typical.
23890 Sam's club has hours just for buisness members starting at 7:00am.
23891 You can also fax in or go online and have them shop for you.
23892 All you do is go in a pay for it.
23893 They have a few membership levels- Business, Gold Member and Premium.
23894 The Premium level you earn 2% back on all your purchases.
23895 They do give you two cards for the price that you pay, so you can go in with a neighbor and each get a card.
23896 In addition to electronics, photo lab, optical center, bakery, meat department, they also have a little know "clearance" section at each Sam's.
23897 You just have to know where it is.
23898 Also when they are clearancing out merchandise, the price will end in a "1".
23899 Most common is .71 or .81.
23900 I have picked up 5 pound bags of mixed candy for .71 a bag, and lots of other deals just by knowing this little secret.
23901 They do discount their meat the day before they need to pull it from the shelves.
23902 They also will give cookies to children.
23903 My boys also love the cafe where they get their "pizza and drink please."
23904 Their menu has changed  a lot lately though and I am not sure if I like it.
23905 Prices are very reasonable though.
23906 They also have gasoline pumps outside which if you know your prices can be a good thing!
23907 If you are not satified with your membership, you can cancel at anytime and they will prorate your membership refund.
23908 Their refund policy is really good as well.

23912 Mm!
23913 I've tried all the cheese fondues, and the Swiss is my favorite.

24126 I went with my friend Amy who was visiting from New York.
24127 She had been to Roy's before and is a fellow foodie.

24131 And we are major drinkers - just gotta throw that in there.)
24132 Our waitress on the patio could not have been more accomodating and she even brought us new martinis even though we drank quite a bit of our strong ones.
24133 I am a people watcher and it was nice to see that there was an assortment of people sitting on the furniture, some of them looked like they could be relatives of mine, enjoying the late afternoon, reading, conversing....well, if I HAD any rich or classy relatives, that is.
24134 It was very nice and relaxing.
24135 Plus the Mariott property is stunning and I wish I could have looked around the property more than we did.
24136 When we meandered inside for dinner, the hostess greeted us by name and our server showed us to our table.
24137 She was very competent, could make recommendations, and was pleasant without being clingy.
24138 We loved her.
24139 She reminded me of Joan Cusack.
24140 Sounded just like her!
24141 The complimentary appetizer of lightly spiced, steamed edamame was delightful and even though they gave us warmed wet washcloths we were complete heathens and ate with our hands without ever using them.
24142 We shared the Roy's Canoe for Two, which had Lobster potstickers, Beef Satay, shrimp on a stick (not its real name), and Tuna Sushi Rolls.
24143 I must say - the Lobster potstickers - better than sex.
24144 The Beef satay was basically this ultra-tender beef on a stick, lightly flavored and grilled.
24145 Fabulous.
24146 But the pinnacle of perfection here was the Tuna sushi rolls, which absolutely knocked our socks off.
24147 I have never, ever had such an amazing piece of sushi before that moment.
24148 I think our  server, Joan Cusack (Not her real name) thought I was choking because as I ate it, my eyes were rolling back into my head in ecstacy.
24149 She bustled over and once she got closer she could see she was merely interrupting a very intimate moment with me and my tuna roll and she went back to her post after giving me a thumbs-up sign.
24150 For whatever reason, these tuna sushi rolls were encrusted in what may have been macadamia nuts and it was completely divine.
24151 I re-live that moment over and over.
24152 MMM.
24153 But you know, the showstopper was STILL yet to come.
24154 I could not believe my luck when my Roy's Trio was placed in front of me.
24155 It was a piece of Hawaiian butterfish in Miso sauce, a piece of Seared Ahi, and a piece of salmon.
24156 The poor salmon!
24157 It was the best salmon I ever had out, but next to those two it was like Cinderella's ugly stepsister.
24158 Just upstaged by the butterfish, which is melt-in-your mouth decadence, and the seared ahi - which surpassed the tuna roll I just got done fantasizing about as the most perfect piece of sushi EVER.
24159 Amy got the butterfish.
24160 We licked our plates clean.

24554 This is not a fancy place.
24555 It's address is on Scottsdale Road, but it's easier to get to from Shea, about a block east of Scottsdale.
24556 It's split into two sections.

24901 Seriously.
24902 It's amazing.
24903 It's the best little hole-in-a-rundown-strip-mall you can find.
24904 And it's cheap!
24905 Nestled between stores like Big Lots and some electronic place with Mexican ranchero music blasting, this tiny place is hidden in the corner.
24906 The owner is from El Salvador, so don't expect it to be Mexican food -- there are many similarities, but the dishes themselves are different.
24907 Walking in, you can smell the homemade pupusas -- seriously, it smells like the roadside stands along the bus routes in central America.
24908 It's amazing.
24909 There are only a couple waitresses, and I don't think they speak much English, but the menu is in pictures, as well as in Spanish and some English, so you should do just fine.
24910 Get the pupusas - they're like thick, hand-made tortillas stuffed with either pork, cheese and beans or, my favorite, cheese and loraco flower, which is some green and edible plant that tastes a bit like asparagus, to me.
24911 It's definitely the best one.
24912 These things come with salsa and some coleslaw (if they don't, just ask for the salsa) and are very filling!
24913 The other dishes are really good, too.
24914 For a low price, you can get an entire plate of things like meat with rice and beans - and this place doesn't skimp on the fixin's.
24915 They put slices of fresh tomatoes, avocado and all kinds of other stuff on the plates.
24916 I honestly LOVE it here.
24917 If you want to avoid the crowds, come at an off-hour... then you can just sit, relax and watch the telenovela on the TV in the corner.
24918 For dessert, pick up a piece of the cheese pie near the cash register.

24963 I can't forget to mention the amazing bread made with tapioca flour, they will even give you the recipe.
24964 We especially enjoyed talking to the girls in the information center (the one that looks like a mine).
24965 They were VERY helpful in giving us advice on local restaurants and insisting we take a day trip to Sedona......we did and Sedona is now one of our favorite cities.
24966 Thanks to Ashley, Miranda, Tiffany, Chelsea, and Pat.

24968 This was a very thoughtful touch.

24994 of saintly acts, around this town
24995 the volunteers, each morning bound
24996 unselfishly, they give their time
24997 a day, an hour,  can remind
24998 you how, sometimes, the way things go
24999 to count your blessings, never know
25000 hungry, homeless, most are blessed
25001 St Mary's cares, for all the rest
25002 feeding famished, forty years
25003 donations come, from far and near
25004 warehoused, sorted, then sent out
25005 deserving families, who, no doubt
25006 would otherwise, just not be fed
25007 but gratefully, they go to bed
25008 with bellies full and filled with hope
25009 thanks to St Mary's, most can cope
25010 with unemployment, cost of gas
25011 mounting bills and dwindling cash
25012 humbly they come, take what they need
25013 a box or two, enough to feed
25014 their families, ease their malaise
25015 for weeks, or just, a couple days
25016 so volunteer, you wont regret
25017 it's what you give, not what you get
25018 easy to say, you could, or should
25019 but doing good, will do you good

25021 boxes of apples, stand and sort

25111 01/04/2012
25112 I thank Yelp and ATC for giving me the great opportunity to experience a terrific performance of "Daddy Long Legs," ATC's first musical production, at The Herberger Theater tonight!
25113 The two-actor (Megan McGinnis and Robert Adelman Hancock) musical, plus the invisible, but great assets, the orchestra and sound crew, entertained and amazed me w/ their execution of a well-written body of work.
25114 It had comedy, romance, deception, and sorrow, to name a few... what's not to like?
25115 Truly enjoyed McGinnis' impeccable timing, as well.
25116 It is sad that many people pass up the opportunity to watch live theater due to the higher ticket fees, and I cannot fault them-- what's easier to bear: $37 per person plus $3 parking fee, which you may buy at the box office prior to attending the show, or $10 and free parking at the movies (well, at least when you're NOT catching one in downtown PHX)?
25117 However, when you do decide to place the financial investment, you will almost always be rewarded w/ a highly-memorable night, believe you me!
25118 I had a wonderful time, and I would definitely recommend "Daddy Long Legs" to anyone who enjoys great acting and music!
25119 (Much thanks to McGinnis and Hancock for their lovely harmonies-- I cherished them!)
25120 I'd go back the next time I'm in town.

25126 However I do warn beginners to use the easier trail on the East side near Invergorden which runs north south and turns into 64th st.
25127 It is a bit of a walk from the parking through the neighborhood but the hike is less treacherous and much easier and takes you up a gradual slope to the top.
25128 Be very careful it's easy to loose the trail on that side too.
25129 Of course all the Phoenicians like to go to Echo Canyon at Mcdonald and 44th street bend.
25130 Parking can be bad at peak times on weekends--I definetely recommend late afternoon hiking, less exhaustion from heat, less crowds and a glorious sunset at the top.

25645 Totally excited to try this place out, my grandparents, my mom and I (4 of us) came here for some Korean food.
25646 It wasn't too busy; just pairs of people from nearby offices coming in and out.
25647 Unlike other Korean restaurants, their lunch special selection is very limited.
25648 Special A  consists of a sushi roll with a soda, special B = teriyaki beef/chicken (no soda), or special C, Korean BBQ Spicy Chicken.
25649 As we were looking at the "lunch special" board, the lady behind the counter insisted that we should look at their full price menu instead.
25650 Here comes the awkward part: she then asked my mom "are you Chinese?"
25651 Even though she is, my mum looked at me all puzzled as in "what does that mean?"
25652 The lady proceeded by pointing at the "seafood pancake" section on the menu and saying "I don't know why but you Chinese like this pancake a lot."
25653 Good thing my mom didn't hear what she said.. or else...
25654 So we got the Spicy Chicken lunch special ($6.99), a bulgogi ($6.99), and a beef yakisoba ($7.19).
25655 The cool thing about this place is that it has a mini "kimchi" buffet bar, with trays of marinated tofu, potato, bean sprout, kimchi, broccoli and some other vegetables.
25656 It also has this delicious house special hot sauce.
25657 By the time we finished a dish of kimchi, the food came, so it didn't take long.
25658 The spicy chicken, came in a bowl about the size of an instant-noodle bowl (but slightly deeper), was tender, with rice underneath it.
25659 The chicken was definitely marinated well; however, the last couple of pieces had tendons and big chunks of fat... what a bad way to end it.
25660 The bulgogi also came in a bowl, with rice underneath.
25661 The beef was definitely not marinated fully.
25662 The color was super light and the beef was close to tasteless.
25663 The biggest disappointment, food-wise, was the beef yakisoba.
25664 The noodles, occupying most of the Styrofoam lunch box, were sweet.
25665 Then there was an ice-cream scoop of rice, topped with 3 pieces, I kid you not, THREE pieces of dog-tag-sized, super-dry meat.
25666 In the end, we just decided to bring the barely-touched yakisoba home for my younger brother (well, teenage boys tend to eat everything...).
25667 While my mom transfered the noodles to the plastic bowl (since the Styrofoam box was lidless), I went to ask for a plastic cover.
25668 This is the best part: the same lady, stared at me, pointed at the salad bar and said "you can't take that home".
25669 I thought there was a miscommunication, so I asked again for a lid for the noodles.
25670 Again, she pointed at the salad bar and said "you are not allowed to take the kimchi home".
25671 Wow seriously?
25672 Just b/c my grandparents are Chinese you assumed we were stashing kimchi in a bowl and trying to sneak it out?
25673 "Look, I just want to take my noodles home, ok?"
25674 She hesitantly gave me a lid.
25675 "Hey, hey you.
25676 we chineness peple no steal kimchi becuz Confucius say 'no stealing kimchi'"... only if I said that to her face...
25677 Oh, and when we got home, my brother, aka our food dumpster, took a bite of the yakisoba and never touched it again.
25678 Conclusion: If you want amazing Korean food and friendly customer service, please just go to Chodang.
25679 Chodang is WAYYY BETTER, hands down

25709 What a great place to hike/ run/ shred!
25710 It's a great hike to shake up the routine with.
25711 A steep hike with bits of scrambling to a summit with amazing views.
25712 The only downside is there's mad crowds of people snaking their way up and down the hill.
25713 I feel for humanity sake I must pass on some words of advice.
25714 1) If you need to pass- Just say "Excuse Me" or "On your left/right" or, if those don't work, "Can I pass?"
25715 Don't frustrate yourself and huff and puff behind someone because they can't interpret your grunts.
25716 2) The railing sections.
25717 Yes, it's steep but if you see someone running down using the railing and trying to go fast- LET GO and let them pass.
25718 There's this thing called gravity and it will keep you firmly on this earth.
25719 Trust me you're not going to fly off into space nor topple over backwards.
25720 Then you can grab the railing and pull yourself up if that's what you need to do.
25721 3) I can't believe I have to mention this- DON'T FREAKIN' SMOKE on the trail.
25722 Apparently there are some who can't savor life's moments without puffing on a cigarette.
25723 But if I see you smoking as I hike this thing I will be forced to kick you in the shins.
25724 I can't help it it's what happens when I inhale second hand smoke.
25725 4) Your trash does not add to the ambiance.
25726 Pack out what you take in.
25727 This includes dog owners.
25728 Pick it up.
25729 Nothing will decompose because this is a desert.
25730 Just sayin'
25731 5) Finally, sometimes in life when we arrive to our destination and find the parking lot full one must consider finding other options.
25732 Yeah, you in the SUV waiting with the engine running for a spot at the nearest stall to the trail head.
25733 Park down the road and walk up.
25734 Ridiculous.
25735 Happy Hiking!

25751 Just fantastic.
25752 I first went to Cornish Pasty in 05' a few months after they opened and fell in love immediately.
25753 Although a few things have changed over the years each one is usually an improvement and never a negative.
25754 If you are not familiar, a pasty is a traditional British coal miners food.
25755 A hearty filling wrapped in a pie crust and baked.
25756 Kind of a hand-held meat pie.
25757 Cornish Pasty Co. has taken this simple and traditional dish and meticulously perfected each component.
25758 Their crusts are some how simultaneously hearty and flaky.
25759 Although their is nothing delicate about their seasoning it is never out of balance and all of the ingredients are always quality.
25760 Beyond just mastering the finer details of pasty science, Cornish Pasty Co. has also branched off into wild and exotic flavors.
25761 It's no shocker that the British know Indian food and it shows with the tika masala and the lamb vindaloo pasties.
25762 What is shocking is the refinement of the Greek and Italian inspired pasties.
25763 Perhaps my favorite pasty, from the cuisine most elusive to the British, is the Carne Avadado.
25764 This is a Mexican inspired pasty that will satisfy even the most snobby Las Cruses/El Paso foodie.
25765 If you have ever talked Mexican food with one you will know just what I mean.
25766 I have eaten nearly every item on the menu and not a one disappoints.
25767 It took me ages to get past the pasties and start ordering soups and salads.
25768 Now that I have had the spinach, mushroom, walnut soup, it is hart to save room for my old favorites.
25769 Although the mine shaft inspired interior is dark and cramped I have never felt uncomfortable there.
25770 The sound system is usually bumping classic rock and the employees are pierced and tattooed well beyond your typical wait staff, but everyone is friendly and service is typically good.
25771 If I have to list a negative the only one I can think of is the food is consistently just a little better at the University location than the Dobson one.
25772 No clue why, but everyone I've talk to seems to agree, the Tempe store has the edge on quality.
25773 After you add a respectable selection of beers the only reason you won't be here every night is your waist line.
25774 The castle is what drew us here.
25775 It's just the front of a castle with a reading nook in the bottom of the tower.
25776 The 3 year old was impressed as soon as he saw it.
25777 There is also a play area with big activity walls.
25778 It was a little hard for my son to comprehend being quiet while playing.
25779 Getting to the library was confusing with the GPS.
25780 Just follow the signs and park in the garage at the end to the left when you pull in.
25781 Well worth a one time visit.
25782 This place is over priced and the service is horrible.
25783 I went there with my feiends and the server was very rude and degrading!
25784 Dave at Dave's Ashtanga is the best yoga teacher.
25785 He is kind, considerate, patient and a very nice person.
25786 He will take the time to show you a yoga move or asana.
25787 He is very knowledgeable about different subjects.
25788 What I like best is once he said, "here you can do nothing wrong."

25801 Fuego Bistro is one of my new favorites!
25802 A couple people have recommended it to me, so my boyfriend and I decided to try it for restaurant week.
25803 We arrived about 15 minutes before our reservation to have a drink on the patio.
25804 The staff was super welcoming and friendly.
25805 Matt enjoyed a mai tai and I had a red sangria - both very refreshing.

25809 We got the pomegranate mojito (very refreshing) and a peach-blood orange mojito (sweet, but very good)
25810 Starters:
25811 Signature empanadas: Tasty.
25812 The focus was the meat, I would have preferred more vegetables inside.
25813 Sauteed prawns: The star here were the sauces - delicious!
25814 Entrees:

25816 Some of the best we've ever had.

25826 Dessert: (By this point, we knew we'd need to be rolled out of the restaurant, but we HAD to have dessert since it was part of restaurant week).
25827 Chocolate chip bread pudding: Really good chocolate chip bread with scoops of malted chocolate crisp ice cream.
25828 This was a lot of food after that meal, but I savored the bites I had.
25829 The ice cream was excellent!
25830 Banana burrito: exactly what you'd picture with scoops of the same icecream - delicious!
25831 I can't wait to go back to Fuego and tell my friends about it.
25832 Great service, charming atmosphere, and excellent dishes.... Fuego is a winner!

25865 I had a great burger experience here and intend to return the next time I am craving a Fuddburger.
25866 I also got to introduce a friend to Fuddrucker's for the first time, so it was a cherry-poppin' adventure.
25867 Not only are the burgers here tasty, but I love the fact that you get to pick and choose the toppings from their self-serve produce and condiment bars.
25868 One of my favorite things on french fries is Heinz 57 sauce and Fuddrucker's is truly awesome for including that amongst its vast condiment selection.
25869 As a professed condiment whore, I was thrilled to discover a new flavor of Tabasco I have never encountered before... and I like to think I really know my Tabasco products, having lived in Louisiana for years.
25870 This Fuddruckers special-orders the Sweet & Spicy variety of Tabasco which is not only great on a burger, but would work as an egg-roll dipping sauce.
25871 Knowing that I must have it for home use, my dining partner graciously approached the manager who arranged to allow him to purchase a bottle.
25872 This was just one example of how efficient, helpful, and friendly the staff here are.
25873 Next visit, I will demand to meet the one who refers to himself only as "Mr. Crusty Baker" (see photos).
25874 The restaurant also has a lot of shiny fun decor evoking shameless Americana and Route 66 roadside culture.
25875 The bright colors and the overindulgence in fast food goodness contributes to a heightened state of arousal that can only be described as a "Burger Party Contact High".
25876 You can just feel the burger love... the afterglow punctuated by the difficult click of the seat belt as you strap in for a ride back to a somber, less-gluttonous reality.
25877 True fine dining has come to the Valley.
25878 If you are looking to have a special dinner, this is the place.
25879 And plan on spending 3 hours as it is a true culinary experience.
25880 The tasting menu consists of options of 4, 5, or 6 courses, and they can be paired with wine, if you like.
25881 This is the way to go and even for tasting portions, they are not micro-mini.
25882 The choices for each course are extensive.
25883 At least 6-10 each.
25884 AND, the coolest part, is that you won't find any ingredient repeated twice.
25885 NONE.
25886 Yes you might find tomatoes in the same night, but they won't be the same type.
25887 That's not easy to pull off, considering the variety of the menu.
25888 But, while you are between courses, Chef Binkley will send out numerous amuse bouche - which, if you don't know, are tiny little one bit or one gulp appetizers like, mini sliders the size of a half dollar, or pancetta mousse in a shot glass.
25889 We ate there for my ex-H's bday, and had 8 amuse bouche.
25890 Also, if you let them know in advance you are there for a special occasion, you will get custom printed menus for everyone at the table mentioning the special event.
25891 The ONLY drawback, is the atmosphere.
25892 It definitely doesn't fit the quality and beauty of the food.
25893 But, I still give it a 5, as the food is superb.
25894 If you are a true foodie GO.
25895 I was excited the whole meal, as I couldn't wait to see what came out next!
25896 If you are a meat and potatoes type with an uneducated palate, save your time and money, since you won't appreciate the menu at all.

26111 I now consider myself an Arizonian.
26112 If you drive a lot on the 101 or 51 like I do, you'll get your fair share of chips on your windshield.
26113 You'll also have to replace a windshield like I had to do just recently.
26114 Apparently, chips and cracking windshields  is common in Arizona.
26115 In fact, I seem to recall my insurance agent telling me that insurance companies must provide this coverage in Arizona.
26116 I had a chip repaired about a year ago near the very bottom of the windshield.
26117 Just recently a small, very fine crack started traveling north on the windshield from the repaired chip (a different vendor repaired the chip).
26118 I called these guys over to my house and they said it was too long to fix, so they replaced the whole windshield the next day.
26119 What great service, they come out to your residence or place of business to repair or replace your windshield.

26298 I really enjoy writing reviews praising a place for great food, service, ambiance, and value, or any combination of these.
26299 Unfortunately, this isn't one of those reviews.
26300 This is a fish story... No, not about the big one that got away.
26301 Nor is it about the time I was fly fishing with my dad and had to rescue him because he stepped in a deep hole and sank when his waders filled with water.... this is about the trout that saved the day.
26302 When my wife and I arrived at the Greene House, it was earlier in the evening, still happy hour, though we were there for dinner not appetizers.
26303 Checked-in with the hostess and were quoted a  quoted 30-45 minute wait for a table.
26304 We knew the place was popular so weren't upset with the wait as we were looking forward to a wonderful dinner.
26305 Went to the bar to order wine and that's when our disappointment started.
26306 We were sitting in plain view at the edge of the bar facing the entry and there were TWO bartenders,  In spite of this, in the 15 minutes we waited, occasionally waving and saying "excuse me" to get the bartenders' attention, we never even got so much as a Hi, and certainly not an opportunity to order a drink.
26307 I had only just told my wife I wasn't willing to wait another 15-30 minutes wine free when the hostess pleasantly surprised us by saying a table was ready.
26308 Our relief was short lived however.
26309 After being seated, it was approximately 5 minutes before our server came to the table.
26310 We ordered wine and water.
26311 Our wine and water came NINE minutes later... a total of over 30 minutes since we entered the restaurant before we received our first beverage.
26312 We skipped an appetizer, planning ahead for dessert, and for our entree ordered Rainbow Trout with a side of Truffle Parmesan Fries.
26313 Approximately 15 minutes later, our SIDE of Truffle Parmesan Fries showed up... sans trout.
26314 When asked about the missing trout, she said it'd be a few more minutes because the kitchen was backed up.
26315 When asked why she brought the side of fries, she said she thought we wanted them first, a leap of logic that totally escaped us.
26316 When our server said she could take the fries back "to keep them warm until our trout was ready", my wife and I looked at each other in amazement and made a spontaneous decision that given we were now STARVING, our original side of fries would serve us better as a hot appetizer than as a reheated side with dinner.
26317 Finally, a few minutes after our Truffle Parmesan Fries were gone, our trout arrived.
26318 As I indicated in the begining, it saved the day.
26319 The fish was fresh, perfectly prepared and exceptional.
26320 As good as the trout was however, is wasn't good enough to make us ever return to the Greene House.
26321 There is no reason any customer should suffer through such slow and uninspired service when there are at least a dozen restaurants within a 2 mile radius of this one (much less dozens more throughout the Phoeniz metro area), that are SIGNIFICANTLY more enjoyable.
26322 Spend your hard earned money somewhere else

26524 As a former Bay Area resident, I have come to love and appreicate all asian food.
26525 Generally, I prefer Japanese and Thai over Chinese, however, when it comes to Iron Chef it's my favorite.
26526 The location is perfect as it's only a quick two or three minute drive from my house.
26527 Their food is absolutely delcious and is on par with a high end chinese restaurant.
26528 The quality of the meat, fish and vegetables is just excellent and it's always very consistent.
26529 I generally order the garlic chicken as I love spicy food!
26530 It's a wonderful mix of vegetables and white meat and the sauce is perfect, full of flavor and not at all greasy.
26531 I also like the fact that they offer brown rice as an option and their eggrolls are some of the best I've tasted.
26532 The family meal for $29.95 is an excellent value and is enough food for four or five people.
26533 We ordered it for the two of us and had leftovers for a week!
26534 It includes sweet/sour pork, broccoli beef, orange chicken, chow mein, fried rice, steamed rice, soup and eggrolls.
26535 I sure hope that Iron Chef survives the recession.
26536 I try to eat there as often as I can :)

26538 The food and service is better than any other 'Chang's' country-wide.
26539 We just moved here from NY and missed our "local hangout".

26541 We go at least once per week for wonder food, drink, and company with the staff and other patrons.
26542 Thank you Clint, Gerry, Nate, Kyle, Nick, Angie, et al.
26543 This is a family owned local restaurant at it's best.
26544 If you like to explore and support locally owned businesses, you should definitely give this one a try.
26545 They have a big menu and I have tried breakfast and lunch and both were excellent, but the breakfast is particularly good.
26546 I love the breakfast burrito.
26547 (to the reviewer that complained about the greasy chorizo...hello, it is chorizo, chorizo is sausage).
26548 I would go out of my way to stop and eat here whenever in the general area.

26833 The decor is nice.
26834 Simple, with a classic cucina feel.
26835 The brick oven is the star of this place.
26836 Clearly.
26837 We ordered some bread to get started.
26838 It came with a little cup of high end olive oil.
26839 Fantastic!
26840 The crust was crisp, and the bread was chewy to the point where you can't help but smile when you eat this.
26841 The pizza is phenomenal.
26842 We ordered two pizzas (for three people).
26843 One was half Rosa and half Margherita, the other was the Biancoverde.
26844 This way we were able to try three different kinds of pizza .
26845 All three styles were phenomenal.
26846 The winner of the three was the Margherita.
26847 The tomato sauce doesn't overpower, the mozzarella melts like a dream, and a hint of basil.
26848 The Rosa was unique, and also delicious.
26849 The Arizona pistachios take some getting used to, but pairs well with the red onion.
26850 The Biancoverde was much more complex.
26851 Definitely a hearty pizza because of the ricotta cheese.
26852 Very tasty.
26853 It's topped with arugala, so you will get a nice earthy, and loud flavor.
26854 Usually when I eat pizza, I take a bite of the crust, and then I leave the rest.
26855 Not here.
26856 I went through the entire pizza slice because it's perfect.
26857 Chewy, crispy, and full of happy!
26858 Take it from me....this place is worth the hype.
26859 Look at the reviews from other Yelpers.
26860 Even the picky ones love this place.
26861 Maybe it's true.
26862 Maybe Chris Bianco did learn how to make pizza from Jesus.
26863 Sure as hell tastes like it.

26865 Worth the 3 hour wait?
26866 YES.
26867 Bring all your friends here?
26868 YES.
26869 Will I guarantee the awesome?
26870 YES.

26917 Ordered a bacon havarti burger with fries and a coke; it came out to just over 9 bucks.
26918 The burger came with lettuce, tomato, cucumber (???
26919 ), pickled red onions, and thousand island.
26920 It was DELICIOUS.
26921 Beautifully toasted bun, great char on the meat.
26922 The pickled onions were a nice touch.
26923 The fries were skinny and crispy and had seasoned salt, which brings me back to being a kid and getting fries at the food court in the mall (good memories).
26924 I got a refill on my coke before I left, so I don't know what another reviewer was talking about when they said there are no refills on sodas.
26925 I asked and it was no problem.
26926 My only gripe is that after I had ordered and sat down to wait for my food, a couple of guys came in and the guy at the counter immediately handed them paper menus (with actual descriptions of the menu items I'm sure, unlike the chalkboard on the wall), which I would have liked.
26927 I probably would have gotten an add-on for my burger if he had given me a paper menu when I was at the counter.
26928 Oh well, now I know for next time, because there will definitely be a next time in the near future :)

27044 After a long week of being trapped in a conference room, I really really needed to be outside.
27045 Pinnacle Peak helped to put me back in my normal happy place.
27046 This spot is very popular and can get really crowded on weekends.
27047 I wanted to enjoy a little bit of solitude, so I arrived as the sun was rising.
27048 Good choice - there were only a few others around on this chilly morning.
27049 The 3+ mile trail is an out-and-back route, with enough ups and downs to keep it interesting.
27050 Like a stairmaster, but better because you aren't in a gym squished next to some icky sweaty person.
27051 The well-maintained path is packed gravel, so you can spend more time enjoying the beautiful views rather focusing on where you are stepping.
27052 For those that want to take their time and learn a little, there are small signs along the route that label various plants, as well as two rest points with markers to tell you the names of the mountains you can see in the distance.
27053 Get up!
27054 Go outside!
27055 You will love it as much as I do.

27198 I had an amazing dinner tonight at Quiessence.
27199 When we made the reservation they asked if we were celebrating anything; we were, so when we sat down we were given 3 glasses of complimentary champagne.
27200 We started with a plate of three delicious cheeses.
27201 They have a huge selection of cheeses, probably about 20, and we chose a goat, a smoked gouda and a jack.
27202 All delicious and served with crostini, perfectly melt-in-your-mouth bartlett pears, pecans, honey and quince paste.
27203 Great start.
27204 Our next course we shared two salads - an octopus carpaccio and field green salad.
27205 Both good.
27206 My main course was AMAZING.
27207 It was heritage turkey with mashed potatoes and carrots.
27208 I ate every bite.
27209 SO flavorful.
27210 My dad had a beef sirloin that was perfectly cooked and delicious with a side of fingerling potatoes.
27211 My mom got swordfish.
27212 It was not cooked properly when it first came out, but they promptly corrected the problem, so i can't fault them for that.
27213 The ambience was great including a live but not distracting singer and a warm crackling fireplace.
27214 In addition, I want to give big props to the servers for knowing everything about the food they served.
27215 She knew where the fish was caught, how the beef was raised, what certifications the turkey farm had achieved.
27216 It is great to be able to get those kind of answers with zero attitude when you ask the question.
27217 My only reservations would be 1) definitely is "slow" food, maybe a tad too slow but so delicious it was worth it and they said they were short staffed and 2) i'm not sure i buy that their seafood is sustainable.
27218 They served atlantic cod and atlantic swordfish.
27219 My understanding is that both of these fish stocks are pretty severely depleted.
27220 I asked and was told that the fisherman they buy from are committed to sustainable methods, but I'm not sure (personally, for me, at least) that it is possible to sustainably fish a stock that is in danger.
27221 All in all though, a fantastic night and i can't wait to return!

27300 I buy Hava Java beans and brew them at home, but when I stop in for a quick cup of coffee I always have a good experience.
27301 This is the largest urban park.
27302 Moreover, that urban part is great because I am 10-30 minutes from three major trailhead areas.
27303 For hiking I like many points of entry, one of my favorites is telegraph pass, this is on the south side of the mountain.
27304 A new recently remolded parking lot is found on desert foothills parkway.
27305 There is a paved path that is about 1/2 a mile and at its end Telegraph pass is to the left and Desert classic is to the right.
27306 Telegraph pass grows in steepness towards the top where there are some larger stairs.
27307 At the top, there is a bench and you can then continue on National trail.
27308 If you head west, you can reach a great Ramada.
27309 From the pima canyon entrance I take the fire road to national, after the initial ascent it is just some rolling hills, I then make left to hidden valley where there is a great natural tunnel, Follow this trail to reach fat man's pass, contrary to the name there is a narrow gap that fat men cannot pass luckily you can go around, this meets back up with national trail.
27310 Many unique rock formations on this hike.
27311 For shorter easier hikes from this lot, you can do the east and west loops and Beverly canyon all small trails that loop, and have a few nice views.
27312 For Mountain biking my skills are not too advanced so I stick to the east end of desert classic, with mostly straight section and a few wash passes and slight hill inclines it's great for a novice rider.

27333 I put forth that we need to institute a new standard of measurement to be used for comparing coffee shops.
27334 Furthermore, I think that Cartel Coffee Labs should use this place as a standard for this new unit of measurement.
27335 I have to assume it's called a "Coffee Lab" for a reason.
27336 Too many coffee shops these days are retail stores, where coffee is an incidental thing in all the yelling, stupid names, and fancy colors.
27337 If you look at the menu of Cartel Coffee Lab, there are a total of 13 items.
27338 It's all about the coffee, plain and simple.
27339 Then again, there's really nothing simple about it to those who take their coffee as seriously as this place does.
27340 The artistry of their baristas is not to be trifled with.
27341 These people can make a latte so pretty, you really won't want to drink it (until you do, then you're happy you did).
27342 On top of that, the selection of coffee varietals is impressive.
27343 I've only tried one, but that alone was better than anything Starbucks tries to pawn off on the masses.
27344 Perhaps the use of the term "Lab" is because they've actually stepped beyond anything any other coffee shop has done.
27345 Either way, the formula that they came up with works better than anything I've come across before.
27346 Then again, maybe I'm being too hard on the other places.
27347 It's not that they have an intrinsically inferior product, but the reason for these places has been lost behind t shirts and mugs and open mic nights and selling you a card containing the same money you'd use on the place anyway...
27348 I digress.
27349 Cartel Coffee Labs is a great place with a fantastic product.
27350 If their WiFi is weak or the back corner gets dark, I honestly don't care.
27351 Their coffee is excellent and I'll be coming back for more.

27600 The kind you would drive by and never even notice if you weren't looking for it.

27609 With a few hours past and a few tasks accomplished the next stop of my day would be at Pane Bianco - the sandwich shop from the Valley's most celebrated Chef, Chris Bianco.
27610 Having made my pilgrimage to the eponymous pizzeria during my first trip to Phoenix, Pane had been on my radar since the day I moved to town but given the lunch-only hours and my office location in North Scottsdale I knew a weekend would be best and as luck would have it a new website (http://www.pizzeriabianco.com/) and seven day 11a-3p schedule had been rolled out just the week prior.
27611 Arriving at the surprisingly large space (especially when compared to Matt's and JoBot from earlier that day - and compared to Pizzeria Bianco as well) shortly after 11:30 and allocating parking in the free lot juxtaposing the Light Rail I debated for a moment whether dine-in or to-go was best and opting for the former made my way into the restaurant where two couples already sat.
27612 Greeted by one of two servers it was suggested I could take "any seat I wanted" and opting for a bench in the center of the room where a menu awaited I sat down to browse the menu as well as the daily specials listed on the chalkboard - almost all sounding appealing, but a bit different than the Saturday special listed on the website.
27613 With a small list of beverages available I was asked soon if I was ready to order or if I needed a few minutes I deferred and requested a glass of water that would never reach even half-empty despite me drinking from it consistently and the restaurant soon filling to capacity.
27614 Having debated the specials but eventually undeterred from the reason I'd come in the first place I soon placed my order for a sandwich and an 'appetizer' which I was told would be 'just a few minutes' and as while I waited I checked out the small market at the Take Away section featuring the famous focaccia, cans of tomatoes, dried pasta, and apparel before returning to my seat where my items would arrive shortly - the first a Manchego and Tomato Sauce Focaccia del Giorno featuring Bianco's delectable wood fired focaccia in all of its spongy glory topped with sweet, ripe tomatoes and an ample layer of briny Manchego; at $4.50 probably the most expensive "Grandma Slice" I've ever had yet at the same time also probably the best...or at least on par with that at DiFara in Brooklyn for best of its genre.
27615 Moving next to the original target of my desire, a sandwich of Bianco's House Made Mozzarella, Tomatoes, and Basil on Wood Fired Focaccia my first thought was "wow - that is a lot of cheese" while my second, after a bite, was "wow - that is a lot of flavor."
27616 Perhaps as pure of a sandwich as you can find and the result of exquisite ingredients on top quality bread there is really nothing 'special' about the composition of this sandwich aside from the fact that it simply works - a largely unmanipulated masterpiece only improved by a touch of sea salt and cracked black pepper.
27617 Largely unaware on entering that Pane serves dessert it was with much delight that I realized soon after sitting down that three options were available that day and while the flourless chocolate cake I saw emerge from the kitchen to the table next to me looked quite nice there was simply no way I was passing up the Organic Vanilla Bean Rice Pudding with Candied Pecans - another simplistic stunner with creamy Arborio rice imbued with a rich vanilla custard flicked with whole vanilla beans and a few pecans for crunch.
27618 Delicate and smooth, flavorful without being overly sweet, and *almost* thick enough to stand a spoon up straight it was not quite the best rice pudding I've ever had - but a top five contender without a shadow of a doubt - a reason in and of itself to return to Pane Bianco...though to be fair, if I returned it would take pretty spectacular daily specials to prevent me from ordering the exact same trio of items once again.
27619 With Chris and his team now two for two it is only a matter of time before I make my way to Italian Restaurant... and honestly, that time is likely measured in hours and days as opposed to weeks and months.

27651 I love red heavily tart, fruity teas.
27652 It doesn't matter to me if there is no white, green, or black tea in it.
27653 In fact, I prefer it to just be the fruit.
27654 I drink it hot, and then as it cools all day in my tea pot, I keep refilling and either warm each huge travel mug with lid in the microwave, or drink it room temp, or even add some ice if it is particularly strong.
27655 I can EASILY drop $150 at Teavana, or $120 at Tea District and just touch on what I most want.
27656 With your three vouchers worth $60, I got to try two bags of every flavor I most wanted, except Peach (as they are out of it, but Holly wrote me several times and made recommendations based on what I had in my cart).
27657 I know I will love it, and go back to order the Peach when it is in stock again.
27658 Thank you so much for finding a local treasure and making it accessible.
27659 Sincerely,
27660 Judith Ann Hillard
27661 President of Addiction Overcome, Inc., a non-profit foundation
27662 Author of The Other Woman at the Well
27663 www.addictionovercome.com

27666 Dive bars are plentiful in Phoenix, but the Bikini is in my 'hood.
27667 It's a dirty, unassuming place, with a couple of no-nonsense bartenders and a good jukebox.
27668 There are a couple of rules to follow when visiting the Bikini:
27669 1.
27670 Bring cash.
27671 Cards aren't accepted, the atm machine is there for decoration only, as it hasn't worked in at least two years.
27672 2.
27673 Don't make fun of the guy in the overalls and farmer hat.
27674 He's my neighbor.
27675 3.
27676 Don't piss off the bartenders.
27677 Tip them well, treat them nicely, and don't order more than three dirty martinis.
27678 If you are nice to them, they will be nice to you.
27679 This includes, but is not limited to: the strength of your drinks, the price of your drinks, and whether or not you get a drink at all.
27680 They take no shit.

28075 Moreover, they are a FULL  service pharmacy, they also offer delivery (handy when you feel like you are on the verge of death) and useful recommendations on the pros and cons on a on non-prescription drugs and vitamins (often recommending the lower priced generic brand).
28076 In addition, you can find a wide variety of homeopathic products, as well as a selection of snacks, books and small gifts.
28077 Even if you don't need to get a prescription filled, it's worth a visit to check out the retro interior and grab and grab a vintage bottled pop and candy.
28078 Better yet, stop by on a First Friday when the pharmacy features live music, and frequent art shows in the studio in the same complex.
