28384 My sister recently took her '98 VW New Beetle to First Class Auto in Scottsdale, AZ for an overheating issue.
28385 I'm normally the one who does the maintenance on the vehicle but I was ~600 miles away.
28386 She described the symptoms as follows: overheating light came on while she was stuck in construction traffic and went back off once she was moving again.
28387 I immediately suggested that the radiator fans may not be coming on for some reason.
28388 Since I wasn't around to look at it, she took it to First Class Auto.
28389 She relayed the symptoms to the guys at First Class and also SPECIFICALLY requested they check  radiator fan functionality.
28390 They told her the water pump was cracked and leaking, needed a new thermostat and also replace the timing belt and serpentine belt while they were in there (water pump is driven by the timing belt on this engine--2.0L 8V 4 cyl AEG code).
28391 Well, a) I personally replaced the timing belt, water pump and serpentine belt about 10,000 miles ago as preventative maintenance.
28392 What's more is the car hasn't lost any coolant since the job.
28393 So the water pump being cracked is highly unlikely!
28394 I did not replace the thermostat, though.
28395 Once she called me to tell me this, I told her to decline the work and either take it somewhere else or wait for me to make a trip out.
28396 I had a job to do that brought me almost half way to the Phoenix area so I decided I would make the trip the rest of the way to have a look for myself yesterday.
28397 FIRST thing I did was check the radiator fans.
28398 I turned on the AC and the fans didn't come on at all.
28399 I pop the cover off the strip fuse panel that resides on top of the battery and found a melted 30 AMP fuse.
28400 Guess what that fuse is for?
28401 The RADIATOR FANS!
28402 Imagine that.
28403 Being a car that lived most of its life in Michigan, some of the fuses and the fuse panel itself had become corroded and caused the one fuse and part of the fuse panel to melt.
28404 The coolant level was exactly at the max level, right where it was after I did the maintenance on it 10,000 miles ago, not to mention I checked it before her recent trip to Scottsdale (didn't have to add anything.
28405 The car doesn't leak a drop of coolant).
28406 Local dealer had a new fuse panel in stock, I swapped it out and replaced all 3 of the 30 amp blade fuses as they were all corroded pretty badly.
28407 The larger strip fuses were still decent.
28408 The radiator fans now work as normal and the car does not overheat.
28409 The hose coming off the thermostat also becomes pressurized and hot at the correct temperature as well, so that's definitely not a problem!
28410 Fans also come on automatically once the coolant temp hits 99 deg Celsius like they're supposed to.
28411 Problem solved!
28412 I drove down to First Class Auto today to give them a chance to explain/defend themselves, but there was only one guy working in the shop who she didn't recognize and no one at the counter.
28413 What great customer service!
28414 So she COULD have spent the quoted $800 and STILL had the same problem!
28415 She just got dinged for a ~$40 diagnostic fee... for an incorrect diagnosis.
28416 I absolutely love this sub shop!
28417 Its the only place i will get a sub sandwich!
28418 I have been going here for over 10 years and i NEVER get tired of it!
28419 Mitch is an awesome owner and he really cares about the customer!
28420 MUST GO!

28480 Baiz Market is a "Mediterranean" type restaurant, or "Arabic" type food.
28481 Well, you could get confused and call it that.
28482 The fact of the matter is though, that this place has a very unique touch.
28483 This restaurant is a staple not only for groceries, but also its food.
28484 The owner is persian, so you can tell where the tastes are coming from.
28485 Its somewhat hidden in the heart of Phoenix, but that's ok, once you are there you will be glad you found it.
28486 This place is unique because they make their own bread!
28487 Are you kidding me?
28488 I only recently found out about this place like 3 years ago, and I've been living in Phoenix for 20 years.
28489 The chicken and beef shawarma have a special, authentic taste because of the fresh bread.
28490 One of the best parts about the shawarma is not only its amazing taste, but the pricing is very fair as well.
28491 I don't think I can stress this enough, but the fresh bread just sets this place apart from all the impostors in the Phoenix metro area.
28492 Why haven't the other restaurants caught on?
28493 I know of maybe one persian restaurant that makes their own bread, but their pricing makes them a different story (I'm talking about 'The Persian Room' in Scottsdale).
28494 I just don't understand how other restaurants can serve the bread that comes in plastic bags from a manufacturer hundreds of miles away.
28495 'Good bread' and 'Arabic bread' are all good forms of pita that have great shelf life due to the ridiculous amounts of preservatives, but they just don't taste fresh.
28496 If you like the bread, head to the back of the store and there is a shelf of freshly baked pita bread, its baked throughout the day, I think.
28497 I can tell because sometimes my bread is still warm and the bag has a little condensation.
28498 Beware though, the bread gets hard and crunchy after a few days, so you really need to use it quickly.
28499 This isn't bad, its just I think they choose not to add preservatives to ensure the freshness of the pita.
28500 I usually just get the chicken or beef shawarma, but I decided I'd get a kabob plate one day because I also wanted hummus.
28501 The beef kabob plate came with hummus, bread, 2 skewers of beef kabob, and some pickles and onions.
28502 Wow.
28503 The beef kabobs were cooked perfectly, and were EXTREMELY tender.
28504 It was a tad bit on the lemony side, but I suppose that was necessary to make it so tender.

28506 The hummus was definitely good as well, I can't stand restaurants that crack open a can of premade hummus.

28584 Came here with the hubs- and we love the place :)  We were able to eat here for significantly less dinero than you typically spend at any other sushi restaurant.
28585 The food comes by on the conveyer belts and the items are price coded by the color plate they are on.
28586 At the end of your meal you just add up the plates for your total.
28587 Each plate comes with 4-6 pieces of sushi- and they also have salads, desserts, appetizers, etc on the belt.
28588 If you are afraid that the sushi has been on the belt for too long or there is something else that you would like that isn't currently on display you can order direct from the bar.

28663 Our server told us that the broth stews for at least 12 hours allowing it to achieve the best flavor from the pho spices!

28786 I know, I'll share the best part about my amazing birthday dinner at Elements -- meeting Executive Chef Beau Macmillian.
28787 He didn't duck away when we made eye contact in the hallway, instead he broke away from his staff and came right up and introduced himself.
28788 He was so incredibly personable.
28789 He could have easily ignored us.
28790 I'm sure he's approached on a regular basis now that he's such a TV personality.
28791 But instead, he chatted us up and he talked about how he was so inspired by Asian food and how he wanted to bring that influence into his food and to Arizona.
28792 Before we knew it he was taking us in to see the latest renovations to Elements' kitchen!
28793 He proudly showed off the latest upgrades.
28794 Sure, there were new gadgets, but he even included skylights because his sous chefs said they hated never seeing the light of day.
28795 How cool is that?
28796 And to be revealed next month is an expansion to the kitchen that includes a table for 12 INSIDE the kitchen.
28797 Not a new concept for restaurants, but something Chef Macmillian is so excited about.
28798 There's no doubt that the food that he cranks out can be intimidating, but his latest endeavor speaks to his desire of having his guests witness the artistry behind the kitchen doors.
28799 This new addition promises to give you a full sensory experience BEFORE the plate even reaches your table -  from seeing, smelling and hearing what's happening in the kitchen to finally tasting the finished product.
28800 Talk about mouth watering.
28801 Here's hoping that I will one day get to sit at that table.

28824 For the next 15 minutes I tried to get her attention to alert her that we were ready to order - no luck.

28826 I wasn't about to give up because I was determined to try some of their well-reviewed food, but after a quarter of an hour spent trying to get their attention with them just laughing and pointing at us, my boyfriend and I had enough.
28827 The way they treated us was disrespectful and humiliating, so we walked out and drove across town to another Vietnamese restaurant.
28828 We are never going back to this restaurant, and I suggest you don't either.
28829 Just as it isn't acceptable for customers to be rude to restaurant staff, it also isn't okay for restaurant staff to be blatantly rude to customers who have not done anything to deserve bad treatment.
28830 We did not deserve the type of treatment we got at this restaurant and I am seriously fuming with anger as I write this review.
28831 I don't care how delicious and cheap your food is, you cannot use that as an excuse to make customers who come in feel like somehow they are undeserving individuals.
28832 Thanks, but no thanks, Pho House.
28833 I don't need to feel disrespected and belittled just so I can try your cheap Vietnamese food.
28834 I have plenty of Vietnamese friends who have moms who can probably cook better than you can and will treat us a million times better than your staff did last night.

28886 My dad and I decided to try Great Wall because he had heard many reviews about the place and everyone insisted that you had to come try the Dim Sum.
28887 Since I was in town visiting, it gave us the perfect excuse to go.
28888 I'm happy to report that the experience was most excellent at Great Wall and that it lived up to the hype.
28889 Upon getting there, we were given a number to wait as the restaurant was completely full, there were probably 150+ people there dining, however, we were seated within 15 minutes.
28890 As soon as we  sat down, the carts started rolling by with various plates of items to try.
28891 The pancake, shu mai, shrimp, duck, and sliced beef inside a wrapper are highly recommended, all were excellent.
28892 I did have a bit of trouble taking the shrimp out of the steam container because their rice wrappers were sticking a bit, but that does happen.
28893 I would advise that if you have an allergy to shrimp that you make sure to ask the server what is in some of the items because they do come with shrimp, including their egg rolls.
28894 Since my dad has a shrimp allergy we did have to watch for that.
28895 I did want to try their egg rolls but I would have been the only one eating them, and they were big enough to make a meal in itself.
28896 The sliced duck was one of the best I have had at a restaurant, well cooked with crispy tasty skin, and not too many bones to get in the way, and very reasonably priced at $6.25 for a plate.
28897 Most other Dim Sum plates are $2.25 or $3.15 so you can end up eating a lot for a very reasonable price.
28898 If you love Dim Sum and are willing to wait a few minutes for a table, but you will get fast service afterward, this really is the place you want to go to.
28899 There are still so many more dishes to try as well, but that will be for another trip.

29044 I entered Mimi's Cafe at the end of possibly worst day ever.
29045 I came in looking to order food for takeout and get home to drown my sorrows in comfort food.
29046 i was directed by the hostess up front to go stand by the bakery and i would be able to order take out.
29047 i waited not 15 seconds and was greeted with a huge smile from a lovely girl named Danielle.
29048 She gave me a menu and told me to ask if i had questions and inquired if i had been there before.
29049 i looked at the menu for some time, unable to clear my mind enough to decide.
29050 She told me i was welcome to take a seat, and when i apologized for taking so long she responded with a smiley "where's the fire?
29051 take your time, can i get you a glass of wine while you decide?"
29052 wine was a perfect idea!
29053 I finally ordered and sat drinking my wine.
29054 i waited, and then waited a little longer, Danielle the young girl doing take out informed me the kitchen was working as fast as they could but are very busy, she apologized for the wait and offered complimentary bread  and convinced me to buy a a second glass of wine.
29055 When she brought me the second glass i had just gotten off the phone and was visibly shaken with more bad news.
29056 Somehow this young girl had the courage to ask if everything was alright and what she could do to help.
29057 It was just the olive branch i needed.
29058 Just the inquiry was enough to make me feel better.
29059 i told her i was fine and thanked her for her compassion.
29060 finally my food was ready.
29061 She boxed everything with care for the drive home.
29062 All this time smiling.
29063 i couldn't help but notice Danielle interact with the other employees they always laughed or high fived her with each exchange.
29064 She had brightened my day, and it was clear she is a light for others in Mimi's Cafe.
29065 This is the kicker...my bill was $30 and some change...i gave her what i thought was two $20 dollar bills, but in reality was a $50 and a $20.
29066 The young girl ran outside and stopped me saying sir, I'm not sure these bills are right.
29067 i was overwhelmed by her honesty and told her no, i thought they were two 20's but the difference would be her reward for honesty.

29285 Honestly the best part of this place is the unbelievable deal you can get on pet related products.
29286 Because they are one of the primary income sources for HALO Animal Rescue, people that have pets, tend to make donations.
29287 You can almost always find pet carriers for under $10.
29288 They have dog crates for training and you don't have to shell out a fortune for them.
29289 They have fish tanks that will allow you to let little Johnny get his feet wet in the world of pet care and the associated responsibilities without breaking the bank.
29290 If you are a person that shares your life with animals, you understand the rarity of these kinds of deals!
29291 Yes they have clothes, furniture, tchatchkies, etc., but the real deals are on the pet products.
29292 As a side note, HALO recently leased the MCCAC location at 5231 North 35th Avenue (It was the previous Maricopa County run cat adoption center).
29293 So if you are looking for a companion (cat or dog), check them out and support one of the fastest growing no-kill efforts in the US.

29515 It's 1961 and we're having lunch in the courtyard of our Miami Beach hotel.

29521 I work to orient myself in time and space and find, what a relief, that I'm actually in Cafe ZuZu in downtown Scottsdale and it's 2010.
29522  The Valley Ho Resort, which houses the Cafe, is such a wonderful period piece.
29523 It opened in 1956 and was renovated in 2005 by a very wise design team that left the mid-century architecture and spirit intact.
29524 Cafe ZuZu is at the far end of the lobby, and its charming patio is surrounded with flowers.
29525 The decor is late 50's.
29526 If you're as old as we are, you'll recognize it instantly.
29527 The menu consists of "Flavorful American comfort food.
29528 Familiar favorites with a contemporary twist."
29529 There are goodies like warm Maytag blue cheese fondue ($7.50), truffled grilled cheese ($9), beef stroganoff ($17), and (gross) tuna salad with cottage cheese which brings me back to my childhood a little too clearly.
29530  While waiting for our entrees, we received a basket of Parker House rolls.
29531 These are the nice squishy white bread treats that, if you can manage not to eat them all, make wonderful toys.
29532 You can mold them into sculptures, or shape them into little round beebees to shoot through your straw.
29533 My meatloaf sandwich ($11.25) was served on a thick piece of grilled white bread topped first with melty cheese, then the meatloaf, then the gravy.
29534 There was a mound of lumpless mashed potatoes alongside.
29535 They were so smooth Ken wondered if they were made from instant, but they tasted much too good for that.
29536 The portion was huge, I took half home (of course I knew I was going to have dessert).
29537 Ken had sauteed liver, beautifully prepared, atop a mound of kale that had been cooked with high quality bacon, sauced with a Madera reduction.
29538 He loved it.
29539 I surprised him by ordering a lemon meringue tart ($6) for us to share.
29540 There were several chocolate desserts that sounded good, but I had a vision of the mile high meringue toppings of my childhood.
29541 The tart had only modest swirls of meringue, but it had been made in such a way that it was creamy, as opposed to foamy, and it was really good.The lemon custard was the star.
29542 I remembered a gelatinous filling, but this was smooth and velvety, with just the right tart/sweet balance.
29543 The pastry was a cross between cookie and pie crust, and stood up well to the filling.
29544  This was not an inexpensive meal, but the portions are large and quality is excellent.
29545 Plus we had joined an organization called The Lunch Club, which every weekday, emails it's members a discount coupon for a restaurant in their specified zip code.
29546 So one of our entrees was free!
29547 (The discount coupons differ, some are 20% off the bill, others merely are for a free drink).
29548 But, to pay Cafe ZuZu the ultimate compliment - I'd come here and pay full price.
29549 Love the carne asada.
29550 St. Francis gives the impression you could be dining in one of the finest cities in the world, instead of the 5th largest cities in the USA.
29551 Start with their cucumber gin drink, and then order another.
29552 Goat cheese on crostini follows.
29553 Insist on extremely memorable whipped potatoes--a side order-- to accompany your salmon on red quinoa.
29554 Dessert MUST be the chocolate cake with peanut butter gelato accompanied by carmel sauce trailings and carmel corn garnishes.
29555 Try dining at the bar for an uncluttered view out the picture window opening, minus the glass.
29556 Loved it!
29557 Will happily return.
29558 They split our entree for us AND were gracious about the extra trouble we caused--not a wimper.
29559 Truly superior service !

29561 If you ask me about eating at Papaya Thai, that is what I will say.
29562 0 stars for the single kinda scattered and scruffy staffperson.
29563 0 stars for the cook who cannot prepare an offering from the menu as the menu describes it.
29564 In this case, I was down to two remaining untried Thai restaurants within quick reach of the Valley Metro Limo, and both in Tempe.
29565 The other half was in Tampa, and since he does not care much for Thai, I get the chance to try one.
29566 The limo arrived at Southern and Mill at 5:17 PM, and connected me with another limo at Broadway.
29567 With traffic, getting to McClintock took nearly 15 minutes.
29568 On exiting the limo, 5:50 PM, I walked back about half a block to the restaurant.
29569 On entering the restaurant, I picked up a menu and rang the bell and a somewhat harried staff person came to greet me.
29570 He asked me where I wanted to sit, at a table with 1 bench looking directly into the side of a huge fish tank...or the next table, which would leave no buffer between myself and the only other table seated in the restaurant.
29571 There are at least 120 seats in this restaurant.
29572 Why so fiercely contain people in the first three tables close to the door?
29573 You must get your business in fits and hurries and keeping only the 3 tables active is working for you?
29574 Then again, your telling me you are the only staffperson does not surprise me.
29575 The Help Wanted sign on the door was more than an indication that Help is NEEDED!
29576 When I was seated, staffperson offered to bring water.
29577 The phone rang and he was off, as he offered another version of "I am the only staffperson here..."  I looked at the menu and made my decision.
29578 In the menu, there is a $2 charge listed for sharing.
29579 This goes against everything Thai I have ever known.
29580 The traditional Thai meal has everyone enjoying some of each dish served.
29581 Because of my proximity to the fish tank, I was quite up close and personal with the fish.
29582 The water probably isn't filthy, but the plexiglass tank is not helping the perception.
29583 6 PM, as the cellphone chime reminds me of the passing of an hour.
29584 I am waiting for water and a staffperson who can take my order.
29585 6:01, the staffperson comes, bearing a pitcher of water and a (My eyes are rolling in opposite directions because I am either overworked or stoned) smile.
29586 He filled up my glass and asked if I was ready to order.
29587 I replied that I was and ordered Som Tom, the Thai name for the green papaya salad.
29588 Staffperson replied that he did not know the Thai names for the menu items.
29589 The phone rang again.
29590 Staffperson's attention was no longer on me.
29591 The phone, his Pavlovian stimuli, had taken him away.
29592 I asked if he had heard me.
29593 He replied that he needed to go answer the phone.
29594 He asked if I minded waiting, as he was the only staffperson.
29595 I said I would wait.
29596 Off he went, in pursuit of electronic interaction.
29597 6:10 PM, staffperson returns, apologizing for the telephone delay and asking about my order.
29598 I ordered the papaya salad without the green beans and steamed rice on the side.
29599 Staffperson took the order and went to the kitchen.
29600 The phone rang as he left the table,  his pace quickening as he approached the phone.
29601 6:18 PM, the door opens and 2 potential patrons enter.
29602 The bell rings and staffperson rushes to the waitstand to greet 2 new patrons.
29603 6:20 PM, staffperson returns.
29604 He brings the salad and a bowl of rice.
29605 The salad that appears has some of the traditional salad ingredients along with ingredients that have no business being in the salad.
29606 Som Tom does not have cucumber, shredded lettuce or cilantro.
29607 On sending back the initial preparation, staffperson returned with the original preparation, advising the chef stated "This is a traditional Thai presentation of the dish".
29608 I sent the order back, citing the inconsistencies and asking for a new presentation.
29609 6:25 pm.
29610 As I empty my water glass, the salad I received previously is returned, minus the cucumber.
29611 In asking staffperson if this is a new presentation or if it is an attempt to correct the original, he replied that he did not know.
29612 I stood and left.

29631 Mr. T is Japanese & I lived in Japan for @4 years, so take my word it's authentic.
29632 The mix of foods is not so strange if you're familiar with restaurants in Japan.
29633 The ramen is Hakata style, made with a pork broth & may be heavy/oily for some people, so why not please everybody?
29634 Be sure to ask for "Cha Shu Ramen" to get a few more pieces of pork.
29635 (extra $)
29636 The salads are also fantastic; warm lightly fried (10?
29637 )Shrimp on a fresh spring mix base with mango dressing,  Shanghai Duck salad, and the Chicken Caesar was perfect, not heavily dressed like some "roadhouses."

29640 So there are French pastries, German beer, Italian pasta, and Indian curries.

29860 Let me begin by telling you about my horribly debilitating fear of going to the dentist.
29861 It's epic.
29862 Weeks before an appointment I start having nightmares.
29863 Thinking about sitting in the dental chair makes me break out in a cold sweat.
29864 I require nitris oxide for a simple cleaning.
29865 The sound of the drill is enough to make me want to claw my face off.
29866 Basically, every visit has been the worst experience ever for the past 30 years....
29867 Enter Dr. Marcia Blazer.
29868 I read about her online when searching for a local dentist here in Scottsdale.
29869 I literally googled "dentists for anxious patients", and her name popped up.
29870 Her website appeared too good to be true.
29871 They offered nitris (plus), offered non invasive options for dental procedures (double plus), and offered a staff used to accomodating those with a healthy dose of dental fear.
29872 I went in for my first visit (a cleaning and exam), and I was amazed at how comfortable they made me feel.
29873 They were warm and friendly, and put me at ease immediately.
29874 During the cleaning, my least favorite part is always when they use the scrapy,pointy torture device to stab off all the plaque at the gumline.
29875 How happy was I when they used an air abrasion tool instead...felt like a cool stream of water on your teeth, and BAM, they're clean!
29876 They were so calming, that when I was informed that I had 2 cavities, I didn't even have a panic attack at the thought of coming in.
29877 Fast forward two weeks to my filling appointment.
29878 I had requested nitris (hey, I was feeling better but still SUPER anxious), which they had all set up in the room for me when I walked in.
29879 Now here's my favorite part.
29880 As I sat in the chair, the assistant brought over two big boxes full of dvd's and asked me what movie I would like to watch during the procedure...What??
29881 So I picked a lighthearted comedy (50 First Dates).
29882 I was then given noise eliminating headphones to use (goodbye horrible drilling sound), nitris (hello happy gas), and a few hand signals to recognize if I was supposed to open or close my mouth.
29883 And we were off!
29884 She didn't try to maintain conversation (soooo annoying when dentists do that), and before I knew it she was done and I was disappointed because my movie wasn't quite over!
29885 I was even told that had my dentist not needed the room I was in for another patient, that I would have been welcome to stay and just finish the movie!
29886 I have had several interactions with this office since then (regarding billing and follow up), and every time it is a pleasure to deal with them.
29887 I highly recommend this office to anyone!

29914 Just looking at the cuts in the display case, I can declare Von Hanson's makes AJ's look like Fry's!

29939 Business takes me out to Mesa yesterday.
29940 After chatting with a friend about possible lunch locations, he tells me about Georges Gyros, near University and Country Club.
29941 I decide to give it a try, as it isn't too far from my destination.
29942 Situated right next door to Sun Devil Liquors, I'm surprised I hadn't been there before, or, for that matter, even noticed it.
29943 I guess when I hit SDL, I've got tunnel vision.
29944 First thing I notice is there appears to be plenty of parking, even at 12:30, for lunch.
29945 Outer patio, stuck out into the parking lot, not overly appealing, might be nicer in the evening, I guess?
29946 The interior is clean, plenty of seating, a small bar at one end, and a counter from which you place your order.
29947 Never having been before, I ask the counter-person for a recommendation.
29948 "What's good?"
29949 He suggests the Original Gyro, served with fries or a greek salad.
29950 Sounds good, I'll take it with fries.
29951 With drink, under $9.
29952 A few moments later (actually, I saw three other tables get served, so it seemed like a longish wait), a ginormous gyro arrives, with a huge helping of fries.
29953 The gyro was huge, overflowing with, umm, meat, gyro meat, I guess, white onions, diced tomatoes and cucumber sauce (Tzatziki, I think).
29954 The meat was well cooked, artfully shaved, and tender.
29955 The sauce was also very good.
29956 The pita?
29957 Warm, soft and tasty.
29958 The fries?
29959 Crisp and golden brown, and piping hot, about 3-4 times the size of Mickie D's or about 1/2 a 'steak fry'.
29960 I was very impressed with the quality of the food, the cleanliness of the dining area, and the presence of a bar.
29961 Most folks were eating gyros, or good sized greek salads.
29962 Other items on the menu include several different gyros, burgers, sandwiches, a decent selection of pasta dishes and all kinds of Greek and non-Greek appetizers.
29963 I plan on coming back, perhaps before a foray into Sun Devil Liquors...

30101 Several people had called 911 at this point and we waited outside for the police to arrive.
30102 The police arrived and took down the bouncers' information and stated that they would be recording this incident.

30104 We were treated disrespectfully by untrained staff who were either too eager to close up to get home or get a power high by manhandling non threatening, non physical patrons of their establishment.

30522 We get in and I ordered a burger that wasn't the Streamliner (1st mistake), and just ordered it with the BOCA burger.
30523 The waitress takes our order, my husband also ordered his with a BOCA.
30524 About 20 minutes later the food comes out.
30525 The patty looks right.
30526 I was a little apprehensive and I should have gone with my gut feeling on not eating here this day, but I ignored it.
30527 It had been awhile since I had eaten a BOCA patty (over a year), so I THOUGHT it looked right.
30528 (2nd mistake)
30529 I start eating it and about half way through it the bill hits our table.
30530 It was crowded in there so the waitress must have been trying to get us out of there.
30531 So I look at the bill and notice both my husband and my burgers say Turkey substitution.
30532 I immediately start to freak out.
30533 We call the waitress over and explain to her that we ordered BOCA, why does it say Turkey?
30534 She then tells us that it is BOCA it just says turkey.
30535 I say, no that doesn't sound right.
30536 So she goes to talk to her manager I guess because we never saw her again.
30537 The manager comes over to our table and apologizes profusely for what happened.
30538 I'm upset because how the hell do you confuse BOCA and Turkey?
30539 I mean, really.
30540 I know some people might think how did I not know the difference.
30541 And I thought that to myself as well, but the truth is it slipped by me even though it shouldn't have.
30542 And it hurts me every time I think about it.
30543 I will never come to this Johnny Rockets again, if any of them ever again because of this experience.
30544 All I can say is, if you are vegan or vegetarian, and you go to any of the Johnny Rockets, make sure that your waitress/waiter knows that a BOCA burger isn't meat.
30545 Stress that to them.
30546 Because obviously they aren't trained to know what the difference is.

30604 :-)

30606 So, we left.

30608 Glad I went back later on my own and found out how affordable it was!
30609 I checked and tried a few other Fitness centers and gyms nearby but, when I decided to actually try one of Club SAR's boxing classes, I was hooked!
30610 For a mere $3  (a day) drop-by fee, I was able to get one of the best workouts I ever had.
30611 I joined after I found out it only cost $75 for the whole YEAR which includes ALL the classes I can take (Boxing, boxing conditioning, Yoga, spin class, kickboxing, weight training, MMA...
30612 Yes!
30613 MMA too, which I personally love.
30614 :-) ).
30615 Jonathan & Carlos are great and so is Tom.
30616 They're funny, friendly, and they actually remember you after only a few classes.
30617 The pricing has gone up this year but it is still by far, the BEST possible deal you can find anywhere in the Valley.
30618 Fees
30619 YEARLY Membership  Resident    Non-Resident
30620 Adult (18+ years)       $99                  $150
30621 Child (14-17 years)    $50                  $75
30622 Daily Drop-In Fee $3 Residents; $5 Non-Residents
30623 If you are serious about getting fit, staying in shape and getting a good old-fashioned workout without all the "posing" and pretentiousness of other gyms which are more like "meeting places" and "meat markets" for the young Scottsdale wannabes, this gym is definitely for you!
30624 Personally, I recommend the boxing classes because they will kick your butt, they are fun, get you fit and, in shape.
30625 :-)
30626 They just got new heavy bags so there are 2 heavy bags, 1 hooks bag, several "Bob bags", 2- double-ended bags and 3 speed bags in the main workout areas.
30627 Plus, a bunch more standing weighted-base heavy bags in the other "kickboxing/Yoga room.
30628 And, in case you didn't notice from the picture, a full-size boxing ring.
30629 Yes.
30630 I am totally endorsing this gym!
30631 P.S.
30632 This is a "no frills", serious gym.
30633 So, no whinnying and crying.
30634 Suck it up and do some push-ups!
30635 ;-)

30662 Roka Akor has a classy atmosphere, and a slightly formidable menu to pick from.
30663 Everything looks so good, and in a new environment, I want to try it all!
30664 But my date and I, after much deliberation, decided to "go for broke", as it were and if we couldn't finish, at least we had a good sample of the menu.
30665  For an appetizer, we got the butterfish tataki and the burnt red tomato salad.
30666 These were yummy little tidbits that disappeared off the plate quickly.
30667 The butterfish was delicate, and the salad was great - the greens had all sorts of different flavors, and not that "generic clump of lettuce" flavor I hate.
30668  From the sushi menu, I was feeling adventurous and had never had raw red meat before, so I ordered the wagyu gunkan.
30669 My date saw the amount of green onions piled on top of this dish and oh-so-chivalrously gave me his piece.
30670 It's true that you needed a healthy appreciation of green onion to like these as served.
30671 The wagyu beef is ground nearly to a puree - which I wasn't expecting, and I thought the onion was a bit much.
30672  At for the skewers we ordered, my date liked his sweet potatoes the best, but I was partial to the crispy BBQ.
30673 These turned out to be two large ovoid and solid shapes of rice, run through with a skewer.
30674 Pure white sushi rice in the center, the outside was caramelized with what tasted like the sweet BBQ sauce that comes on eel sushi, which gave the whole thing a nice, crispy shell.
30675  At this point, I got to what I consider to be the crowning achievement of the meal: the yuzu marinated black cod.
30676 The cod, cooked on the robata grill in a leaf, was meltingly soft and delicately flavored.
30677 It was an effort to be share fairly.
30678 I believe my date said after our first taste of it, "Just eat what you want and I'll finish ...",  I looked up from my chopsticks, "... you know what?
30679 Just cut me off half."
30680  I wasn't sure that I could handle dessert after eating so much, but we finally decided it wouldn't be fair not to give the dessert menu a looking over, right?
30681 So we ordered the baked green tea custard, and it was a perfect pick after a gut-busting meal.
30682 Light and airy, it also had some carbonation to it that tickled my taste buds and made me giggle a lot as I was eating it.
30683  Our sampler of shochu ranged from impressive to harsh, at least to my taste buds.
30684 In order starting with least harsh: pineapple, honeycomb, raspberry, and apple.
30685 I didn't like the last two, but the pineapple was, in my mind, a fairly dangerous thing to drink when you're not paying attention.
30686 Smooth.
30687  That's it for the food, and as for the service, it was swift and considerate; glasses were kept full, and empty plates whisked away.
30688 There was, however, one glaring exception that nearly overpowered the entire evening with its oddness.
30689 The waiter, who had up till this point been very nice and chatty, helpful about menu items, and generally a pretty cool guy, handed me his phone number and told us to call him any time we wanted to go partying.
30690  What am I supposed to do with this?
30691 Are we going to call our waiter up and say ... well, what?
30692 It flummoxed me.

30774 Their employees are friendly and the food under the glass is fresh looking and appetizing and in their own bins.
30775 Sometimes you can go to a subway and the prep area is a wreck.
30776 Thats what makes this Subway so great.
30777 Everything is in it's place, and orderly and makes you feel like they take pride in their work.
30778 Absolutely I will go here again, and I can't say that about many Subways unfortunately.

30807 !
30808 Sunridge Canyon has been one of my very favorite courses since I first played it 6+ years ago.
30809 I have to admit I did work here for a two-year span several years ago, but it was one of my favorites before, during, and since then.
30810 It's not as hyped as Grayhawk, Troon, and some other courses but it's just as great of a layout, if not better than some of the more popular high-end courses in the valley (definitely better than the overrated Grayhawk).
30811 The course has the rare distinction of being very playable yet very challenging at the same time.
30812 You'll be toast if you don't hit it fairly straight on most holes, but you won't be punished for hitting it where you intended like some of the blind-shot-heavy courses (i.e.
30813 We-Ko-Pa) here in the valley.
30814 I've shot in the 70s one day and in the 90s the next out there.
30815 Besides the superb and scenic layout, I also like the simplicity of the overall complex.
30816 It's not at a big resort, there aren't multiple courses, and there is no grand clubhouse (not that all those things are always bad).
30817 It's just the 18 holes, pro shop, and a restaurant that serves up some pretty solid food.
30818 The staff is friendly and helpful, too.
30819 It's like a neighborhood course albeit a high-end one.
30820 They have some great summer rates for locals this summer: Any day, any time for only $35.
30821 I recommend all valley golfers to enjoy that rate while it lasts.
30822 I played yesterday and the course was in good shape tee-to-green, and outstanding shape on the greens.
30823 It's been awhile since I've seen greens roll this well on a $35 course here in town.
30824 One last, but important, note: It gets WINDY out here.
30825 As in, it gets windy every day.
30826 The course plays through a canyon and the winds are swirling all the time.
30827 An early morning tee time is best since it gives you your best chance to take on the uphill back-nine without the wind gusting in your face.
30828 Inside the Clarendon Hotel in central Phoenix, Gallo Blanco has quickly made a hit for themselves with hipsters and urban dwellers alike.
30829 They offer a refreshing alternative for hotel restaurants, with lively ambiance and great food and drink.
30830 Gallo Blanco's tacos are surefire hits.
30831 They're served individually, and come lined up in an appealing silver taco stand.
30832 We've ordered the carne asada and shrimp soft tacos, and, wow, they're really mouthwatering.
30833 The shrimp is flame grilled and seared, bringing out a nice full flavor.
30834 The guacamole is slightly sweet and chunky, and paired with outstanding tortilla chips, this is a must-order appetizer.
30835 Even the sauces (I prefer the red chipotle one) are addictive, either to accompany the supreme tacos, or to be enjoyed alone on chips.
30836 This restaurant is a fine addition to the emerging downtown Phoenix foodie scene, and with prices extremely reasonable, you get a lot.
30837 A good sized meal for two (sans drinks) could ring up at $30-35, which is a good value for great food.
30838 Try Gallo Blanco, bring friends, and get a bunch of items.
30839 Although I haven't explored the rest of the menu, I sense that Gallo Blanco's items don't stray far from excellence.
30840 I love pueblo pediatric also!
30841 And, also surprised there aren't any reviews!
30842 There staff is always friendly and helpful.
30843 Rooms are always clean.

30846 He also takes his time and even asks us how we are doing.
30847 Most physicians these days are in and out of the room before you can even feel like your questions are answered, but Dr. Salek really takes his time.

30865 Move over Jacques Torres!
30866 Angela has come to town and just might be the next big thing for Phoenix (and the confectionary world!)
30867 I happened to find this place just on a whim....I was reminiscing the other day about all the wonderful chocolatiers in other big cities, and it occured to me 'maybe there is a chocolatier in Phoenix?'
30868 Sure enough, there is!!
30869 (thanks yelp!)
30870 and she's GOOD!!!
30871 !
30872 Angela is as sweet as her candy is!
30873 She explained how she just started this business in October of last year; she is a self-taught, talented and creative, as authentic as it gets, chocolatier!
30874 She uses all organic ingredients, including fair-trade organic chocolate.
30875 You will find many whimsical truffle flavor creations like Raspberry Rose, Mudslide, Strawberry Balsamic, Lavender Lemonade, Madras Curry, Avacado Wasabi, Maple-Smoked Bacon (yeah, I KNOW!
30876 )....and like a million more!
30877 AND the best news of all, is that she says she has perfected a dairy-free recipe for truffles...I.
30878 CAN'T.
30879 WAIT!
30880 I hope I'm the first to order that batch!!
30881 Besides beautiful, flavorful truffles, she makes her own marshmallows (in various amazing flavors as well) Chocolate Bark (which is always dairy-free) and even different hot chocolate mixes.
30882 The most amazing thing of all is....now, get ready for this....all of this magic comes right out of her home kitchen!!
30883 THAT means, everything is made with *love* :)  So, if you happen to yelp this, like I did, the map will actually take you to her business, which is located in her house, in a neighborhood (a little confusing at first....) but it IS LEGIT!
30884 She said normally it's by appointment only (I was not) but she gladly had me in and I got to see some of her gastronomic creations anyways (yay!)
30885 However, she says that she normally sells her stuff at the South Scottsdale Farmers Market (Wednesdays) and the Tempe Farmers Market (on Warner and McClintock on Saturdays) In fact, if you go to her website, you can customize a box of chocolates and pick it up at the farmers market of your choice... (can't wait to do this!!)
30886 Needless to say, this made my day...no, like, my week!
30887 SO excited to have a real, gourmet chocolatier right in my own neck of the woods!
30888 Woo hoo!

31439 After weeks of anticipation, Side Bar has finally opened.
31440 As you ascend the staircase to the second level, the reason for the long wait becomes apparent.
31441 The attention to detail is amazing.
31442 Once layered with crumbling plaster, the walls were meticulously stripped to reveal the historic brickwork.
31443 Other historic elements include the original steel casement windows that feature a view of downtown phoenix and the surrounding area.
31444 Tastefully integrated with these elements is a contemporary interior design.
31445 The lighting consists of warm colors that set the stage for the laid back atmosphere.
31446 No expense was spared when designing the bar and tables, which are made of dark exotic woods.
31447 Seating included organically shaped bar stools that adjust to a comfortable height and depth.
31448 There are also several u-shaped sofas that create conversational areas.
31449 Behind the bar you'll see an array of artistically arranged circular openings backlit in a warm, yellow tone.
31450 Thick glass shelving lines the back wall along with a fine assortment of liquors.
31451 The "soft opening" menu included wines and locally brewed beers among others.
31452 I tried a White Russian and my wife had a glass of Chardonnay.
31453 Both were very good.
31454 Prices seemed to be close to average for the area and when compared to the experience, were a good value.
31455 I had a chance to speak to one of the owners who was glowing with excitement.
31456 After two years of remodeling and working with the city and adjacent historic neighborhood, his vision has become reality.
31457 In addition to a brief history of his endeavor, the owner informed me that additional overflow parking will be available adjacent to the main parking lot.
31458 Parking was one concern originally voiced by the neighborhood and city.
31459 The owners may also experiment with weekly art showings by local artists.
31460 Maybe they can arrange for it to coincide with First Fridays.
31461 Within walking distance of Side Bar, dining includes Pei Wei, My Florist, and Zoe's Kitchen.
31462 If you're looking for a unique hangout in an urban setting, then Side Bar comes highly recommended.
31463 Went to Cracker Barrel twice while vacationing at our home in Litchfield Park.
31464 All the food we ordered were very good and the service was good also.
31465 I highly recommend their pancakes.
31466 Grassroots is right around the corner and we drive by it every week on our usual Friday-Dinner-Out.
31467 I always assumed it was more of a pub than a restaurant.
31468 My wife and I arrived around 5:00pm and were seated immediately.
31469 The waiter was super attentive and knew the menu and preparation of everything I asked about.
31470 We started with an AMAZING appetizer special of burrata* with ciabatta tips, their house spicy tomato jam and arugula with champagne vinaigrette.
31471 It was described as a sort of an experimental combination of preparations from other dishes.
31472 The burrata was silky smooth and spreads onto the ciabatta like softened cream cheese.
31473 The play of flavors in this dish was excellent, we'd go back here just for this dish alone.
31474 My wife ordered the lobster bisque as her entree, which was smooth and creamy with a good lobster flavor.
31475 I suspect we could have asked for bread on the side, but it didn't come with it by default.
31476 I ordered the short ribs with roasted asparagus and jalapeno cheddar grits.
31477 The ribs were cooked just right, just a little pink and tender with a concentrated glaze of delicious sauce layered on top.
31478 The sauce had a light smoky flavor with a fair amount of saltiness, and appeared to be a long simmered reduction with bold flavor.
31479 As others have mentioned, the jalapeno grits are very good, not spicy by any means but a little crunch from the jalapeno pieces, creamy and well prepared.
31480 I strongly recommend the short ribs to anyone.
31481 We splurged with dessert of key lime pie and a banana split.
31482 The split included three large scoops of (what appeared to be) homemade ice cream and topped with caramelized pecans.
31483 The key lime was tart and delicious.
31484 The portion sizes were perfect and considering the careful preparation and unique flavors the price was appropriate.
31485 It's a little more expensive that I would like to put Grassroots into our weekly rotation, but I look forward to visiting it again and sample more items off the menu when the budget allows.
31486 * I didn't know what burrata was: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burrata

31524 I can't believe we get to review a free publication.
31525 Nonetheless, it's important to know (especially for Dave B., who obviously didn't do his research) that this magazine is published by a gentleman who grew up here in the valley and wanted a way to promote all of the great, creative people and activities they are doing by making a free magazine.
31526 He decided this 17 years ago, and, despite pretty much breaking even (it costs money to print and distribute thousands of magazines and no, the ads do not cover the full cost), continues doing so in the name of cultural awareness.
31527 Notice that the photoshoots use local designers, local models, local photographers, and local locations.
31528 The articles are about artwork currently displayed in local galleries, businesses (like restaurants) and bands that local folks have started on their own from meager means, and about up-and-coming events like the taco festival (started by a local), fashion shows (again, utilizing local designers and run by locals - no Dillard's show coverage here) and about people in the valley who are trying to make a difference in our community.
31529 If the magazine doesn't seem critical enough, it's because the people who are the magazine decide what to write about, and therefore don't have to waste pages with hateful criticism when Java can be promoting a local chef or a cool new local jewelry designer.
31530 When it's run by a local, written by locals, and put together in the publisher's dining room, I can't think of any magazine with MORE credibiilty and freedom.
31531 The publisher and writers are meticulous in choosing to write about what moves them rather than what the latest hype is.
31532 That's why you read a story about the man who purchased a building and was designing it into a venue before it was the Crescent Ballroom.
31533 That's also why you'll read the backstory on five locally owned, little-known coffee houses at far ends of the valley.
31534 The candid shots in the back are a tribute to local events the publisher attended but maybe an article hasn't been written about, or to local artists, designers or patrons of the arts.
31535 While it's always interesting to hear what people think of Java, knowing what really goes on behind the scenes gives me nothing but respect for the handful of folks to who put their blood sweat and tears into creating this free publication each month.

31622 The Chopped Salad is very light and refreshing option to accompany the brushcetta appetizer.

31625 The lighting is soft, giving more of an intimate feel, yet this place still remains simple and casual, which I love.

31638 I highly recommend this option for anyone dining here.
31639 The antipasti was a great selection of cured meats and local cheeses.
31640 Next, I had a wonderful salad that was a great combination of sharp peppery flavors mixed with sweet.
31641 Strawberries, arugula, radishes, yum!
31642 For pasta course I got gnocchi with a rich and tasty cream sauce and my husband got ravioli stuffed with yam.
31643 His dish was amazing, I had to fight for a couple bites.
31644 For the fish course I had poached halibut that was served with some kind of really flavorful sauce and a vegetable puree so that whole thing was extremely delicious.
31645 The hubby got a very lightly seared tuna fillet.
31646 I was very surprised that he enjoyed it so much since he is usually not a raw fish kind of guy.
31647 For our main course I got a pork tenderloin and the hubby got braised beef... just lucky we each got our favorite meats.
31648 Each came with other vegetables and starches on the plate so they would have been an ample meal in and of themselves.
31649 For dessert, I got a goat cheese cheesecake that was truly amazing.
31650 One of the best deserts I have ever eaten.
31651 Very rich but the pieces were small enough so that it was not heavy.
31652 The dessert did not have too much sweetness so it went well with the ice wine it was served with which tasted like pure honey.
31653 Just fantastic.
31654 The hubby got bread pudding which we didn't much care for and it came with a sorbet that I didn't try.
31655 I got the wine pairings with the meal and every wine just complimented the dish it was served with so beautifully that I was really glad I added that option.
31656 Also, it ended up that you got a half glass (at least) with each course so I think it is a good value (the wine pairing was an extra $45.)
31657 I do agree with a couple of the reviewers who mentioned salt.

31659 However, I think that was not due to a mistake of the chef, I believe it is just because they use cured meats in a lot of their dishes.

31662 She was very knowledgeable on the food and could answer any questions we had for her.
31663 She also took the time for each course to explain each dish and in my case the wine and why they went together.
31664 Only one time did my wine not come out at the same time with the food course and in that case our server apologized immediately.
31665 I do agree with some of the reviewers that the service is very slow... however, I believe that this is intentional.
31666 They have created a very cozy and comfortable environment and they want you to linger and enjoy yourself.
31667 With the Farmer's Feast in particular it took us almost 3 hours start to finish but I enjoyed every minute of it.
31668 It was nice to have time in between courses to sit and talk and relax.
31669 The spacing also kept us from feeling too full by the end (it is six courses after all!)

32364 If I could only eat at one place for the rest of my life, it would have to be at FnB.
32365 This is ultimate comfort food for me - with the bulk of the menu highlighting local in-season organic vegetables from McClendon and other local farms.
32366 Charleen prepares dishes that pay the ultimate homage to the vegetable and the farmer with perfect seasoning, contrast, balance and temperatures.
32367 Beyond vegetables, the housemade burrata was light as a cloud and shrimp grilled to perfection on the mesquite.
32368 Dishes at FnB are simple but often the simplest dishes are the hardest to get right as there is nothing to hide behind - ingredients have to be fresh and of the highest quality and execution must be perfect.

33270 We spent over 40 minutes trying to figure out this bill, SERIOUSLY!
33271 When I asked the manager her generic and obviously well rehearsed response was "this is our company policy, we do not split checks for large parties".
33272 This is absurd.
33273 So not only did we have a heck of a time figuring out the bill, I'm pretty sure no one really knew who had what and if they had added random things to the bill.

33442 For those of you who love Indian/Pakistani food, but hate dives, Z-Grill just may turn your whole world upside down.
33443 In all foodie honesty, Z-Grill is home to some of the best Indo-Pak food I've ever had.
33444 This praise comes with a reminder though...it is divey.
33445 Z-Grill is located inside Zam Zam World Market, which is a decent little grocery, but it lacks the umph that other well-known ethnic groceries delivery.
33446 With that being said though, other groceries lack Z-Grill, and this is why it matters...
33447 Everything I've tried from the restaurant, and I mean everything thus far, delivers.
33448 From the hummus, to the samosas, to the chana and even to the paneer masala and chicken karahi, I've only been disappointed when I realized that I was down to the last bite.
33449 The flavors are robust, the sauces are spicy and, surprisingly, the prices are unbelievably reasonable.
33450 It's safe to say that I'm addicted to this place.
33451 **A word of caution when trying Z-Grill.
33452 They are sometimes out of items on the menu.
33453 I find that charming cause they have to make everything from scratch, others might not.
33454 If they happen to be out of something, do yourself a favor and just try something else.
33455 **
33456 I cannot say enough good things about the food from Z-Grill.
33457 This is a must-try in the valley for anyone who has a love for spicy Indo-Pak food.
33458 Go try it!
33459 EXCELLENT TRIP TO THE SPA!!!!
33460 !
33461 A trip to the Aji Spa (located at the Sheraton Wildhorse Pass Resort and Spa) was at the top of my list during my recent trip to Arizona on Memorial Day Weekend.
33462 We made our reservations well in advance.
33463 Having gone to a few spa resorts, I couldn't wait to pay this one a visit.
33464 My cousin and I were each booked for the Little Yellow Bird spa package, which was comprised of 2 services each.
33465 We arrived about 15 minutes prior to our appointment time and was given a tour of the spa.
33466 After changing in the women's locker room, and relaxing in the private women's lounge area (there's a large lounge area, but it's co-ed), our masseuses met us and brought us into our room.
33467 My cousin and I decided for our first service to be the Companion Massage.
33468 After only having solo massages, I was interested how a companion massage differed.
33469 The 50 minute Aji Massage flew by.
33470 My masseuse was professional and the massage given was very comfortable, relaxing and beneficial.
33471 After our massages were completed, we had some time in between our next service, feeling a little hungry, we decided to grab some lunch from the spa's cafe.
33472 I ordered the flatbread pizza and it was TO DIE FOR!
33473 Seeded flatbread topped off with a garlic peppery aioli, grilled chicken pieces, pesto sauce, marinated bell peppers, melted cheese and avocado.
33474 My visit was a month and a half ago and my memory, a little fuzzy, but that was one of the best lunches I've had in a long time!
33475 !
33476 After lunch sometime, we each were up for our second service, our facials!!!
33477 Due to my skin type, I received the Aji Rain Facial.
33478 My esthetician was wonderful!
33479 Her hands were soft and gentle while working on my face and we had some lovely conversation during the 50 minute procedure.
33480 I left that room with my face feeling renewed, clean and fresh!
33481 All spa treatments include full use of the spa's facilities so we definitely made well use of that!
33482 After our facials, we used the sauna (the steam room was out of service during our visit) and whirlpools located on the women's locker side.
33483 We then relaxed and lounged by the outside pool.
33484 The Aji Spa is such a calm, warm and relaxing environment that I ended up taking a nap!
33485 Outside!
33486 In desert heat!
33487 Thank goodness for the wooden awning with misters attached and the huge patio umbrellas providing shade!
33488 The staff at the spa provided excellent service!
33489 From the front desk, to our masseuse, the esthetician, the cafe staff and the locker room attendant!
33490 While napping, one of the staff from the cafe even brought us iced water with lemon and cucumber slices in it!
33491 Our appointment started at 12pm and with our 2 procedures, and lunch, we should have been done and out of there within a few hours.
33492 But the point of visiting the spa was to relax, and with Aji Spa being such a lovely place, we just didn't want to leave!
33493 We finally left nearly 8 hours after our arrival, and we would have stayed longer if we could!
33494 I highly recommend Aji Spa to anyone visiting the Phoenix area, or if you're looking for a new spa to travel to!
33495 Aji Spa is a beautiful spa with excellent staff and service.
33496 They even emailed me the same day of my service as a "Thank You" for visiting and included a discount coupon on my next visit!
33497 A 5-star spa, indeed!

33527 Camelback Inn was much bigger than I expected.
33528 Lots and lots of buildings spread out over the property.
33529 It's not the easiest place to find your way around but at least it's pretty to look at while you get lost.

33531 It looks like they do corporate events - cowboy cookouts - but nothing was going on while we were there.
33532 But we had fun wandering around the "town" and taking goofy pictures of each other.
33533 Even though it was December it was warm enough to hang out by the pool.
33534 The pool is heated so that helped and there are two hot tubs as well for really chilly days.

33536 There were kids splashing around but the area is big enough you can hide away from the action if you prefer.

33588 Let's start by disclosing that I grew up in New Orleans, went to school in Lafayette (home of the Ragin Cajuns), and REALLY know good New Orleans/cajun food.
33589 I grew up eating great po-boys, gumbo, red beans, and wouldn't consider eating any of these if not well prepared.
33590 That said, I can truly say that Jennifer and the Flavors of Louisiana gang make cajun food as good as any you'll find in New Orleans--SERIOUSLY.
33591 The po-boys are spot on (though the bread could be a little crustier) and the chicken & andouille gumbo is even better than mine--and, I assure you, that's DAMN GOOD.
33592 Frankly, I've never had better.
33593 The only thing that is not "as good as it gets" is the red beans and rice.
33594 They're good, but not quite the creamy "Washday Monday" staple that I grew up on.
33595 My cajun grandmother has Jennifer beat on that one, but not by much.
33596 But, if you want a special treat and want to taste something that kills all, get a sausage po-boy.
33597 Hot sausage or smoked sausage po-boys are a New Orleans staple and my favorite po-boys of all.
33598 But, Jennifer blows them all away with her home-made andouille.
33599 Simply put, I've never had better sausage--ever.
33600 It's the reason her gumbo is soooo good and her po-boy the best ever.
33601 I've eaten at Flavors many times, even though I live across town.
33602 Every time I go, I eat like a pig and bring some home to eat later.
33603 I have no affiliation with the restaurant, but wanted to post this as a review from someone who really knows New Orleans food and as a thank you to Jennifer and her crew for giving me a source for the best flavors in the World (not just Louisiana).
33604 As a matter of fact, I even overlook the fact that Jennifer is from Baton Rouge, instead of New Orleans or Lafayette and for not having any USL/UL Lafayette paraphernalia on the LSU/Saints wall.
33605 At least that is, so long as she keeps her promise to open another restaurant on the east side of town--that is, a lot closer to where I live.
33606 If you want the ONLY good cajun food in Phoenix, treat yourself to Flavors of Louisiana.
33607 For me, it's just like a visit to any of my favorite po-boy shops in the old neighborhoods.
33608 It really is that good.

33648 Picazzo's Organic Italian Kitchen is a gem in the many pizza locations that can be found in the Phoenix area.
33649 Picazzo's boasts a menu which includes appetizers, salads, organic and gluten-free pastas, and of course pizza and dessert!
33650 One cannot go wrong with any of the categories of foods Picazzo's offers, but there are certainly favorites that can be ordered upon ones first visit.
33651 Picazzo's offers a casual yet sophisticated atmosphere upon entering their establishment.
33652 One is greeted immediately by their hostess at the door and then you are seated promptly at one of their many tables (or the bar area if you prefer).
33653 The atmosphere is roomy with their ample seating, and friendly upon entering.
33654 One of their best appetizers is their Mama's Meat-za Balls ($9.50).
33655 Made with three meatballs with mozzarella, artichoke hearts, organic tomato sauce, basil, and Parmesan, it is a savory appetizer that easy starts the meal off on the right foot.
33656 One can choose from one of their many pasta dishes or their pizza creations, or even create your own creation.
33657 If going with one of their creations, I would recommend their "Nonna's Favorite" (gluten free) ($16.50, $21.00, $25.00).
33658 This pizza is a delicious combination of organic olive oil and garlic, Fontina and mozzarella cheeses, mushrooms, tomatoes, goat cheese, Kalamata olives, and basil.
33659 Melts right in your mouth and one can easy eat more than one expected!
33660 If even after all of this you still crave something sweet - One cannot go wrong with electing their "Classic Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie" ($7.00).
33661 This sinful combination includes two scoops of organic vanilla bean or coconut vanilla ice cream served with your choice of organic chocolate, chocolate mint, or chocolate raspberry sauce over a fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie.
33662 Oh wondrous dessert indeed!
33663 Picazzo's will leave you most satisfied and delighted with all that is good.
33664 With the finest ingredients, Picazzo's takes great care in delivering the best in atmosphere and dish.
33665 Stop by Picazzo's Organic Italian Kitchen today for an unforgettable meal.

34121 The tranquil aesthetics of this quaint cafe made us feel welcomed and relaxed.
34122 The decor had a modern Asian feel: minimalistic organic zen with soft ambient music playing - perfect for a Sunday afternoon.
34123 We ordered the Pho Dac Biet Bo Vien- House PHO'nomenal (House special combination of *sliced eye round steak, well-done brisket, well-done flank, soft tendon, tripe, and beef meatball) and the Pho Tai (Sliced eye round steak) and Goi Cuon- Spring Rolls.
34124 As with most Vietnamese restaurants the portion size of Pho is quite large and we could have shared.
34125 Both were delicious, filling, and had a nice aroma but nothing too overpowering.
34126 I've experienced a few places that use a little too much anise, so much that you can't get an overall sense of all the delightful herbs and spices used in this delicious creation.

34184 So, when we received a coupon for Daphne's Greek Café we were jazzed to go check it out.
34185 What I noticed right away is it has kind of a fast-food sort of feel to it and I thought, OK, its catering to people on their lunch breaks.
34186 However, the food itself is like Greek fast food for people who have never had anywhere near really Greek food before and so they wouldn't know any better.
34187 The plates are astatically pleasing with everything arranged nice and neat.
34188 This amounted to zilch to me.
34189 When I got to eat, I want plenty of food and I want quality as appropriately expected from the type of establishment I am eating at.
34190 At Daphne's you get a few little thin slices of what may or may not be real gyro meat.
34191 The falafel meat is little over fried disks.
34192 That's right disks.
34193 Not balls of falafel meat where the outside is slightly crunchy and the inside is meaty and moist.
34194 The pita bread is not.

34233 Flowers, baked goods, dishes....AJ's.
34234 It's here.
34235 I'm queer.
34236 Get used to it.
34237 This place is fantastic.
34238 About the restaurant itself.
34239 It's right by downtown Phoenix, and in fact right next to a Light Rail stop--so keep this in mind, parking is metered and sometimes hard to come by easily, if you live by a light rail this may be the smarter option.
34240 The place is seriously tiny, only about 6-8 groups of people can be seated at one time.
34241 A slight drawback is that there is limited outdoor seating, which, given the predictably large lines even on weekdays, is a problem.
34242 The Phoenix sun will make a 45 minute wait seem like an hour and a half wait.
34243 Now about the service.
34244 I've always had a good experience with the people who work here.
34245 The first time I came here, apparently one of the owners saw that I looked lost, because she came out and very kindly explained how people are seated, where I can go to get coffee in the meantime.
34246 She even suggested I leave my cell phone number and she'll call me when my seat is ready, in case I'm shopping for example.
34247 The waitresses always serve us quickly and never leave us hanging, and they're always smiling, which for some reason makes the experience so much better.
34248 Now for the best part.
34249 I swear, they put crack in their food, because although their breakfast options are simple, they are out of this world.
34250 The first time I came here I got the waffles.
34251 Perhaps it's because they use REAL maple syrup, or all of the ingredients are organic and locally grown, but they make the best waffles I've ever had.
34252 I don't even know how one makes a good waffle really, it seems pretty formulaic, but it's stellar.
34253 I ordered it with bacon, which was also wonderful--the bacon used was the good stuff, not the excessively fatty bacon you buy at the supermarket.
34254 Every bite is spectacular, and when you're done, you're full, but not the kind of full you'll often get at breakfast joints where you think you're going to explode or take a nap--full, but refreshed.
34255 The second time I came I got the pancakes.
34256 Not the best pancake I've ever had, but still, superb and the real maple syrup just sends it through the roof.
34257 The third time I went I got the waffle again (see above).
34258 Before I came here, I was excited about leaving Phoenix for New York due to the incredible array of dining options you get in that city.
34259 Now I'm worried there won't be anything as good!
34260 I will continue to give this place five stars for so many reasons.
34261 First, the menu is very creative, and offers a great variety of healthy food, with an Asian twist.
34262 This time I had the shrimp curry, which had lots of fresh vegetables, and instead of a heavy cream curry, it was a much healthier broth curry.
34263 We had the edamame dumplings again, which were as good as I remembered.
34264 It was kind of cool to see Dr. Weil eating there last night.
34265 It's good to know that he likes the place enough to dine there.
34266 We used the taco cart for my 30th birthday this past weekend and we came away very impressed.
34267 Eduardo was the guy that came to our fiesta, and he was incredible.
34268 When he arrived, we experienced a haboob and he immediately stepped in and helped bring in our decorations and furniture.
34269 He waited about 30 minutes until serving because we were unsure if the haboob was going to attack again.
34270 My wife and I are both in the restaurant biz and so were many of the guests, we all came away impressed with the food quality.
34271 Next time we throw a party, we will use them again!

34320 We also shared the Jerk Chicken Salad ($9.95) and the Jerk Prawns Off the Grill ($14.95).
34321 Here's the ultimate rub, the bottom of the menu states "no substitutions or modifications"...
34322 Since when is cutting a KFC-side-sized ear of corn a "modification"?
34323 At the same time, the menu describes the restaurant and it's offerings as "Nothing fancy; simply good food that nourishes and rejuvenates the body."
34324 It seems like cutting something in half so we could easily share it -- particularly after the plate has been delivered to the table for us to appreciate it's "beauty" AND after we've communicated to our server and demonstrated with the first two courses that we were splitting the items -- is in the vein of "nothing fancy."
34325 How about providing the customer with an appropriate utensil to cut it themselves, then?
34326 The fact that the chef was obstinate in refusing to cut the KFC-side-sized ear of corn provided with our entree screams "pretentious and grandiose" and tainted our entire experience.
34327 To quote my dinning companion, "You are not James Beard and James Beard would've cut the corn!"

34487 When cowboys ride off into the sunset, they probably stop at Greasewood Flat for a burger and beer.
34488 This rustic little bar is located a bit outside the city right near Pinnacle Peak and is definitely worth the drive!
34489 You'll know you are in the right spot when you see the antique farm equipment and suddenly feel like you are walking up to an Old West saloon.
34490 Say hello to the mule on your way in.
34491 Outside they have picnic tables, horseshoes, and fire pits (gets chilly out there in the desert!
34492 ), and on the weekends they have live music and dancing.
34493 Inside, the bar is pretty small, and the place is covered in dollar bills and business cards left by satisfied cowboys and cowgals.
34494 For the nights without live music, don't you fret, they have a jukebox with tons of country hits.
34495 The night we went it was the bartender's birthday, and the regulars were definitely having a good time.
34496 Both a historic landmark (120+-year old original stagecoach stop) and a dive bar, Greasewood Flat is clearly special to Arizona, and is a definite must see.
34497 I'll be going back on a weekend to get the true Greasewood Flat experience and hopefully see a cute cowboy or two..

34548 Woodlands is a nice CLEAN eatery in a nice part of Chandler.
34549 It's not a restaurant.
34550 It's basically a Dosa shop.
34551 They  specialize in Dosa and offer several types.
34552 They also have excellent Indian Chinese dishes.
34553 The food is consistently good and I have eaten there on several occassions.
34554 This is a lunch/light dinner place.
34555 Don't think of this place like a restaurant.
34556 There are several types of Dosa and that's what this place specializes in.
34557 The restaurant is also modern and not is some ghetto strip mall so don't worry about failing health codes here...at least not for a while.
34558 Negatives

34560 For non-Indians, they should be informed that this is a Dosa house so order dosa and other south Indian dishes.

34571 I love the other locations of Thai Rama and this one is no exception!
34572 Food is fast, fresh tasting and well seasoned.
34573 The lunch specials are unique and delicious, and the service is good.
34574 Far superior to the Char's Thai restaurant that used to be in the same location.
34575 This is a great place in an extremity of the Valley.
34576 They serve both Korean and Japanese food.
34577 They are quick and attentive.
34578 Having lived in South Korea for two years, I can honestly admit that this is some of the most authentic Korean cuisine I've had in Phoenix.
34579 I typically ate bibimbap once a week minimum over there and I can't really tell the difference between Takamatsu's version and the stuff I had on the other side of the Pacific.
34580 I noticed they offer a list of other, more obscure foods I learned to love over there, including naengmyeon (cold, spicy noodles), japchae (stir-fried glass noodles), and several other dishes.
34581 They also follow tradition and bring you several side dishes.
34582 Love it or hate it, kimchi accompanies every meal, as do spicy bean sprouts, a tangy spinach dish and a few other random sides.
34583 It's a little bit more expensive than average restaurant prices in the Valley, but definitely worth it when you consider the sides that come with it, and a complimentary spiced tea for "dessert."

34711 I finally got a chance to check out the MIM yesterday and I was really wowed by the extensive collection.
34712 I knew going in to expect items from all over the world, but there are literally instruments and related objects from every country.
34713 We spent between two and two and a half hours but it still wasn't enough time to really take in everything.
34714 I loved that the audio/video guide was included in the $15 admission price.
34715 Most museums I have been to charge an additional fee.
34716 This was unlike any guide I have experienced before.
34717 No numbers to punch in, just walk by any of the exhibits with your headset on and when you stop at each video screen, the audio automatically starts up!
34718 Very cool, and I loved watching all the videos to learn more about all the instruments.
34719 When I walked up to the flamenco part of the Spain exhibit I instantly recognized the video playing as I have actually been in the flamenco club in Madrid where it was filmed so I thought that was neat.
34720 I really enjoyed all of the exhibits especially seeing the "guts" of the Steinway piano and how Martin guitars are made.
34721 It's not something I had thought about much before but now I know so much!
34722 I think the MIM is a fab place to take kids (and adults!)
34723 to learn and to get them excited about music.
34724 Definitely check it out it you haven't yet.

34949 No one offered to bring more.
34950 Our waiter told us about the daily specials, after which we ordered food and wine.
34951 After a short wait, four large dinner plates arrived.
34952 I was the lucky one, my steak (a large  rib eye steak, ordered medium-rare which tasted very good despite two large blobs of fat) was sitting pretty in the middle of the large dinner plate.
34953 Nothing else on my plate, just the steak.
34954 I looked around at my wife's plate and couldn't believe, her fillet mignon was laying there, in the middle of the large dinner plate without anything garnishing it, be that a glaze, a leaf, a slice of whatever!
34955 At the prices asked by this restaurant, it felt like an insult to each of us to have such a poor presentation of a steak!!
34956 We asked our waiter for a side dish, mashed potatoes with Parmesan, and when they arrived, we couldn't believe it!
34957 There were no more than two scraggly potatoes turned into mashed potatoes, or about a tablespoon of mashed potatoes per person.
34958 Mind you, they tasted good, but at over $9.00 per side dish?
34959 In short, we left hungry and wondering why we spent over $200 for the entire meal.
34960 Next time, we'll go to a well tried place for steaks and more.

35125 Do Taco Jedis work at Senor Taco?
35126 Yes.
35127 Yes they do.
35128 Is the force of making killer fast Mexican food strong with these Jedis?
35129 Oh hell yeah!
35130 Try the shredded beef tacos in the hard shells.
35131 When they ask you if you want hot sauce, say 'si' and drizzle it mightily onto the tacos.
35132 Piled cheese, beef, lettuce, tomatoes all stuffed into an authentic-style taco shell - it doesn't get any better than this.
35133 Just make sure you put a helmet on because it's crazy good.
35134 If you like spicy, no-nonsense burritos, go with the Carne Asada Burrito (Red Chile).
35135 If you like the whole meal, go with the Carne Asada or Pollo Asado burrito combo plates.
35136 The plate comes with flour tortillas, beans and rice, guacamole and salsa fresca.
35137 You make your own burritos.
35138 This is just good eatin'.
35139 Take it home, crack open a good Hefeweizen, and you are golden.
35140 And lastly, from the sage words of my wife: "The shrimp tacos and burritos are certified gourmet meals!"
35141 Do I stutter?
35142 Nope.
35143 While Senor Taco is technically 'fast food' it does take some time to prepare.
35144 If you do drive-thru don't get all road ragey if it takes longer than it does at Taco Bell.
35145 There is a price to pay to make good food and that price is TIME.
35146 This is not a worldwide chain that spends more on advertising and earning your business by putting cute little dogs on plastic mugs.
35147 Senor Taco is not that type of place.
35148 A little wait is very much worth it.
35149 I realize that appearance of the location irks some reviewers.
35150 Yes, it is in a strip mall.
35151 Yes it is 100-150 feet away from a gas station slash AM/PM mini market.
35152 I get that.
35153 But this is not Sanctuary.
35154 This is not Kai.
35155 This is not Deseo.
35156 When one reviewer (and I use the word 'reviewer' loosely here) hilariously claims to have walked in, used his Superman vision to supposedly spot a family of offending microbes and (without trying the food) proceeded to sprint out because he was frightened of all the imagined cooties ... well...
35157 I just have to laugh.
35158 That's not a review, it's a drive-by, and reviewers like this are probably happier with Hometown Buffet or Luby's Cafeteria.
35159 And that's too bad because this is excellent fast food.
35160 I've eaten here maybe 15-20 times and my wife has ordered the fish taco plate a number of times and neither of us has ever gotten sick.
35161 The people at Senor Taco are nice, the food pleasantly surprises and your expectation of fast Mexican food will be forever changed for the better.
