35259 Just got back from my first visit to Adobe, and I am beyond impressed.
35260 My German Shepherd pup was having some stomach issues over the holidays, so I decided to have him checked out to be on the safe side.
35261 I knew he didn't have an obstruction or other emergency issue, but I was concerned about parasites.
35262 The receptionist, Hilary, was super sweet on the phone and in person.
35263 She was upfront with what tests she thought would be ordered, and how much it would run me (and it wasn't an arm and a leg; the office call was only $56).
35264 I was very happy they'd be able to see me the next morning, but then she called back not 20 minutes later with a cancellation and said to come on in.
35265 Even better!
35266 The tech was very good with Nately's 40 pounds of squirming, and loved on him the whole time.
35267 I was also happy they let me help hold him - I've been to vets that called in a 2nd tech, like the owners aren't capable of safely holding their own dog.
35268 Okay, maybe some aren't, but I am, and I appreciate being able to and not being instructed like a child.
35269 Dr. Newland was AWESOME.
35270 The difference between him and some other vets I've been to?
35271 - Other vets: "Oh my God, we need to run $500 worth of expensive tests and start him on multiple medications", general sense of admonishment for not rushing him to their affiliated ER clinic, eagerness to run the bill up, very few questions about anything, etc...
35272 -Dr. Newland:  Super calm and personable.
35273 He spent 20 minutes going over everything (Nately's last few days of activity and stomach issues, diet, contact with other dogs, where I take him in public, anything he could think of really), felt his abdomen thoroughly, and said "Honestly, he's a puppy, they eat funny things, and something probably just irritated his stomach.
35274 He's plainly feeling pretty good, so just feed him a bland diet, give him this medication to settle his stomach, and bring a stool sample just in case, so you know for sure he's parasite-free".
35275 He also dispensed advice for Nately's general care, as long as we were there, about heartworm prevention and  necessary vaccines, etc.
35276 I even got a good education on the different types of parasites and which were even likely in AZ's climate (turns out, not many).
35277 I really appreciated that he didn't try to frighten me into expensive diagnostics and possible serious diseases, and that he is so on his game and scientific/logical about things.
35278 I am very impressed and will be making Adobe my regular vet for as long as possible.

35407 I now have a sixth Sens for delicious Asian tapas- a genre I never knew existed.
35408 I always assumed the best tapas disappeared when Aaron May sauteed Sol Y Sombra's last batch of butter-marinated brussels sprouts!
35409 Well, I was proven wrong when I hit up the ultra-cool Sens Asian Tapas & Sake on a Thursday night.
35410 Guests are greeted by electric blue lights, neon pink lotus blossom light fixtures and fresh beats courtesy of a hipster DJ, which transport the hungry to an intoxicating, fluorescent experiens filled with sauces, sakes, and spicy flavors they probably don't even know about yet.
35411 I tried three top-notch items:
35412 Wasabi Tofu- Hot, in every Sens of the word.
35413 Wasabi and 300-degree tempura crusties have the ability to burn you to your soul if you aren't careful.
35414 Don't skip it, just poke it with a chopstick or blow on it first.
35415 White Peach Juice and Vodka- Just like Japanese candy exchange students brought home in high school, it's one of those miraculous flavors most Americans will never have the opportunity to try.
35416 Light and sweet, but not overly so, it's a perfect blend you can sip all.night.long.
35417 (I did!)
35418 The best, by far, is the Hot & Sour Soup.
35419 It's nothing like the kind you get for .99 at Chinese restaurants as an appetizer.
35420 A Bilbo Baggins-ey cauldron arrives with a wooden ladle- among the various veggies and disc-shaped noodles is your choice of meat- I chose clams.
35421 I've always heard you can truly tell how talented a chef is by how tasty his soup is, and would have to agree.
35422 There's nothing to hide behind, and you're confronted by pure flavor.
35423 It was complex, different and mouthwatering.
35424 The whole Sens-ation was so genius, I even got past the embarrassment of Chef Johnny Chu snorting in my face for taking pics of my meal on my iPhone.

35436 So I scored two dresses originally totaled for $160 for $60.
35437 Sounds like a good deal to me.
35438 I wish they had more colors, except that would have been bad for my credit card cause I am sure I would have ended up buying them all.

35502 I have been to every ballpark in the Cactus League and know my way around them all.
35503 This is, by far, the best facility in all of Spring Training (that includes the Florida parks).
35504 Granted, I am a Dodger fan and we get it better than the 'Sox fans do, but it is still amazing.
35505 Camelback Ranch is the brand new, state of the art, spring training facility for the Dodgers and White Sox.
35506 The Sox moved from Tucson because Tucson is the literally SO bad that even people from CHICAGO won't stay there.
35507 The park is located just south of the Glendale Airport and pretty much only has one way in or out - 111th Ave.  You can avoid Camelback Rd by taking Indian School to 111th and then just drive into the stadium.
35508 The grounds feature 13 practice fields and a giant lake and river that also help irrigate the fields.
35509 While the White Sox practice fields and clubhouse entry are blocked off from the public, the Dodgers' are wide open and inviting.
35510 Players must walk through the crowds during practices which invited lots of interaction with the fans.
35511 The field is beautiful and the layout of the stadium is quite impressive.
35512 Not only do they have a full Jumbotron but they also feature fully enclosed suites and a full buffet for those willing to shell out $90 per game.
35513 That price gets you seats behind home, access to unlimited food, wine, beer, soda, and sweets.
35514 It also gets you exclusive merchandise as well as cold towels to help you cool off.
35515 It sounds like a lot but it turns out to be worth the money.
35516 The grass seats have a great slope to them (much like Scottsdale) and the seat aisles are wide.
35517 The food selection is lacking without Dodger Dogs, however.
35518 The stadium is also missing the independent food vendors that Maryvale and Peoria feature.
35519 A great stadium and surely one to visit every March.
35520 I was introduced to SanTan Brewery two years ago on a very cold, winter evening.
35521 My cousin knew I would instantly fall in love with this place, simply because I just love fine craft beer.
35522 He was surely right because I visit SanTan three times a week because I simply cannot get enough of their beer selection.
35523 It's like an adventure every time I go.
35524 The staff is fantastic not because they're very nice and friendly, but they have the same passion and enthusiasm for fine craft as I do, so relating to them in that respect makes the experience fantastic.
35525 I normally do not engage in writing reviews on websites like this, simply because I personally tell the management team my best regards but I will for this because people really do need to experience the joys this brewery has to offer.
35526 SanTan is the new level of drinking and dining experience.
35527 It's relaxed, fun mature environment and you can start a conversation with anyone there.
35528 Enough reading this review, go try it out yourself.

35530 It's unrivaled and it maintains it's crown through constant improvements, expansions, and new stores.
35531 Empty stores are rare.
35532 Try that on for size, PV mall.
35533 The food court is decent, but a wide variety of restaurants surround the mall, providing the shopper with an endless amount of stores, and a great selection of places to eat.
35534 Scottsdale Fashion Square aims to please the most critical, and goes above and beyond all expectations.

35801 Say hello to the Ghost Lounge, folks.
35802 This is a brand new bar located right next to Seamus, within the San Carlos through an agreement with the hotel's ownership.
35803 For years, I've thought the Hotel San Carlos was an under-appreciated (through its own fault) downtown venue.
35804 With the Ghost, the owner has finally executed a plan to revive its rightful place on the downtown Phoenix scene.
35805 This is apparent from the first step inside the lobby, which appears as it did in 1928 when the hotel first opened.
35806 If celebrities in the 1930s had to spend the night in Phoenix, back then a small, un-airconditioned cowboy town with around 50,000, they would have stayed here.
35807 (Or else the near-by Westward Ho).
35808 You get a taste of those times with the massive photographic blow-ups the Ghost has put up on its walls of various scenes from early 20th century downtown Phoenix.
35809 So large that you can zero in on individual pedestrians on the streets, and marvel at their bowties, cowboy hats, handkerchiefs and facial expressions.
35810 Back then, the San Carlos was probably one of the only places in town that was "air-cooled."
35811 (That may have meant it had swamp coolers.
35812 I haven't googled the history of air conditioning technology for this review.)
35813 I'd describe the bar's style as grandiose, and classic old school Phoenix with an obligatory hint of Chicago (obligatory given the decades-old economic relationship betweeen the two cities that endures to this day).
35814 It has been beautifully done.
35815 I will be back often.
35816 Saigon Pho doesn't have a fancy sign, great decor or even windows you can look in/out of.
35817 But who cares when you have the most amazing Pho in the valley (and at the best prices)?
35818 The servings are very big and everything averages about $6 a plate.
35819 Staff is very attentive and quick to deliver the goods.
35820 As you can read through the various other reviews - everyone has a favorite dish.
35821 I have a problem with gluttony so I can't suggest a single dish - I can only suggest them all.
35822 However, this place also has some of the best Salt and Pepper calamari I've ever had.
35823 Great staff without an attitude (which is rare in Scottsdale).
35824 As I was waiting for my party to arrive, I was sitting outside drinking my beer and eating my food.
35825 Without ANY questions and/or hassle, my bill was transferred inside when my party arrived.
35826 Not only that, but our waiter remember exactly what I had and was able to split it without me even asking him to do so.
35827 OK, how great is that?
35828 I am totally sold on the service there an  I will definitely come back.
35829 Very nice unpretentious place.

35865 I went with my Grandma and Aunt on a Thursday afternoon.
35866 The weather was great but just a tad windy so we sat inside.
35867 First I like the layout of this place, very open and airy.

35872 The second time we ordered 3 small plates to share, ahi tacos, artichoke and spinach dip and the mussels.
35873 All three were heavenly and very reasonably priced.
35874 The ahi was fresh and chilled, perfect for a warm day.
35875 The artichoke dip was different than any I have had before, gooey cheesy goodness that we gobbled up practically licking the bowl.
35876 The chips that accompanied the did were fresh and perfectly salted, even when the dip was done we still polished off the chips.
35877 The mussels were in a perfect white wine sauce but the stars of this dish were the mussels themselves.
35878 Buttery and melt in your mouth good, not chewy at all with no grit, to most common problem I find.
35879 The broth was so good I let the bread marinate at the bottom of the bowl, soaking up the juice.
35880 My martini was a generous pour and even though they were out of blue cheese stuff olives the bartender took the time to stuff some and deliver it to our table.
35881 Now on to the staff, all are a good looking lot but they are also skilled.
35882 All of our food and drinks were delivered in a timely manner by our lovely server Jennifer.
35883 We also met one of the sous chefs, Lennie.
35884 A charming fellow with stunning blue eyes, my grandmother remarked on them, a playful Mohawk and tattoos peaking out of his uniform.
35885 He swears that the sweet potato fries are some of the best in town and sent over a complimentary bucket.
35886 I do believe he is right, cooked to perfection, slightly crisp on the outside, warm and soft on the inside dusted with fresh herbs and I believe Parmesan cheese.

36141 I have two friends who were constantly bantering about bingsoo and this Fresco place.
36142 I was excited when I found out it was so close to my house.
36143 If you've never heard of it, this is how it goes down.
36144 It's a layer of shaved ice, then you have your choice of ice cream or FF frozen yogurt, your choice of fresh fruit off the menu (apples, strawberry, mango, banana kiwi and many others) and then your choice of "sauce" which is a fruit puree of either strawberry, kiwi or mango and honey.
36145 You mix it all together and there you have it.
36146 A somewhat healthy dessert!
36147 They even have a frequent bingsoo buyers card =)
36148 This place isn't just all about the bingsoo though.
36149 They have a menu of fresh sandwiches and fruit juices too!

36435 I'm giving Bobby Q an extra star in this update to my previous review, because although it has its share of hits and misses, it is, in fact, as good as it gets in Phoenix for great barbecue.
36436 I love barbecue.
36437 It is a hobby of mine.
36438 When I get stuck on something and want to know what it should look and taste like, I go to Bobby Q and am almost never disappointed.
36439 Most recently, this happened with beef brisket.
36440 I'm going to upload a picture I took of Bobby Q's brisket because seriously, if you look at it and don't want to immediately die from desire, then you just don't like barbecue.
36441 If I had anything bad at all to say about Bobby Q, it would be that sometimes their meats can be slightly overdone but this is not the norm.
36442 Their quality control, considering how much food they must serve to keep up with the demand, is astounding.
36443 Their prices are too high, but of course, you're paying for the almost Disney-esque atmosphere.
36444 Their sauce is absolutely delicious (although it should be noted: they don't understand what "spicy" means).
36445 All in all I really can't say enough good things about this place.

36492 As a bonafide recovering Art Bitch, I give this university gallery the blue ribbon award for kickassery!

36497 This is one excellent Ethiopian restaurant, rivals anything I've sampled in Washington DC or Seattle.
36498 If I lived in Phoenix, this would be a Top-5 restaurant for me (along with Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - yum!
36499 ).
36500 Lalibela takes a slightly different approach to their menu.
36501 Many of the entrees are offered as small portions ($4.50-$6.00 each).
36502 They suggest each diner order 2-3 of these to make a meal.
36503 Kitfo and Lamb Tibs dishes are offered as full entrees and like many Ethiopian restaurants, you can order combo plates (meat combo, veggie combo, house combo plate etc.).
36504 This made deciding on our meal a little more complicated, but also offered more flexibility for sampling different dishes.
36505 Our favorite dish ordered was the Lamb Tibs (the spicy version with Awaze spice paste).
36506 Lamb was soooo tender, and the spices were a delight - rich in flavor but not too hot for those with tame palettes.
36507 Good thing it comes as a full order - four of us were competing for bites!!
36508 We ordered a half portion of Keye Wott (beef in a spicy brown sauce) that was some of the best I've ever had.
36509 Again, rich in flavor but not too spicy.
36510 My favorite Ethiopian meat dish is Kitfo - choice beef sort of like steak tartar (servered raw or lightly cooked) but with Ethiopian spices.
36511 Lalibela's was pretty good, just not transcendent like the Lamb Tibs or Beef Keye Wott.
36512 The vegetable dishes were on a whole excellent - especially the yellow lentils, gomen (collard greens) and spicy (Wott) lentils.
36513 Staff was great - attentive, helpful service.
36514 Unlike some Ethiopian restaurants, this one is very user-friendly.
36515 Although in some cases  the menu accommodates American tastes it doesn't compromise on quality or authenticity.
36516 One note on the injera (sponge-like bread used to scoop up the entrees) - it's a mix of wheat flour and teff (a grain indigenous to Ethiopia) and I don't think it's fermented like injera that is made with 100% teff.
36517 I'm used to the latter, but you can argue Lalibela's injera doesn't compete with the flavor of the entrees as much.
36518 All in all, one of the best Ethiopian restaurants I've been to, and I have been to many in the States.
36519 Only problem now is whether my favorite Ethiopian restaurants in Seattle will still taste as good!
36520 Highly, highly recommended.
36521 When I moved away, these were the tacos that I missed!
36522 I stopped back today, and must say - it was exactly how I remembered!
36523 The lunch specials are very reasonably priced at $5.99 and come with two items and rice and beans.
36524 I always get the hard taco - seasoned shredded beef, lettuce, and cheese in a deep fried corn tortilla - and the cheese enchilada.
36525 I could eat the rice and beans alone, both are so well seasoned and they definitely don't skimp on the cheese!
36526 The only thing to watch is that the red hot sauce can vary from visit to visit - some days it's super hot, others - not so much.
36527 The wait staff is exceptionally friendly and always try to help me because my Spanish is so limited.
36528 The interior is large but very modest, there aren't a lot of fancy decorations - this is a place to come for the food and service and  not th ambiance.
36529 Still, one of my faves!
36530 Great place for Sushi, ordered the Musscles ( Caution very large order even with only four) Great wine.
36531 Ordered Eel Crunch Roll, Tuna Roll, Soft Shell Crab Roll.
36532 All of it was to die for.
36533 A little Gem.
36534 Pricing is competitive not high or low.
36535 Environment is pleasant, service was wonderful and waitress was very helpful with suggestions and information.
36536 Been here twice now and tried two different dogs and two sides.
36537 Nothing was disappointing.

36855 Having a father who grew up on Los Olivos I remained a loyal customer, that is, until last evening's change in plans lured me to the colorfully lit and lively patio of Los Sombreros Authentic Mexican Cafe & Cantina.
36856 I am not an expert on "authentic" Mexican cuisine nor will I pretend to know what  the flavors of San Miguel de Allende taste like; however, I am a foodie so I know good food when I eat it.
36857 We chose to sit outdoor and enjoy the beautiful weather while taking in another Cardinal's loss!
36858 (Sad, I know, since they were off to a great start)....  Lucky for us it was a calm Monday night and we had the full attention of our waiter, aka the bartender.
36859 Phil (no need to blush if you read this) did a wonderful job walking us through their many margarita selections while also conveying his personal favorites that showcased his love for whiskey!
36860 My friend allowed Phil to make his margarita as he felt a fine margarita should be made while I allowed Phil to concoct my special margarita while following strict no sugar, no salt, heavy on the tequila preferences...and that was just to start!
36861 Perfectly crafted margaritas in hand, check.
36862 Now what to eat for dinner.
36863 My friend ordered his beloved Mole poblano ($18.95) while I couldn't decide between the Smoked chicken enchiladas with salsa verde and chipotle crema (yumm) and the Pollo a la parilla with spinach in a chipotle cream sauce -or- tinga Poblana sauce($18.95).
36864 I opted for the Pollo a la parilla with chipotle cream preparation and, once again, my dinner friend had 'order envy'!!
36865 That's not to say his Mole was par (or dare I say sub-par) because it wasn't - it actually has received many culinary awards being named "Best Mole" both locally and nationally, but because the chipotle cream sauce combined with spinach, perfectly sautéed  chicken breasts and a side of warm corn tortilla is....AMAZZZZZZING!!!!
36866 It's also fair that I note aside from the pricier entree dishes served w two sides (as we ordered), they also offer up tacos (3 at $10.95), various quesadillas (@ $5.95) and other lesser priced authentic eats including fresh guacamole, salads and more!
36867 Deciding I'd save room to see if they could satisfy my sweet tooth I boxed my remaining dinner as we read through each and every dessert.
36868 Undecided, again, and so we trusted our gastronomy guide, Phil, to choose.
36869 He selected the Mexican Chocolate Cream Pie to finish off the evening, and we happily finished off this delectable treat leaving one bite as I always like to do!!

36936 I have yet to find a better americano.
36937 A splash of cream and a splenda only augments the flavor of the espresso and the richness really shines.
36938 I've been to most of the independent coffee shops throughout the area, and if I do find myself elsewhere, I can only compare them to Lola, and Lola wins out each time.
36939 I'm not normally one to jump at reviewing a chain restaurant, especially when there are 3 subways all within a couple blocks of each other.
36940 I felt it was necessary in this case.
36941 My husband and I came here over the weekend after a lovely trip to the dog park.
36942 The two guys working here on the lonely afternoon were awesome.
36943 They were really nice and friendly, and quite chatty.
36944 One of them started helping my husband and the other one was sweeping while I was deciding.
36945 The sweeping boy apparently noticed I was ready and he quickly ran to the back, washed his hands, threw on gloves and asked me what I wanted.
36946 WOW!
36947 This type of service has never happened at the other locations, all of which I have been too.
36948 He chatted with me as I told him what I wanted.
36949 He also joked about my weird sandwich and made me laugh.
36950 It's refreshing to see a couple guys working on a boring day and actually enjoying themselves.
36951 They also have outdoor seating which are perfect to sit at and people watch on beautiful days.
36952 We even met this incredible 90 year old guy who is blind and deaf in both ears but somehow managed to communicate with us perfectly.
36953 He was much more lively than most twenty-somethings you meet.
36954 Amazing.
36955 Only in downtown do you meet people like that.
36956 This is a great Subway.
36957 Go here and skip the others.
36958 Let's see...what is there NOT to like about Surprise Stadium?
36959 Well, $9.50 tall cans of PBR is about all I could come up with and that's not a surprise (pun intended) considering you're attending a sporting event...even spring training.
36960 But as someone who does not living in Arizona, and as someone who doesn't go to MLB baseball games in Southern California due to the fact it costs so damn much, people bitching about the slow service or any other little inconvenience when it comes to seeing a game here.
36961 Look, you're lucky enough to have almost an entire month of low cost MLB baseball right in your back yard.
36962 If I could, I'd live down here during March just to take in the awesome baseball action that crisscrosses the Phoenix metro area each year.
36963 I attended my first spring training game on March 12th, 2012 at Surprise Stadium as the Royals took on the San Francisco Giants (my favorite team).
36964 Our seats (Sec.
36965 112, Row J, Seats 13-14-15) were 25 bucks each (around 30 bucks including service fees).
36966 I mean, we were maybe 5 or 6 rows back from the Giants dugout (check out some of my pictures).
36967 The stadium (funny calling it that since it only holds just over 10,000 people) is big enough so you feel you're at an MLB game but small enough to feel pretty close and intimate with the players.
36968 The stadium is well maintained and kept super clean.
36969 Arriving to the park, I was surprised (pun unintended) to see that parking was free, an oddity when going to an event like this.
36970 The stadium staff, as mentioned by other reviews, are mainly made up of senior citizens who were super friendly and helpful.
36971 I didn't have to wait long at the concession stands, even if lines were a bit long.
36972 The outfield is lined with a lawn area, perfect for people to sit back and have a picnic while taking in a game (Tickets are around 9 bucks each after service fees!!!
36973 ).
36974 I love this place and hope to return next year when visiting family.
36975 Oh, Giants won 2-1!
36976 Go Giants!!
36977 !
36978 4-5 locations.. all 4.5 star average..
36979 I think Arizona really has some fantastic Pizza options, and Spinatos is at the top of my pizza fix list.. the semi sweet sauce is addictive, great service, fresh ingredients, The Spicy Italian is my favorite...
36980 The chocolate chips cookies are laced with mind altering drugs, that make your body parts"romantic" when you think of their cookies.. BTW 5:30pm, on a Tuesday, when we left, a 30 minute wait.. Its on the List..
